loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 38 years old and married is Fredrick, who is a businessman, and they have three children aged fourteen, twelve and three years old. Judith sells cereals in Kapsabet trading center and has been in the business for a period of eighteen years, earning a monthly income of about $163.

She has borrowed 30,000 KES from KADET, and this is her first loan. She hopes to spent the money to purchase dry maize and beans for resale. The anticipated profits will be used to purchase a plot for her family and also to educate her children.

Her dream is to own a retail shop and also be financially stable.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for the business; i.e. maize and beans.

loans.name: Dianne Eve

texts.en:
Dianne Eve is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single with 1 child. 

Dianne Eve is making and selling homemade sausage or longganisa. She has had this business for 2 years. She requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients needed for making homemade sausage. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. 

In the future, Dianne Eve hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making homemade sausage

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is 43 years old and lives in Fatima, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with 3 children. 

To earn a living, Annie has a restaurant business. She earns about 8,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. Annie has a requested a loan to purchase food and drinks for her restaurant. Annie has been a member of PMPC for 1 year.

loans.use: to purchase food and drinks for her restaurant business

loans.name: Rojasse

texts.pt:
Nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Provincia do mesmo nome ao sul de Moçambique é casado e pai de 3 filhos, de idades entre 2 anos a 12 anos. Fez 4a classe e parou por falta de condiçoes financeiras. vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta a sua mãe enviando dinheiro para ajudar nas despesas alimentares.   
saiu de Maputo para Massaca em Boane quando obteve o seu terreno, onde fixou sua residencia. Tem um negocio proprio de venda de produtos de primeira necessidade ha mais de 2 anos onde consegue um rendimento de cerca de 4.000.00mt  por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e consegue poupar algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca fez emprestimos noutros bancos, Conheceu Hluvuku atravez do cunhado que tambem é cliente desta instituiçao e este é o seu primeiro emprestimo no valor de 10.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar mercadoria (arroz, amendoim, açucar e outros) para aumentar a quantidade  no seu estabelecimento.
o seu sonho e concluir a sua obra e ampliar o seu negocio, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Born in Maputo city,  in the province of the same name, in southern Mozambique, he is married with three children, ages 2 years to 12 years. He stopped his own schooling in the 4th grade due to lack of money.  He lives in his own home with his family and also supports his mother by sending money to help her pay for food.

He left Maputo for Massaca in Boane when he obtained his land, where his build his home.  He has a business selling staple household products for over 2 years now that provides earnings of about 4.000.00mt a month which he applies to household expenses and can still manage to save some in his personal bank account.

He has never borrowed from other banks.  He heard of the Hluvuku agency through his brother who also is a loan recipient of this institution.  This is his first loan in the amount of 10.000.00mt with which he will buy goods (rice, peanuts, sugar and others) to increase the amount of inventory in his business.  

His dream and to finish his home construction and expand his business for which he intends to seek further loans from the Hluvuku agency.

loans.use: comprar  e venda de mercadoria (arroz, amendoim, açucar e outros)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more clothes that will be sold to customers

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is 30 years old, married to Caroline and supports three members of his family. He operates a mini-shop in Kapsabet trading center and has been in the business for a period of 5 years, earning a monthly income of 3,000 KES.

He has borrowed a loan from KADET of 30,000 KES. This is his second loan after successfully repaying his previous loan. He hopes to use the money to purchase stock like cereals, sugar, cooking oil, and cooking flour among other things for the shop. The profits will be used to improve business stock and also improve the welfare of his family.

His dream is to prosper in his business.

loans.use: to purchase stock like cereals, sugar, cooking oil, and cooking flour among other things for the shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more new shoes for his business

loans.name: Kheng

texts.en: Mrs. Kheng, a resident of Kompong Chhnang Province for many years, sews nets that she sells to neighbors and other villagers who need to protect their cows or other domestic animals from mosquitoes. Operating this business since 2008, she earns an income of around $3.5 each day to meet her family's daily expenses. She also has a life partner in her husband who plants fruits to earn more profit. They have one daughter working as a garment factory worker who shares her salary with them, while other three children are not yet attending school. Mrs. Kheng will use the loan she is requesting to buy more nets to sew for additional profit.

loans.use: to buy more nets to sew and sell.

loans.name: Mario Salomao

texts.pt:
Natural de Gaza, Provincia de Gaza ao sul de Mocambique casado e pai de 3 filhos,de idades entre 2  a 11 anos de idade os mais velhos vao a escola. Fez 7a classe e parou por falta de condiçoes financeiras. vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta os irmaos enviando dinheiro para ajudar nas despesas alimentares.   
saiu de Gaza para Maputo a procura de emprego e melhores condições de vida. Trabalha na empresa caminhos de ferro de Moçambique ha mais de 7 anos e tem um salario de 3.880.00mt  por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca fez emprestimos noutros bancos, Conheceu Hluvuku atravez do colega que tambem e cliente desta instituiçao. Este é o seu segundo emprestimo no valor de 10.500.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, areia, pedra e outros) para aumentar a sua residencia.
Esta confiante que vai pagar sem dificuldades, pretende concluir a sua obra e iniciar um negocio, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos.
texts.en:
Mario is from Gaza in the province of Gazo in southern Mozambique.  He is the father of 3 children who range in age from 2 to 11.  The oldest 2 are in school.  He studied through seventh grade but did not continue due to the lack of financial resources.  He lives in his own home with his family and also supports his siblings by sending them money to help with their food costs.

He left Gaza for Maputo in search of employment and better living conditions.  He has worked at the railroad comapny of Mozambique for more than 7 years and makes 3,800 meticals per month, which he puts towards his home's expenses and also saves some in his bank account.

He has never has a loan with another bank.  He became familiar with Hluvuku through a colleague that is also a client of our institution.  This is his second loan in the amount of 10,500 meticals, which he will use to buy construction materials (cement, sand, rocks, etc.) to expand his home.

He is confident that he will pay back his loan without any difficulty.  He wants to finish the work on his home and start a business, for which he is planning to request more loans.

loans.use: To buy construction materials (cement, sand, rocks, etc.)

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 

Marilyn has a restaurant that serves a variety of dishes. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients used to prepare the dishes she serves. Marilyn is a new member of HSPFI.  

In the future, Marilyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for cooking a variety of dishes

loans.name: Roseh

texts.en:
Roseh is 33 years old and married to Boniface, who is a farmer and supports five people. Her children are aged  thirteen, ten, six and four years old. She operates a retail shop in Denja trading centre and has been in the business for two years, earning a monthly income of KES 4,000.

She has received a loan from KADET of KES.35,000 This is her second loan, after she successfully repaid the previous loan. She hopes to use the amount to purchase stock like cereals, sugar, flour, cooking oil, soaps etc. for her shop and the anticipated profit to invest it back to the business by restocking her shop.

Roseh hopes to open another shop and also improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To purchase business stock  like cereals, sugar, flour, cooking oil, soaps etc.

loans.name: Xavier

texts.pt:
Natural de Montepuez, Provincia de Cabo Delgado ao norte de Mocambique casado pai de 4 filhos de idades entre 2 anos a 20 anos de idade. Fez 7a classe e parou quando foi incorporado ao serviço  militar obrigatorio. vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta o seu cunhado que vive com ele.   
Saiu de Montepuez para Maputo quando terminou a guerra, actualmente trabalha como segurança numa empresa ha mais de 12 anos onde consegue um salario de 4.000.00mt  por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e tem poupado algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca fez emprestimos noutros bancos, Conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de amigos que tambem sao clientes desta instituiçao e este é o seu quinto emprestimo no valor de 8.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar electrodomesticos ( televisor, aparelhagem, sonora e outros) para a sua casa.
o seu sonho e ampliar a sua casa para garantir o conforto da sua familia, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Xavier is a native of Montepuez, Cabo Delgado Province in northern Mozambique. He is married and has four children between the ages of 2 and 20. Xavier finished seventh grade and stopped school when he began compulsory military service. He lives in his own house with his family and supports his brother-in-law, who lives with him.

He left Montepuez to come to Maputo when the war ended. Xavier currently works as a security officer for a company and has worked there for more than 12 years. He earns a salary of 4,000 meticais per month, which he uses for household expenses. He also saves some money in his bank account.

Xavier has never had loans from other banks. He learned about Hluvuku through friends who are customers of this institution, and this is his fifth loan. He is asking for 8,000 meticais, which he will use to buy home appliances (television, stereo and other items) for his house.

His dream is to expand his house to guarantee his family's comfort, and for this reason he intends to ask Hluvuku for more loans.

loans.use: to buy home appliances (television, stereo, etc.).

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 

Luz has a retail shop that sells vegetables and food seasonings. She has had this business for 5 years. She is a new member of HSPFI, and has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy additional vegetables to sell.  In the future, Luz hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 44 years old and married to David, a farmer.  The couple supports a family of five.  Christine buys and sell milk in Kipture trading centre.  She has been in the business for  two years, earning a monthly income of KES 8,000.

She has taken a loan of KES 20,000 from KADET LTD.  This is her first loan term.  Christine wishes to use the money to purchase more gallons of milk for resale.  

The anticipated profits will be used to improve the quantity of milk she buys from farmers for resale.  Her hope is to prosper in her business.

loans.use: To buy milk and pay the suppliers

loans.name: Yolita

texts.en: Yolita is married with 4 children.  She is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. Yolita is a farmer and raises livestock to earn a living. She has been doing this for 2 years. She has requested a loan to purchase livestock feed.  Yolita has been a member of PMPC for 4 years.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
This is Elsie, 49, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Domingo, a caddy, and is a mother. The couple works hard for a safe and secure future for their family.

Elsie operates a piggery. She raises hogs and then sells them to the immediate community. She has patrons who buy either the whole hog or just a part of it. She also supplies the meat to various market stalls. There are many patrons who prefer Elsie’s products because they are assured of freshness and cleanliness.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 383 in sales every day.

To help her continue business operations, she is requesting a PHP 13,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy piglets to raise and livestock feed. She expects a boost in income as she expands her business.  

Elsie hopes that her business will continue to be successful, just as she fervently hopes that her children will be able to graduate one day, and be finished with their studies. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and she draws strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for feed and new piglets that she will raise

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 44-year-old married mother of four children. Mary runs a tailoring business in Kisauni, Mombasa.  Her business has been in operation for the last nine years. 

Mary has been a KADET LTD client and this marks her second loan to finance her business. With this loan, she plans to purchase a sewing machine and cloth. 

She will use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and to support her family.

Her dream is to own a boutique where she sells tailor-made clothes.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine and cloth

loans.name: Fayza

texts.en:
Fayza is a 44-year-old married woman and the mother of one child. Fayza has owned a grocery store in Ain since 15 years ago.

Fayza is a smart, hard worker; she opened her shop next to a school where she can benefit the whole school season from students and parents buying their goods from her shop. In addition to students and parents, most of her customers are relatives, neighbors and friends.

Fayza is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua for the first time in order to increase her shop's capital through summer beverages and ice cream. The summer season is also a good season for Fayza since most of Ain's population comes back from Beirut to enjoy their summer vacation.

Fayza hopes to stay healthy and continue working and expanding her business.

loans.use: to increase her shop's capital through summer beverages and ice cream.

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 28 years old, married and has two children.

Khaled is a carpenter. In 2005, he opened his own workshop. He has much experience, a good reputation and is well known in his area.

He is requesting a $2,000 loan to buy a diesel generator for his workshop. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To buy a diesel generator for his workshop.

loans.name: Madelyn

texts.en:
Madelyn is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. 

Madelyn is peddling ready-to-wear t-shirts, blouses and underwear. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippines pesos to buy additional t-shirts and blouses.

Madelyn is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Madelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional t-shirts and blouses.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David, aged 37, is married to Helen. They are blessed with one child, aged 1 year. David sells curios, which he has been doing for 21 years. The business earns him a monthly income of 25,500 Kenyan shillings.

This is his first loan term with KADET LTD. He will use the loan funds to buy more curios for sale.

David hopes to be one of the international curio exporters in the future.

loans.use: to buy curios.

loans.name: Clarice

texts.en:
Clarice is a 34-year-old married mother of three children. Clarice runs a food cafe in Kilifi, and her business has been in operation for the past seven years with good returns.
 
Clarice has been a KADET client, and this marks her seventh borrowing to finance her business. With this loan, she plans to purchase more stock of foodstuffs, like vegetables for cooking in the hotel, and to refurbish her cafe. The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan, and her future dream is to own a bigger and better restaurant where she can serve more clients.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of foodstuffs and to refurbish her cafe.

loans.name: Reuben

texts.en:
Reuben is a 29-year-old married man. He is in the transport sector in Magongo, Mombasa. He also sells GNLD supplement products. His business has been in operation for one year and has been a success. 

He has been a KADET LTD client and this marks his fourth borrowing to finance his business. With this loan, he plans to purchase more stock of GNLD supplement products.

The anticipated profits will be used to repay back the loan and to gradually expand his business.

Reuben's dream is to become prosperous and to be able to sustain his family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of GNLD supplement products

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is married with two children. Elizabeth is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. Elizabeth is a farmer and raises different livestock to earn a living. She has been doing this just this year. She has requested a loan to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Elizabeth has been a member of PMPC just this year.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a 37-year-old single mother of three children. Christine runs a beauty salon in Mombasa and her business has been in operation for the last eight years. 

Christine has been a KADET client and this marks her first loan to finance her business. With this loan, she plans to add more stock of cosmetics and hair products for use in her salon. Some of the anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and some will be saved for future use. 

Christine’s dream is to relocate her beauty salon into a bigger business premise and thus attend to more clients.

loans.use: To add more stock of cosmetics and hair products

loans.name: Leonilo

texts.en: Leonilo is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with three children. Leonilo has a vegetable garden and sells a variety of vegetables. He has had this business for 10 years. He requested a loan for 5,000 Philippine pesos to buy fertilizers for his vegetable garden. Leonilo is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Leonilo hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for a vegetable garden.

loans.name: Isenzesihle Group

texts.en:
Sindisiwe is 54 years old and married with eight children between the ages of 32 and 40. She takes care of her two grandchildren and they both attend school. She runs a retail business in Kwa Zulu Natal of Empangeni in South Africa. In the photo, she is pictured raising her hand. 
 
She has been in business for six years selling traditional mates and bananas at her home. She also receives income from a government child support grant.  Sindisiwe requested this loan through WDB and Kiva to buy flowers and vegetables to increase her stock.  She says the main challenge she faces in her business is her bananas because she cannot keep them for more than a week. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her improve her life and her family. In the future, she would like to grow her business.

loans.use: To buy flowers and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen is a widow and spends her time at home managing household chores and taking care of the cattle. Her husband was involved in a livestock business but after his death, her eldest son took it over and started a dairy business. Presently, they have three buffalos at home, which has become a source of income for them.   

Nasreen has given birth to two sons and two daughters. Nasreen’s remaining children are enrolled in a local school and getting their education. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her son who wants to buy another buffalo to improve his dairy business. This will help him sell a larger quantity of milk to different milk shops and earn better profits. Nasreen is hopeful that after investing the loan money in her son’s business, he will be able to earn more income and Nasreen will be in a position to get him married soon. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. In the previous loan year, she established a good credit record and never missed any meeting. 
 
Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Nasreen.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo

loans.name: Viilma

texts.en:
This is Vilma, 48, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Diomedes, a policeman, and mother to her children. At this time, she is working hard continually to provide income for their everyday expenses

Vilma operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings when all of the family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but also a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one or two persons when buying cooked rice and viands cost less than raw food. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Aside from the food stall, she has a variety store. She earns a minimum of PHP 1466 in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 17,000 loan. She will be using the loan to have her stall renovated and buy a freezer. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 
 
Vilma dreams of being able to give all her children a good, high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She also hopes to open a branch of her food stall. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to renovate her stall and buy a freezer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy flour, cooking oil, sugar and milk

loans.name: Carmela

texts.en:
Carmela is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Carmela has a retail shop that sells rice by the kilogram. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy sacks of rice per kilogram.

Carmela is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Carmela hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cultivate his land, transplant seedlings, hire laborers and pay for water

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Ester is 58 years old, married, and has two children. She has been selling charcoal fuel for the last 10 years. Ester intends to use her loan to purchase more charcoal that she plans to resell.  

Ester plans to use the profit she makes from her business to expand her existing business. In the future, she hopes to become a wholesaler of charcoal. Ester describes herself as innovative.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Winefredo

texts.en:
Winefredo is married with eight children. Winefredo is 59 years old and lives in Lawaan, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte.

Winefredo sells different products in his general store to earn a living and has had this business for 20 years. Each month, he earns PHP 10,000 doing this type of work. He has requested a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase more products such as canned goods, dry goods and anything that is needed in the household.

 Winefredo has been a member of PMPC just this year.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, dry goods and household products to sell

loans.name: Sut

texts.en: Mrs. Sut, 34, is married to a casual worker and resides in Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham Province where she provides sewing services to villagers for both modern and traditional styles at reasonable prices. The owner of a small kiosk, sewing machine and other tooling materials, Sut is admired by her clients for the good service she provides.  In business since 2007, she makes around $3 of profit per day. Sut will be using her loan to purchase zinc to cover the roof of her house and to pay for construction costs.

loans.use: to purchase zinc to cover the roof of her house and to pay for construction costs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase wheat seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for Installing tiles and kitchen windows.

loans.name: Carmencita

texts.en: Carmencita is 53 years old  and lives in the Philippines.  She is married and has 3 children.  Carmencita is a farmer and raises cows and goats to earn a living. She has been doing this for 2 years.   She joined PMPC this year.  Carmencita has requested a loan to purchase 4 sacks of feed.

loans.use: purchase livestock feed

loans.name: Toufic

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 45 years old, married and has three children.

In 2008 Toufic opened a food market, selling cheese, candies, juices, soft drinks,  daily use items and diary products. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. His store is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by. 

He is requesting $1500 loan to buy two showcases, a freezer and to make shelves for his market. He is optimistic about his business development and hopes that the coming years will continue to bring him positive growth.

loans.use: To buy two showcases, a freezer and to make shelves for his market.

loans.name: Sughran's Group

texts.en:
Sughran is a widow who sells buffalo milk to financially contribute to her family. She took over this business after the sudden death of her husband few years ago. Now she has 2 buffaloes. She takes care of these buffaloes, gives them timely food & water and sells their milk to her community clients. She has 5 sons. Two of them work in a factory. The next two attend school and are getting their education. Her youngest son is 7 years old and has not started attending school yet. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to buy another buffalo to expand her milk selling business. The additional buffalo will not only become an asset for her business but also increase her profits in future. 

She has many years of experience in her business and hopeful that an investment will bring positive changes to her business. Her elder son is 27 years old and she hopes that she will be able to marry him off in the near future with the help of increased profits. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 4th loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a  book (called Asasah Passbook) is Sughran.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for dairy business.

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.en:
Consuelo is 51 years old and is a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Melchor, who works with her in the business.  She is a mother of three children, all of whom are in college. By the grace of God, Consuelo has managed to support her children's schooling up to college level.  This has been dream for most poor Filipino parents like Consuelo, who believe that a college diploma is the best inheritance that parents can leave to their children.

Consuelo operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals in the evenings when all the family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but also a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands cost less than raw food.  Consuelo's regular customers are her neighbors and people in the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php1000 in sales every day.

To help her continue  the operations of her business, Consuelo is requesting a loan for Php13,000. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Consuelo dreams for her children to find a stable job after finishing college and also for her business to grow. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buy raw ingredients for her food stall

loans.name: Orlom

texts.en:
Orlom is 35 years old.  She lives with her husband and three children in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Uvs province in Mongolia. All her three children, age 7, 12 and 14, attend secondary school. 

Orlom manages a vegetable planting and trading business in her town with the help of her husband. She started her business in 2007 with 0.8 hectare of land in her possession. Now she plants and harvests all kinds of daily consumption vegetables such as potatoes, carrots, onions, cabbages, etc.   All three of her children help in the family business during their summer vacations. They harvest 3-4 tons of vegetables a year. 

Orlom contributes her earnings toward her family consumption. With her business profit, she has built a fence on her land.  She is planning to buy more land in order to increase her business sales.  

Orlom is a hardworking lady who says, "One must work hard in order to earn money for his living." She is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to purchase potato seeds for her business.

loans.use: purchase potato seeds

loans.name: Bachir

texts.en:
Bachir is a 39-year-old married man who is a father of one child.  He has been the owner of a chicken shop since 2008. 

Bachir's business is special since he sells freshly-slaughtered chickens, which most of his customers prefer since they don't trust other shops where the chickens were prepared for a long time in advance and might be poisonous. 

Bachir is a man with good communication skills and most of his clients like that about him. His family is his priority and he seeks the best for them.

Bachir is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua for the first time in order to increase the capital for his chicken business.  Increasing the number of chickens will increase his income.  With what is left, he will pay his car's bills.  Bachir hopes to expand in the future and open another branch if possible.

loans.use: buy more chickens

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 35 years old, married and has two children.

In 2000, Alaa opened his shop where he sells cars accessories and decorates wedding cars. He has more than ten years' experience and has a deep understanding of local consumer needs and he is well known in his area.

He is requesting a $1800 loan to make an advertising light box for his shop. He is optimistic about his business development and hopes that the coming years will continue to bring him positive growth.

loans.use: To make an advertising light box for his shop.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity 38 years old.  She is currently in the business of selling vegetables.  She is divorced and has six children, only two of whom go to school.  Her future goal is to increase her business.

loans.use: stock more vegetables

loans.name: Saodatkhon's Group

texts.en:
Saodatkhon, 42, is the leader of this group. In order to earn money to meet the family's needs, her husband went to work in Kazakhstan.  There are four children in their family: two sons and two daughters. The older son works in Kazakhstan with his dad and the other children study at school. 

Saodatkhon breeds cattle to contribute additional money to the family budget. At the moment she has a cow and a calf.  She earns an additional 2000 soms per month by selling milk. With money received from this loan, Saodatkhon wants to purchase more farm animals for breeding and further reselling. In the future, with the money gained from reselling cattle she plans to start repairing their house.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase farm animals for breeding

loans.name: Ek

texts.en: Ek, age 44, is a rice farmer who has been living in the Ornlong Veng District of Siem Reap Province. Her husband is employed in the public sector as a soldier and has a specific salary every month. They are blessed with two school-age children and are able to live under their income. With the rainy season coming now, Ek would like to request some funding in order to pay for plowing costs and to begin planting potato seeds. Ek hopes she will increase her income by using a Kiva loan.

loans.use: to pay for plowing costs and to begin planting potato seeds.

loans.name: Sugarragchaa

texts.en:
Sugarragchaa is 53 years old and lives with his wife and three children in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Uvs province in Mongolia. His younger two children, age 19 and 21, attend college while his older son helps with his business. 

Sugarragchaa manages a wood-product making business in his town. He started his business in 2004 and has gained much experience. Now he makes a variety of furniture such as tables, chairs and hangers, using a broad collection of designs. He has been able to stabilize his business and has built a strong customer base. His customers are happy with the quality and durability of his products. He always updates his equipment in order to sell  quality products to his customers.  He is planning to have small workshop in the future. 

With his earnings, Sugarragchaa is paying for his younger two children's educational cost. He is a hardworking and responsible businessman who says, "One has to be confident in his fate." He is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase wood for his business.

loans.use: purchase wood for his carpentry business

loans.name: Johnsthan

texts.en:
Johnsthan is a 51-year-old married man.  He runs a food café in Mshomoroni, Mombasa. His business has been in operation for five years and has been a success. 

Johnsthan has been a KADET LTD client and this marks his third loan to finance his business. With this loan, he plans to renovate his business premise.  The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and to gradually expand his business.

His dreams for the future is to become prosperous and to be able to sustain his family.

loans.use: renovate his business premise

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en: Rosie is 50 years old and lives in Antonino, Labason. She is married and has 2 children.  She works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for 2 years.  Rosie has requested a loan to purchase different kinds of fish.  She has been a member of PMPC just this year.

loans.use: purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a withdrawal machine for car chassis.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase wheat seeds and fertizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for eye operation expenses (cataract)

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en: Felisa is 59 years old and lives in Compra, Liloy. She is married with three children. Felisa has a dressmaking business and earns approximately 12,000 Philippines pesos each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to purchase one sewing machine. Felisa has been a member of PMPC for two years.

loans.use: to purchase one sewing machine.

loans.name: Loic

texts.en: Loic is a business men .she have 3 children on of the 2 are school goer.Her husband is a driver and part time look after her wife's business.

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase wheat seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Abatiganda No 6 Group

texts.fr: Emmanuel est  agri-éleveur né au Rwanda. Il est membre du groupe Abatiganda no 6. Il est marié, il  a 38 ans, il a 6 enfants entre 1 an et 10 ans et trois enfants vont à l’école,  il n’a aucunes personnes en charge. Il  a cinq  ans des études primaires. C’est son deuxième  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit pour acheter les engrais chimique et payer la main d’œuvre. Il n’a aucune difficulté attendue de non-remboursement de son prêt. Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’augmenter les champs en vue d’accroitre la production. Sa vision il voudrait devenir le grand producteur du riz. Pour sa famille il voudrait payer le frais du minerval pour ses enfants et les frais médicaux pour sa famille.
texts.en: Emmanuel is an agricultural producer born in Rwanda. He is a member of the Abatiganda No 6 group. He is 38 years old and married. He has 6 children between the ages of 1 and 10 of whom three attend school. He has no employees. He has completed five years of primary education. This is his second loan with ACB.He will use his credit to purchase chemical fertilizer and pay for labor. He does not expect any difficulties with the repayment of his loan. His strategy for the growth of his business is to increase the number of fields in order to increase his production. His ambition is to become a big rice producer. For his family he would like to pay the school fees for his children and medical expenses for his family.

loans.use: to purchase chemical fertiliser and pay for labor

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a 28-year-old, married mother of four children. She runs her cashew nut business in Kiwandani, Kilifi. The business has been in operation for the past four years. 

Josephine has been a KADET client, and this marks her second borrowing to finance her business. With this loan, she plans to purchase more stock of cashew nuts for her business. 

The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and start up another business.

Her dream is to become successful.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of cashew nuts.

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita is married with five children. Esterlita is 49 years old and lives in Timan, Liloy.

Esterlita sells different products from her general store to earn a living and has had this business for five years. Each month, she earns 3,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 6000 PHP to purchase more products for her general store.

Esterlita became a member of PMPC this year.

loans.use: to purchase more products for her general store.

loans.name: Rysbu

texts.en:
Rysbu is 50, married and has four children. She lives in the Kyrgyz southern city of Osh. Rysbu graduated from Pedagogical University and worked as a teacher at the local school. As it was difficult to cover all her household expenses on the low wage, and in order to find an additional means of subsistence for her family, Rysbu started her own business in reselling carpets. 

She worked hard and her activity started to bring permanent profit in the sum of 60.000 Kyrgyzstan soms (KGS) in a month, and the number of customers increased. 

But in June 2010, when violent clashes caused by a deposed political regime broke out in Osh city, Rysbu lost her business, which was robbed and looted. But Rysbu, being an optimistic and hardworking person, didn’t give up and decided to resume her lost business and continue activities. 

For this very reason, Rysbu is applying for a loan of 135,000 KGS, which she needs to restart her business. Despite the many difficulties along the way, Rysbu doesn’t look back and is ready to take a step forward to her future.

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to broaden her assortment of goods.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a large generator and to add more inventory to his market.

loans.name: Umuco I Group

texts.fr:
Astere est un commerçant âgé de 62ans qui habite au centre du pays dans la ville de Gitega. Il est membre  du groupe  communautaire« UMUCO». Il  fait le commerce du café et des avocats  depuis 20 ans et il est en même temps cultivateur. Il est divorce et n’a pas d’enfants. Il n’a  pas fréquenté l’école. 
Le crédit Kiva  de 200,000 francs burundais qu’il obtient lui permet d’augmenter son capital pour acheter de grandes quantités de café et des avocats à revendre afin de réaliser de grands bénéfices.
texts.en:
Astere is a 62 year-old merchant who lives in the country heartland, in the city of Gitega. He has been in the coffee and avocado trade for twenty years, while at the same time being a farmer. He is divorced with no kids. He didn't go to school.
The Kiva loan of 200,000 Burundi francs that he is getting allows him to increase his capital to purchase large quantities of coffee and avocados to retail for great profits.

He belongs to the community group "Umuco".

loans.use: to increase his capital to buy large quantities of coffee and avocado to retail and make great profits.

loans.name: Rabii

texts.en:
Rabii is a 36 years old married man who is the father of four children.  Rabii has been working for about 12 years fixing diesel engines and agricultural machines.

Rabii opened his own garage in 2007 because he prefers to be independent and make his own living.  He is a man with a good reputation and his business is very important in his region since most of its citizens are farmers.

Rabii is requesting his fifth loan from Al Majmoua in order to buy new machines for his business and to continue building his house's rooftop.  His previous loans helped a lot in improving his social and financial situations and he is a good standing borrower at the same time.  Rabii hopes to buy his own shop and stop paying rent to others in the future.

loans.use: To buy new improved machines for his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay the annual rent for his shop.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is a businessman and is 46 years old. He is married to Purity who is a housewife. They are blessed with three children. He has been a farmer and a retail shopkeeper for the past thirteen years with the monthly income of about $220 which he uses to support his family members.

He is applying for his third loan with KADET LTD, after repaying the previous loans successfully. Richard will use the loan to purchase farm supplies; i.e. farm manure and seedlings, and he will also purchase more stock for his retail shop; e.g. sugar, rice, flour etc.

He will use the anticipated profit to educate his children. 

His hope and dream is to concentrate on his children’s education and improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase farm manure, seedlings and more stock for his retail shop.

loans.name: Mach Trang-2-6 Group

texts.en:
Na, 27, is married with two children who are still young. Her husband is a worker. She is the leader of a five-member group loan from SEDA.

Na has been a tailor for two years, making clothes for everybody in her village. She also raises chickens and pigs. She has a monthly income of about 5,000,000 (VND).

This is the first time Na has taken a loan from SEDA. She would like to borrow 5,014,000 VND to buy food for her chickens.

About the other borrowers in her group:

Huong is 25 years old. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to invest in her clothes shop. Lien is 54 years old. He wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to promote his small business. Bay is 52 years old. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND. She buys and sells scrap. She wants to borrow 5.014.000 VND to promote her small business. V. is 27 years old. She wants to borrow 5,886,000 VND to expand her shop.

loans.use: to buy food for her chickens.

loans.name: Chhay

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhay is a widow and mother of a child who is young and living under her care. She was born and has been living in Ornlong Veng district in Siem Reap province.

Mrs. Chhay has been a farmer since she was married. They could make about $3 a day. She now lives with her old mother who has worked in a district office as part of the internal staff, and she is able to contribute additional income monthly.

Mrs. Chhay would like to request a loan in the amount of $1000 to buy potato seed for planting as well as pay for someone to plow her fields.

loans.use: to buy potato seed for planting as well as pay for someone to plow her fields.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a diesel generator and purchase additional inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Gyedie Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
Jacob is currently the group leader of the “Gyedie” Trust bank Group, made up of 5 members. Jacob is clearly a hard worker. He sells agro chemical materials like weed killers, pesticide and seedlings. He sells to local farmers.  He plans to use the loan to purchase additional agro chemicals to serve the local farmers. Jacob has sold agro chemicals for the past six years. He is also a hardworking farmer.

Jacob is married to a woman who is a service provider and together they have two children. He lives with his family in Berekum, in the northern part of Ghana. Above all, he hopes to create more savings to support his children in school. As the leader of the group, he ensures that all members attend meetings and submit their repayments.

loans.use: To purchase agro chemical materials in bulk.

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 33 years old, married and has three children.

Khaled has had a food market since 2009; he sells cheese, juices, bread, daily use items, and dairy products. He has a good reputation and he is well known in his area.

He is requesting a $2400 loan to buy a generator, a refrigerator and to make a ceiling for his market. He is aiming to earn more profit so he can improve his family’s quality of life

loans.use: To buy a generator, a refrigerator and to make a ceiling for his market.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow and poultry birds.

loans.name: Veneranda

texts.en:
Veneranda is married with 5 children. She is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is a farmer and grows corn and vegetable crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for 6 years. 

She has requested a loan to purchase 100 sq. meters of land to plant additional crops. She has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Veneranda hopes to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: To purchase 100 sq. meters of land to plant additional crops.

loans.name: Shamma

texts.en:
Shamma is a 54-year-old housewife and a mother of six; five of them are married and one is still single. 

Since Shamma is an illiterate woman she did not have a lot of options in how to support the family, so she helped her husband 3 years ago to open a small grocery store that sells most of the  goods in demand in the area such as canned vegetables  and powdered milk, etc.
 
Now Shamma is applying for a loan for more than one reason: she wants to provide the store with more goods as a preparation to welcome the holy month of Ramadan; to add a refrigerator for cooling goods; and to redecorate the store entrance. 
   
Since Shamma is a conservative person, her son appears in the photo instead of her.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator and goods for the grocery store and to redecorate the store entrance.

loans.name: Phoum

texts.en:
From Ornlong Veng district, Mrs. Phoum is a 45-year-old divorcee who lives with her children. She has a bridal shop where she helps women and men who are planning to get married.

Mrs. Phoum sells from her home, and she has a few assistants. Her business is running smoothly because she has good public relations skills.

But she also faces a problem: her shop is now too old and unattractive to her customers. To solve this, Mrs. Phoum would like to request a loan to be used to decorate her shop which will potentially allow her to add new customers to her clientele.

loans.use: to decorate her shop.

loans.name: Sughran's Group

texts.en:
Sughran has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to expand her sewing business. She is very skillful and receives a good number of orders every month. With the loan, she will buy thread, scissors, elastic and needles that will help her finish the orders on time and make better profits. 

She is 36 years old and, along with her business, she also performs her daily household tasks very well. She operates her business from her home which enables her to do both her business and household work side by side. 

Her husband has a business selling construction supplies. He provides the construction supplies to different construction companies and earns income for the family. Sughran has five children. Four of them are enrolled in a local school and getting their education while the youngest one is only two years old. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting. She is hopeful that an investment will put her business on a more profitable footing. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Sughran.

loans.use: To buy thread, scissors, elastic and needles for sewing business.

loans.name: Siyathuthuka Group

texts.en:
Maria is 79 years old and single with 8 children between the ages of 22 and 42. She runs a foods market business in Kwa Zulu Natal of Empangeni in South Africa. In the photo she is raising her hand.  
  
She has been in this business 2 years, selling fruits, vegetables and chips at her home. She also receives income from the government old age pension funds. Maria requested this loan through WDB and Kiva to buy fruits, vegetables and chips. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her  generate more profit and be used to take her children to tertiary level. In future she would like to improve her life and her family and grow her business.

loans.use: To buy fruits, vegetables and chips.

loans.name: Liwaa

texts.en:
Liwaa is a 37-year-old married man and the father of two children. He has worked at laying tile for 13 years. His business is going along fine and he deals with good contractors who appreciate his work.

He is requesting a loan from A. Majmoua for the first time, in order to buy necessary tiles requested to do a new project he is going to start.

Liwaa hopes to stay healthy and keep on working in an exciting way.

loans.use: To buy necessary tiles requested.

loans.name: Gasanda Group

texts.fr:
Médiatrice est une commerçante âgée de 32ans qui habite au chef-lieu de la Province de Ruyigi située à l’Est du Burundi. Elle  fait le commerce de produits alimentaires comme les tomates, les œufs et arachides depuis 3 ans mais elle vendait auparavant la bière. Elle est mariée a Hassan, un chauffeur  et ont ensemble  4 enfants qui étudient tous. Elle a fait ses études jusqu’en 7e année des études secondaires.

Le crédit Kiva  de 190,000 francs burundais qu’elle obtient lui permet d’augmenter son capital pour acheter de grandes quantités de tomates, œufs et arachides à revendre afin de réaliser de grands bénéfices. 
Elle souhaite mener une heureuse vie dans sa famille et voir ses enfants terminer leurs études et être indépendants.

Il est membre  du groupe  communautaire« GASANDA».
texts.en:
Médiatrice is a 32 year old merchant who lives in the capital of Ruyigi Province situated in the east of Burundi. She has been selling food products like tomatoes, eggs, groundnuts for the last three years but previously she sold beer. She is married to Hassan, a driver and together they have 4 children all of whom are students. She continued her studies until the 7th year of secondary school.

The Kiva credit of 190,000 Burundi francs that she requests will enable her to increase her capital and buy large quantities of tomatoes, eggs and groundnuts in order to make big profits.
She wishes to lead a happy life in her family and to see her children finish their studies and become independent.

She is a member of the Gasanda community group.

loans.use: to increase her capital in order to purchase large quantities of tomatoes,eggs and groundnuts for resale to make big profits.

loans.name: Ritah's Group

texts.en:
Ritah is 21 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. Ritah has a business selling food like matooke (steamed plantain), which she has run two years.
To help expand her business, Ritah has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more food for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Ritah hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for herself and for her young brother. In the future, she hopes to open up a hardware shop.
Ritah is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by helping her improve her business, which has, in turn, helped her pay her school fees.

loans.use: to purchase more food for resale.

loans.name: Asel's Group

texts.en:
Asel is the treasurer of this group. She is 25 and married to a private entrepreneur. Together with her husband she is bringing up two daughters and a son, all of whom are of preschool age (under seven). 

Five years ago with an initial investment of 13,000 KGS the family began to purchase various foodstuffs in Bishkek and then selling them in the village at a higher price.  At the moment the business runs well, so Asel earns about $220 per month. 

She applied for the loan because she needs additional financial funds for purchasing more foodstuffs in order to increase the commodity turnover. In the future, with the profits gained, Asel plans to enlarge a shop.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase foodstuffs for resale.

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en:
Ellen is married with one child. She is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. Ellen is a farmer and grows corn to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. 

She has requested a loan to purchase sacks of fertilizers. She has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, Ellen hopes to supplement her family's income.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase 2 rolls of women’s dresses, two rolls of men's trousers and three rolls of children’s  clothes.

loans.name: Lili

texts.en:
Lili is a farmer from a small village in Adigeni District, Smatskhe-Javakheti Region. She is 49 years old and lives with her two sons (29 and 27 years old) and her daughter-in-law. All family members are involved in running the family dairy farm, which is the only source of income for them. They have eight milk cows and produce approximately 240 kg cheese per month. Cheese is sold to local dairy products retailers. 

Lili requested credit for transportation of her livestock to the summer pasture in a family-owned farm in a mountainous part of the region and take them back to the village after three months. With the borrowed amount she will pay to truck them and also supply some food for her sons, who will stay in the mountain farm to take care of the livestock. After the summer months the livestock will be returned to the village. Their productivity will significantly increase during and after mountain pasturing, as a result of much more fertile grass in the mountains. During the summer months, Lili’s sons will produce cheese in their summer farm and sell it there to retailers, who have already agreed with the family on the purchase of the product. 

The increase in the cows’ productivity and sale of cheese will raise the income of the family. Lili plans to use the increase in the income to purchase additional milk cows.

loans.use: to pay for transportation of her livestock to and from their summer farm in the mountains.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a resident and a farmer in the Nkubu area of Central Kenya.  He is married with 3 children between the ages of 21 and 6 years. He has been farming for the last 15 years, producing and selling eggs, chickens, tomatoes and onions to the local market.

Julius has requested a loan of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase more poultry birds as well as to expand his poultry unit. He says the expansion will generate more income to pay for the education of the two children who are still schooling.

Julius mentions high costs for feeds and poor markets as his main challenges.

loans.use: To buy more poultry birds and expand his poultry unit.

loans.name: Ireneo

texts.en:
Ireneo is 55 years old and lives in Taboo, Jimenez. He is married with 3 children. He works in the fishing industry and catches and sells fish for a living. He has been doing this for 2 years. 

He has requested a loan to purchase materials for his fish cage. Ireneo has been a member of PMPC for 4 years. In the future, Ireneo hopes that his business will progress so that the extra income will be available for his children's education.

loans.use: to purchase materials for his fish cage.

loans.name: Dulcisima

texts.en:
Dulcisima is 67 years old and lives in Sinacaban. She is married with 8 children. She has a motorcycle repair business and earns approximately $230 each month doing this type of work. 

She has requested a loan to purchase materials for her motorcycle repair business. Dulcisima has been a member of PMPC for 2 years.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her motorcycle repair business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy used clothing.

loans.name: Miyansara

texts.ru: Миянсара проживает в городе Душанбе. Ей 38 лет. Она замужем, имеет одного ребенка. У нее высшее педагогическое образование. Она преподает математику в средней школе. В этой области она работает уже 19 лет. Кроме того в свободное от работы время она занимается животноводством. Разводит скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Кредит берет для закупа мелко - рогатого скота.
texts.en: Miyansara lives in the city of Dushanbe. She's thirty-eight years old, married and has one child. Miyansara has a university degree in pedagogy; she has taught mathematics in middle school for the past nineteen years. In her free time she breeds cattle for sale. She's asking for a loan to purchase some small cattle breeds.

loans.use: to acquire some small cattle

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is married with 3 children. She is 57 years old and lives in Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She sells many different products in her general store to earn a living, and has had this business for 25 years. Each month, she earns about $235 doing this type of work. 

She has requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase more products for her general store. Rebecca has been a member of PMPC for 3 years.

loans.use: To purchase more products for her general store.

loans.name: Teddy's Group

texts.en:
Teddy is 22 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is married and has two children, both of whom are currently in school. Teddy has a beauty salon business, which she has run for two years.
To help expand her business, Teddy has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase braids for resale in her salon. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Teddy hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself – for example, by buying new clothes. In the future, she hopes to open a poultry farm.
Teddy is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to work hard.

loans.use: to purchase hair braids to sell in her salon.

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan's husband is a taxi driver. He transports passengers between cities. Hanan is a mother of eight daughters and three sons. Hanan's husband needs to pay for car license and insurance fees, therefore she took out a loan from FATEN to cover the fees.

The taxi is the only source of income for Hanan's family. Hanan is a conservative woman therefore her husband Talal is photographed instead .

loans.use: to pay car license and insurance fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Battulga

texts.en:
Battulga is 33 years old and lives with his wife and 2 children in Darkhan, the second largest city of Mongolia. Currently they live in a rented apartment. 

He has been running a taxi business since 2008 and works on contract with a taxi company. His wife works as a salesperson at a building materials sales shop. His elder son goes to secondary school and the younger daughter attends a kindergarten. 

In 2000, the Mongolian parliament adopted a new land law according to which every Mongolian citizen who reached 18 was allowed to obtain a 0.07 hectare plot of land free of charge. Battulga recently has obtained a license on his land and now he is planning to build a fence around it. In the future, he is planning to build a family house on his land. 

The loan Battulga is taking will be used to buy enough wood planks to build a fence around his land and to pay for labor costs.

loans.use: To buy enough wood planks to build a fence around his land and to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Kalmyrza

texts.en:
Kalmyrza is a 71-year-old villager from Iyri-Suu village. He has worked as a mechanic for all of his life and was really eager to study so he could instill a love of learning in all of his seven children, three of whom became teachers. In 1960, in order to find an additional means of subsistence for his family,  he started his activities in a cattle-breeding business.  With the initial capital of 15,000 KGS, he managed to develop his business with the monthly profit of 3,000 KGS. 

Being a very purposeful and positive person, Kalmyrza works hard to support his family, and today he has one cow, twelve sheep and seven horses at his farm. Kalmyrza plans to use this loan of 100,000 KGS to increase the number of cattle. In the future, Kalmyrza is planning to help his daughter purchase a flat and save money for the payment of the higher education of his grandchild. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners use Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population.  Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Agathe

texts.en:
Agathe is 42 years old. She is married and has one child who is 13 years old. She has three years of experience selling small fish. Her business is open from 7am until 6pm every day.

Agathe needs her first loan from Vision Finance Company of 500,000 RWF. With this loan, she hopes to expand her business by purchasing more small fish in order to increase her sales. With the additional profits, she will be able to pay school fees for her child and save money for her future.

loans.use: to purchase more small fish to sell.

loans.name: Koba

texts.en:
Koba comes from Vale, Samtskhe-Javakheti Region, in the southern part of Georgia. He is 36 years old, married and lives with his wife Ketevan, their 9- year-old son and 1-year-old daughter. Koba’s wife is a teacher in a local school. Koba is the head of the farming activities of the family, which is the main source of income for the family. Koba grows potatoes and cabbage on a family-owned plot. He takes the harvested vegetables to Tbilisi (capital city of the country) with his own minibus and sells them on the Tbilisi open market. The total average monthly income from sales amounts to 1000 Laris per month. 

With the requested credit, Koba plans to cover the costs of plot irrigation. He will pay the watering machine for this service. Unless he waters the plot, he won’t get a quality harvest and thus the planned income from the sales. Also, small part of the loan will be used for purchasing fertilizers for the plot. After fertilizing, the quality of the harvest will become even better and it will be sold for a better price. 

Profit received will be used for covering family daily expenses – purchasing quality food and household goods for family members.

loans.use: to pay for watering of agricultural plot  and fertilizers.

loans.name: Eraste

texts.en:
Eraste is 26 years old. He is married and has two children. He has owned his small general store for about two years. Eraste sells spare parts in the store, and his business is open from 7:00 AM to 5:30 PM every day.

Eraste has requested a Kiva loan so that he can expand his shop by adding more spare parts. With the profits that he earns, Eraste plans to start saving, to pay school fees for his children, and to improve his family's situation.

loans.use: to purchase more spare parts.

loans.name: Munira

texts.ru: Мунира проживает в городе Душанбе. Возраст, 39 лет. Замужем, имеет двоих детей. Ее муж работает отдел кадром в МВД. Сама она имеет высшее образование, педагог. В этой области она проработала более 10 лет. Сейчас Мунира занимается животноводством. Она откармливает и продает скот. Кредит берет для закупа скота, чтобы увеличить их количество.
texts.en: Munira lives in the city of Dushanbe. She's thirty-nine years of age, married and has two children. Her husband works in the HR department in the Ministry of Internal Affairs. Munira has a university degree in Pedagogy; she has taught for more than ten years. Today, Munira breeds cattle: she fattens and then sells it. She's asking for a loan to purchase some cattle and increase her herd count.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 33-year-old single man from Saida. He has worked as a tailor since 2008 with 4 years of experience. Hussein is requesting a loan from A. Majmoua for the third time in order to buy the necessary tools for his business, and to continue pasting tiles and finishing all the sanitary items in his house.

Hussein's previous loans were effective as they let him help his brother do the necessary maintenance to his house so it would be a healthy place for living.

He's a borrower in good-standing and liked by most of his clients. His work is clean and professionA.. He specializes in women clothes.

He loves his business a lot and hopes to open another branch in the future.

loans.use: to buy necessary tools for his business

loans.name: Tanjungsanyang 2 Group

texts.en:
Rohayati has been selling snacks, soft drinks, oil, and other items in a small shop for the past six years. Her business is doing well, and with the income she is able to support her family’s expenses – from the electricity bill to the education of her children. She also works part-time washing clothes in people’s houses. Her husband works off and on; thus, she’s the family’s stable source of income. She has six children. 

She will invest the new loan from VisionFund in her business and for the education of her children. In the future, she wants to expand her business to start selling other items such as t-shirts. She believes that sustaining and growing this business is crucial for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Ilkin

texts.ru:
Ilkin rodilsya v 1989 qodu. On ne jenat i ne imeyet detey. Ilkin jivet v Baku regione vmeste so svoyey mamoy kotoraya boleyet i Ilkin prismatrivayet za ney. 
Uje 2 qoda kak Ilkin rabotayet taxistom. On etomu biznessu nauchilsya u svoyego otca kotoriy toje bil taxistom. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit zapchasti dlya yego mashini, tak kak ona isportilas i on ne mojet razvodit kliyentov. Poka yego mashina ne rabotayet on ne mojet pokupat svoyey mame lekarstvo i poeotmu on v skorom vremeni xochet pochinit yeyo.
texts.en: Ilkin was born in 1989.  He is not married and does not have children.  Ilkin lives in the Baku region together with his ailing mother, whom Ilkin has been looking after.  He has been working as a taxi driver for two years.  He learned this business from his father, who was also a taxi driver.  Currently, Ilkin needs 2000 AZN in order to buy spare parts for his car because the car has broken down, and he cannot transport clients.  While his car is broken down, Ilkin cannot buy medications for his mother, and this is why he hopes to receive the loan soon.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his car

loans.name: Florien

texts.en:
Florien is 37 years old. He is married and has a one-year-old child. Florien sells spare parts. He has been in this business for two years, and his business is open from 7:00 AM to 7:00 PM every day. He currently employs one person to help him.

Florien has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more spare parts. If successful, he hopes to continue building a secure future for his family and to reinvest in his business. In addition, he will help the people of his community by creating jobs for them.

loans.use: to purchase more spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is married and has 5 daughters ages 3 to 13. He has been making cakes and selling them to all types of customers in the town center. As part of his business, Peter employs 4 people from his community. Peter has been doing this for 7 years. In addition to making cakes, Peter also earns money driving a bodaboda (motorcycle). He plans to use the loan to purchase raw materials needed to make more cakes. 

Peter hopes to expand his business and open two branches in the future. He describes himself as creative and entrepreneurial.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials needed to make cakes

loans.name: Hilarion

texts.es:
El Sr. Hilarion tiene 31 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Ita, en la casa de sus padres, él se encuentra trabajando como inspector de la Empresa de Transporte San Buenaventura y también realiza recargas de celulares, es una persona soltera proveniente de una familia responsable y dedicada al trabajo.
Se considera a si mismo como una persona trabajadora,luchadora, proveniente de una familia humilde, cree en la dignificacion por el medio del trabajo. Cree que si es que tiene los medios mecesarios para poder tener un mejor futuro, no dudara en trabajar. 
Él solicita el crédito para la compra de saldos de celulares ya que le esta recibiendo mucha demanda por la zona, por el simple hecho de que las personas no quieren acudir hasta la compañía más cercana o por ende ir hasta el centro de la ciudad.
Su objetivo en la vida es de formar un hogar y de ver creciendo a sus hijos y formándose como persona.
texts.en:
Hilarion is 31 years old and lives in the city of Ita in his parents house. He works as an inspector for the Empresa de Transporte San Buenaventura and, also, recharges cellular phones with minutes. He is single and comes from a responsible family that is dedicated to work. Hilarion considers himself a hard-working, competitive person from a humble family, and he believes in advancement through work. He believes that if one has the necessary means to obtain a better future, one will surely work.

Hilarion is requesting a loan to buy minutes to install on cellular phones, since he is receiving much demand in his zone. The simple reason is that people don't want to travel to the nearest company or to the center of the city.

Hilarion's goal in life is to form a home and to see his children grow and become real people.

loans.use: buy minutes to recharge cellular phones.

loans.name: Rusun Cawang Group

texts.en:
Sofiah works in two businesses. In the morning, she sells nasi uduk for breakfast in a rented mobile store, and in the afternoon, she sells t-shirts. She started her food business in 2002. She became a VisionFund client in 2008 and has used the loans to grow her food business. With the income, she is able to send her children to school. 

Sofiah wants to expand her food business further and buy her own store near her house. She will use the new loan to buy ingredients to make bakso and buy soft drinks to sell during the season of Ramadan next month. With higher earnings, she hopes to send her daughter to university.

Sofiah’s group has a strategy to approach the market in which they sell complementary products. For example, different women in the group sell rice, snacks, drinks, etc. This helps them grow together.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make bakso and buy soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Kuña Aty Ii Group

texts.es:
Kuña Aty II se denomina al excelente grupo de mujeres conformado en la ciudad de Ita, gracias a que la actual Directora General la Sra. Olga, contactó con la asesora en una reunión semanal que la misma tenía en la zona, para informarse de la forma de trabajo que tiene el Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras,una vez asesorada acerca del Programa logró juntar a 15 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto ya en el 1° ciclo,en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro sel programa.
Ellas solicitan el credito para la compra de frutas y verduras, es decir, para adquirir las mercaderias que las mismas mujeres salen a vender. Desean poder tener mas productos que vender para poder asi atraer mas clientela y por medio de esto conseguir un poco mas de ingresos para ellas y sus familias.
Quieren un futuro mejor para sus hijos ya que piensan que la situación actual es muy dificil.
texts.en:
Kuña Aty II is the name of this excellent group of women from the city of Ita.  The group was formed thanks to the current director of the group, Olga, who contacted a loan advisor during a weekly meeting that she was holding in her area in order to find out how the 'Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras' (Committee of Entrepreneurial Women) program worked.  Once she had learned how the program worked, she managed to gather together a group of 15 women who are now working very happily on their first loan cycle.  They are working jointly and supportively within the program.

The ladies are requesting a loan to buy fruit and vegetables.  That is to say, they would like to acquire the merchandise that they go out and sell.  They would like to have more products to sell so that they can attract more customers and make a little more income for themselves and their families.  They would like their children to enjoy a better future since they believe that the current situation is very difficult.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Sigyongyaakadi Group

texts.fr:
Mme Safiatou est la représentante du groupe SIGYONGYAAKADI. Elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Le plus âgé a 12ans et le moins âgé a 4ans.2 vont a l’école et elle a 3 personnes en chage.

Elle vend des pagnes depuis 4 ans. Mme s’approvisionne au marché du secteur 10.Ses clients sont les femmes.

Elle veut s’acheter 12 complets de pagnes.

Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut améliorer ses conditions de vie. Elle ambitionne aider son mari à construire leur maison et voyager pour amener les pagnes et vendre en gros.
texts.en:
Mrs. Safiatou is the representative of the Sigyongyaakadi group. She is married and the mother of three children. The oldest is 12 years of age, and the youngest is 4. Two of them go to school. She has three dependents.

She sells traditional  colorful “pagnes” fabrics for about four years. She stocks up at the Sector 10 market. Her customers are all women.
