She would like to buy 12 sets of “pagnes.” Thanks to her income, she would like to improve her quality of life. Her goal is to help her husband build a house for the family and to travel to buy pagnes for reselling wholesale.

loans.use: to buy traditional fabrics

loans.name: San Antonio Poty Group

texts.es:
San Antonio Poty se denomina al excelente grupo de mujeres conformado en la ciudad de Itá, gracias a que la actual Directora General la Sra. Emilce, contactó con la asesora en una reunión semanal que la misma tenía en la zona, para informarse de la forma de trabajo que tiene el Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras. Una vez asesorada acerca del Programa logró juntar a 15 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto ya en el 8° ciclo,en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
Ellas se definen  como unas mujeres luchadoras, trabajadoras, con ganas de progresar y salir adelante. Luchan por sua familias e hijos, para ofrecerles un futuro digno.
La Sra. Emilce se dedica a la venta de ropas, por medio de este trabajo ella ha logrado sacar adelante a toda su familia y se siente muy orgullosa por ello.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de ropas de estación para la posterior venta. Desea tener una gran variedad de productos para poder asi atraer más clientela y por medio de esto lograr un mayor ingreso económico para lograr una mayor estabilidad.
texts.en:
San Antonio Poty is the name of this excellent group of women that was formed in the town of Itá thanks to the current Director General Señora Emilce.  She contacted the advisor at a weekly meeting that was held in the same area to find out about the work of the Committee of Women Entrepreneurs. Once she had been advised about the program, she managed to bring together 15 women who find themselves working very well, and in the 8th cycle, are part of the program together and individually.

They define themselves as struggling women, hard workers, who want to progress and move forward in their lives.  They are struggling for their families and children in order to offer them a decent future.

Sra. Emilce works selling clothes. Through this medium she has been able to get her entire family ahead and she feels very proud of that. 

She is requesting the loan for the purchase of seasonal clothes for resale. She wants to have a good variety of products to be able to attract more customers and through this achieve a higher income so as to achieve financial stability.

loans.use: Compra de ropas de estación.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase wheat seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Ganzorig

texts.en:
Mr. Ganzorig is 25 years old and lives with his wife and 2 children in Darkhan, the second largest city of Mongolia. His eldest son is 4 and he goes to kindergarden. Ganzorig’s wife works at the local general practitioner as a nurse. Ganzorig does not own his own place to live and currently his family is renting a one-bedroom flat in Darkhan city, but he owns a land plot in a suburb of Darkhan which he uses for growing vegetables. Part of the harvest he sells to vegetable retailers for extra income for his family.

Ganzorig has been running a taxi business for 4 years using his family car. Free of work time, he works on his land growing and watering his vegetables. He is planning to dig a water well in the middle of his land to save time and cost on water transportation. The loan Ganzorig is taking will be used to pay for the labor cost to dig a water well on his land plot, which will be used for irrigating his vegetables on his land.

loans.use: to pay the labor cost to dig a water well on his land plot which will be used for irrigating his vegetables and increasing his harvest

loans.name: Coparimiga Group

texts.fr: François est  agri-éleveur né au Rwanda. Il est membre du groupe COPARIMIGA. Il est marié, il  a 52 ans, il a 4 enfants entre 20 ans et 35 ans, il a 1 enfant va  à l’école,  il n’a aucune personne en charge. Il  a quatre ans des études primaires. C’est son deuxième  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit pour acheter les engrais chimique  et payer la main d’œuvre. Il n’a aucune difficulté attendue de non-remboursement de son prêt. Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’étendre le terrain cultivé pour augmenter la production. Sa vision il voudrait devenir le grand producteur du riz. Pour sa famille il voudrait payer le frais du minerval pour son enfant et  payer les frais médicaux pour sa famille.
texts.en: François is a Rwandan agricultural producer.  He is a member of the Coparimiga Group.  He is married, 52 years old, and has four children between the ages of 20 and 35, of whom one attends school.  He does not look after any others as part of his household.  He has four years of primary education.  This is his second loan cycle with ACB and has not had any non-repayment troubles with his first loan.  He is going to use this loan to purchase chemical fertilizers and to pay labor costs.  His strategy for growing his business is to enhance the soil in order to increase production.  He would like to be become a large rice producer.  For his family he would like to pay the school fees for his child and pay his family's medical expenses.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pay labor costs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase wheat seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Turdubu

texts.en:
Turdubu is 54, married, and has six children. 

She has been engaged in cattle breeding and land cultivating since 1994. Turdubu and her family cultivate beans and potatoes and also run a farm with ten milk cows and 60 sheep. These activities allow them to earn about 6,000 KGS a month. 

Turdubu plans to use her loan of 100,000 KGS to purchase milk cows, which will allow her to increase her milk and meat sales. With the revenues, she plans to help her son build a barn for the cattle and to reconstruct her house. 

About Bai-Tushum and Partners:

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Afag

texts.ru:
Afag zamujem imeyet 3 detey. Ona jivet v Baku regione vmeste so svoim mujem i detmi. Afag 43 qoda. Ona uje 13 let kak zanimayetsya shveynim businessom. Eto uje vtoraya ssuda Afag ona ochen blagodarna Kive i lenderam za ssudu. V perviy raz ona brala US$1,200 i yejemesachno vovrema oplachivala svoyu ssudu.
Seychas ona nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit shveynuyu mashinu dlya razvitiya svoyego businessa. 
Etomu biznessu ona nauchilas u svoyey mami kotoraya s detstva uchila yeyo shit snachalo odejdu dlya yeyo kukol a potom dlya Afag samoy.
texts.en: Afag is married and has three children.  She lives in the Baku region together with her husband and children.  She is 43 years old.  Afag has been involved in the sewing business for 13 years.  This is her second loan, and Afag is very grateful to Kiva and the lenders for it.  She previously borrowed $1,200 and repaid her loan monthly in a timely manner.  Currently, she needs 2000 AZN in order to buy a sewing machine, needed to develop her business.  She learned this business from her mother, who taught her since childhood how to sew clothing for her dolls and then for Afag herself.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Kuarahy Rese Group

texts.es:
Kuarahy Rese se denomina al excelente grupo de mujeres conformado en la ciudad de Itá.
La Sra Diana pudo acceder a ala información acerce del comite de mujeres emprendoras por medio de la reunion de la asesora en la zona en que ellas viven.
Ella define a las integrantes del comite como un grupo de mujeres a quienes el trabajo no atemoriza, es decir, les gusta lo que hacen y gracias a eso cada dia van creciendo más y más, como prueba de ello, este comite se encuentra actualmente en el sexto ciclo.
Ellas solicitan este credito para poder comprar frutas y verduras, y luego realizar la venta de los mismos. Desean poder tener una gran variedad de productos para poder asi atraer a sus clientes y demas futuros compradores.
texts.en:
Kuarahy Rese is the name of this excellent group of women from the city of Ita.  Diana gathered information about the 'Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras' (Committee of Entrepreneurial Women) program from a meeting that a loan officer was giving in the area where she lives.

Diana describes the members of her committee as a group of women who are not afraid of hard work.  That is to say, they enjoy what they do and, thanks to this, they are growing every day.  As proof of this, this committee is currently in its sixth loan cycle.

The members of this committee are requesting a loan to buy fruit and vegetables which they will then sell.  They would like to be able to have a large variety of products so that they can attract their customers and other future buyers.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables to sell in the area

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase wheat seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Ludio

texts.es:
Ludio tiene 36 años, está casado con la señora Agustina de 29 años de edad. 
El Sr. Ludio comenzó desde muy joven a trabajar en el ámbito comercial, comprando y vendiendo todo tipo de articulos como comestibles, ropas, es decir, todo lo que pueda para ofrecer mas variedad a la clientela y asi atraerlos hacia su negocio y así conseguir una mayor convocatoria de clientes.
El mismo comenta que comenzó con un negocio pequeño pero que al trascurrir el tiempo y gracias a su esfuerzo y la de su familia logró crecer bastante en dicha profesión.
Gracias a su trabajo  y dedicación logra brindar a su familia las comodidades esenciales para que vivan dignamente y no les falte el pan de cada día. 
Solicita el crédito para la obtencion de más mercaderias para seguir ampliando el stock de sus mercaderias.
texts.en:
Ludio is 36 years old.  He is married to 29 year-old Agustina.

Ludio started out working in commerce when he was very young, buying and selling all kinds of goods such as food and clothes.  That is to say, he sold everything he could, so that he could offer a good variety of goods to his customers and attract more customers to his business so that he could build his customer base.

Ludio tells us that he started out with a small business but, over time and thanks to his efforts and those of his family, he has managed to grow quite a lot in his business.

Thanks to his work and commitment, Ludio manages to provide his family with all the essential comforts they need to live decently and not lack any essentials.  He is requesting this loan to obtain more goods, so that he can continue expanding his stock of merchandise.

loans.use: to buy goods to expand his stock of merchandise (food, drinks, canned goods, etc.)

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 46 years old and married to Simon. They support a family of nine. She has been in the farming business for the last 15 years with a monthly income of KES 6,000. 

With a second loan of KES 17,000 from KADET she plans to purchase wheat seeds and get fertilizers for her family farm and to pay laborers for tilling the land. This will help in the early preparation of her family farm. The proceeds will be re-invested.

Her future plan is to continue with farming, diversify and venture into establishing a boutique as well as to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase wheat seeds and fertilizers and to pay laborers for tilling the land.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
El Sr. Luis tiene 40 años, esta casado con la Sra. Sonia hace 18 años, tienen 3 hijos, todos ellos varones, Walter (22),Juan Luis (15) y Jorge Ramón(14) los tres chicos se encuentran estudiando.
El Sr. Luis anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de leche y poseía una carnicería, luego comenta que comenzó a interesarse por la Veterinaria y comenzó a estudiar hasta que se recibió de Dr. Veterinario, desde esa vez, y hace 3 años que posee su Agro-Veterinaria donde trabaja en compañía de su esposa, actualmente, posee su local en su domicilio, y cuenta con una clientela bien formada y realiza las consultas via telefónica y particular.
El Sr. Luis solicita el credito para la compra de los insumos que utiliza dentro de su profesion, nos referimos a la compra de  invirtió su préstamo en la compra de vitaminas,alimento para animales,vacunas y demás medicamentos que podria necesitar para el mejor desempeño de su función.
texts.en:
Luis, age 40, has been married to Sonia for 18 years.  They have three children, all boys.  Walter is 22, Juan Luis is 15, and Jorge Ramón is 14.  The three boys are in school.

Previously, Luis sold milk and had a butcher shop.  Then, he says, he started to take an interest in becoming a veterinarian.  He started his studies, and he continued until he became a Veterinarian Doctor.  He has been an Agro-Veterinarian for three years, and he works with his wife.  He currently has his business in his home, and he has well established customers.  He does telephonic and private consultations.

Luis is requesting the loan to buy supplies to use in his profession.  He will use the loan to buy vitamins, feed for animals, vaccines, and other medications that could be needed to improve his performance.

loans.use: to buy vitamins, feed for animals, vaccines, and other medications.

loans.name: Samir

texts.ru: Samir jenat i imeyet odnogo rebonka. Yemu 28 let. On i yego semya jivut v Baku regione uje 3 qoda. Samir 4 qoda kak uchitel po trudu, on uchit detey delat muzikalniye instrumenti, delat malenkiye derevanniye skulpturi, delat razniye derevannie bashni i t.d. Samir seychas nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit instrumenti kotoriye nujni bivayut na uroke dlya izqotovleniya raznix interesnix veshey v osnovnom iz dereva. Kak vi videte na risunke etu derevannuyu skulpturu deti sdelali sami.
texts.en: Samir is 28 years old, married and has one child.  He has been living with his family in the Baku region for three years.  Samir has been working as shop class (industrial arts) teacher for four years.  He teaches children how to make musical instruments, wooden sculptures, various wooden towers and the like.  Samir needs 2000 AZN in order to purchase tools for making different interesting things, primarily out of wood, that are needed for the classes.  As you can see on the photograph, this wooden sculpture was made by the children.

loans.use: to purchase tools

loans.name: Angelique

texts.en:
Angelique is 29 years old. She is married and has three children between the ages of 7 and 10 years old. Angelique has been in her salon business for two years. She employs three people in her salon. Her business is open from 7:00 AM until 7:00 PM every day.

Angelique has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase more shampoo and other items for her beauty salon. With her profits, Angelique will reinvest in her business, save for her family's future, and be able to buy a house.

loans.use: to increase her business by buying more shampoo and other items for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Zarkhanim

texts.ru:
Zarkhanim jivet v Baku regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. Ona zamujem i imeyet 3 detey. Zarkhanim 44 qoda. 
Ona 9 let kak zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i razvodit korov. Seychas Zarkhanim nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korovi dlya uvelicheniya molochnogo produkta kotoruyu ona prodayet v razniye magazini.
texts.en: Zarkhanim lives in the Baku region together with her family.  She is 44 years old, married and has three children.  Zarkhanim has been involved in animal husbandry and breeding cattle for nine years.  Currently, she needs 2000 AZN to buy cattle in order to increase production of dairy that she sells to different stores.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Rustam

texts.ru: Рустам житель города Душанбе. Возраст, 52 года. Он женат. У него двое детей. Его жена домохозяйка, дочка работает поваром, а сын студент. Сам Рустам предоставляет услугу. Он развозит людей по маршрутной линии №55. В этой области он имеет богатый опыт. Кроме того он занимается торговлей на рынке Корвон. В основном он продает в оптом мужские трусы и носки. Этим видом деятельности он занимается уже год. В продвижении его деятельности ему помогает его сын. Он берет кредит для ремонта автомашины марки Тангем и приобретения сезонного товара для торговли.
texts.en: Rustam lives in the city of Dushanbe.  He is 62 years old, married and has two children.  His wife is a homemaker, daughter works as a cook, and son is a student.  Rustam provides a service.  He transports people on route number 55.  He has extensive experience in this field.  Besides this business, Rustam is involved in sales at the Korvon market.  He primarily sells men's undergarments and socks wholesale.  He has been involved in this business for one year.  Rustam's son helps him with growing the business.  He is requesting this loan for the repairs of the Tangem automobile and purchase of seasonal merchandise for sale.

loans.use: to repair automobile Tangem and buy seasonal goods for sale

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
El Cliente Alejandro es D. L. ciudad D. Santaní, tiene 45 años D. edad, es separado, con un hijo.
Es un hombre muy luchadro y trabajador, cada dia lucha por conseguir el sutento D. el y D. su hijo, para lograr que el tenga una vida digna y no pase por necesidades que su padre habia pasado.
El Sr. Alejandro se dedica a L. venta D. joyas D. plata, y L. compra D. joyas D. oro, tiene una clienteL. formada por su ciudad y alrededores.
Aparte D. darle sustento a su familia tambien lo hace con otras, ya que emplea a unas personas, con lo que logra que asi como el lo hace, esas personas puedan darle el pan a sus familias.
El Sr. alejandro solicita el credito para L. compra D. sus mercaderias, es decir aumentar su stock D. joyas, ya  que el piensa que teniendo mas variedad D. joyas atraera mas clientes.
texts.en:
Alejandro is from the city of Santaní.  He is 45 years old, separated, and has one child.

He is a very tenacious and hard-working man.  He struggles each day to support himself and his son.  He does this so that his son has a decent life and does not lack the necessities like his father did.

Alejandro sells silver jewelry and buys gold jewelry.  He has established customers in his city and its outskirts.

Besides supporting his family, he does so with others because he employs people.  With what they get, these people are able to give their families their daily bread like Alejandro does.

Alejandro is requesting the loan to buy merchandise to increase his stock of jewelry.  He thinks that having a greater variety of jewelry will attract more customers.

loans.use: to buy jewelry to increase his stock with merchandise.

loans.name: Samar

texts.en:
Samar is a 25-year-old woman from Palestine. She is a mother of one daughter.  Samar's husband sells cleaning products in one of the city center streets.

Samar's husband wants to pay for a bulk purchase of cleaning products but he doesn't have enough cash to pay all the price at once, therefore Samar took out a loan from FATEN to pay for the products.

Samar is a conservative woman, therefore her husband Hamam is photographed instead.

loans.use: to pay for bulk purchase of cleaning products her husband sells.

loans.name: Huber

texts.es:
El Cliente Huber es de la ciudad de Santani, el cuenta con casa propia ,está casado, y tiene un hijo. Se considera asi mismo como una persona trabajadora y muy emprendedora, no tiene miedo al trabajo, ya que cada labor que desempeña para él es un desafío.
El Sr. tiene un Copetin (expendio de comidas rápidas)en su propio domicilio, tiene una clientela formada a, pues hace unos años que viene dedicandose a eso.
El desea el crédito para invertir en su copetin, es decir, desea incrementar la variedad de productos que ofrece a sus clientes, ya que es conciente de que ofreciendo mayor variedad podra generar mas ingresos.
Comenta el Sr. Huber que le gustaría, algun día, poder abrir un comedor para poder asi ampliar su panorama de comercio o ganancia.
texts.en:
Huber is from the city of Santani.  He has his own house, is married, and has one child.  He considers himself to be a hard-working and very enterprising person.  He is not afraid of work.  To him, each job that he does is a challenge.

He has a “copetín” (a fast food store) in his own home.  He has established customers, and he has been devoting himself to this for a few years.

He wants the loan to invest in his copetín.  That means that he wants to increase the variety of products that he sells to his customers.  He is aware of the fact that a greater variety will generate more income.  Huber says that someday he would like to be able to open a dining room in order to be able to expand his business or income panorama.

loans.use: to increase the variety of products in his store.

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
El comité San Cayetano se formo con la union de varias vecinas de la comunidad de la ciudad de Santaní.
El comité que se denomina San Cayetano esta en el sexto Ciclo con 10  integrantes, es un grupo que se destaca en el barrio por ser sus integrantes mujeres muy unidas, solidarias y responsable.
Las integrantes poseen un gran espíritu emprendedor, creativo y responsable.
La Sra. Rosalia es una criadora de animales, desde muy pequeña se dedica a eso, ella se considera una mujer muy trabajadora y sacrificada. Por medio de su trabajo ella ha podido darle el sustento a su familia y a todos los suyos.
Solicita el credito para la compra de animales para criar y tambien para los alimentos de estos, cree que con esta ayuda podra progresasçr y generar un poco más de ingresos.
texts.en:
The San Cayetano committee was formed by several neighbors from a community in the city of Santaní.

The San Cayetano committee is in its sixth loan cycle and has ten members.  It is a group which is well noted in its neighborhood because all the members are very united, supportive and responsible.  The group members have a great entrepreneurial, creative and responsible spirit.

Rosalia raises animals.  She has been doing this since she was very young.  She considers herself to be a very hard-working and self-sacrificing woman.  Through her work, she has been able to support her whole family.  She is requesting this loan to buy animals to raise and also feed for the animals.  She believes that, with this help, she will be able to make progress and make a little more income.

loans.use: to buy animals and animal feed

loans.name: Indira

texts.en:
Indira is 31 years old and has three children. After the birth of her youngest child, her marriage broke down and she became the only breadwinner for her children. That's why Indira decided to start her own business of reselling fruits and vegetables with the initial capital of 20,000 KGS. 

She also involved her brother in this business. He supports her and helps with selling food at the local market. In order to provide a wide assortment of goods, Indira purchases fruits for reselling from suppliers in neighboring Uzbekistan, and in autumn, she brings apples from the Issyk-Kul region, which is known for apple orchards. 

In some seasons, she also works as a wholesale supplier of vegetables to neighboring Kazakstan. These tireless activities allow Indira to earn about 10,000 KGS in a month. With the revenues, she was able to renovate her house. 

Indira has applied for a loan of 100,000 KGS to broaden her assortment of goods. This will allow for further development of her business in the market. 

Bai-Tushum & Partners, one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan, partners with Kiva to target the especially vulnerable population. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to broaden the assortment of goods she sells.

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en:
Muhammad is a 29-year-old husband and taxi driver; he drives passengers inside the city where he lives. Muhammad has no children.

Muhammad wants to renew the taxi license and insurance and can't pay the fees at once, but paying back on a monthly basis to FATEN is going to be possible as the income of the taxi is barely enough for their household expenses.

Muhammad is photographed in the picture here.

loans.use: to pay for taxi license and insurance fees.

loans.name: Hasifah's Group

texts.en:
Hasifah is 18 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. Hasifah has a tailoring business, which she has run for two years.
To help expand her business, Hasifah has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase materials for making clothes for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Hasifah hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for her family. In the future, she hopes to own a retail shop.
Hasifah is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by helping her business generate more capital.

loans.use: to purchase materials for making clothes for resale.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is aged 44 and has been in the farming business for over 20 years in the Nkubu area of Central Kenya. He is married with three children,one adult with the other two are still school-going. His produce of maize, beans, tomatoes and milk are sold locally. He gets additional income from his employment  in a  local school.

Patrick has made a loan request amounting to 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to enable him to purchase a chuff cutter and construct a zero grazing unit. He says improved feeding for his animals will generate more income due to improved  milk production and eventually enable him to educate his children.

Patrick however laments that the high cost in farming inputs remains a great challenge to farmers.

loans.use: To pay for purchase of a chuff cutter and construct a zero grazing unit.

loans.name: Oñondivepa Group

texts.es:
El comité Oñondivepa se formo con la union de varias vecinas de la comunidad  de Santaní.
El comité está en el quinto Ciclo con 14  integrantes, es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unidas, solidarias y responsable, las integrantes poseen un gran espíritu de servicio y de responsabilidad con la Fundación.
La Sra Viudina posee una pequeña despensa, por medio del cual puede sostener a su familia, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora.
Solicita el crédito para poder cargar con mas mercaderias su pequeño negocio, ya que es conciente de que si tiene mas variedad de productos, podra atraer mas clientes.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Oñondivepa" consists of a group of neighbors from the community of Santani.

This group is in its 5th loan cycle and has 14 members.  This group stands out in the neighborhood for being very united, cooperative and responsible.  Its members have a great spirit of service and responsibility to the  Fundación.

Viudina has a small store with which she supports her family.  She is a very hardworking and tenacious woman.  She requests this loan to buy more merchandise for her small business, since she knows that if she has a greater variety of products  she will be able to attract more customers.

loans.use: to buy groceries, including canned goods, drinks and other products to stock her store

loans.name: Lannaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Lannaya a été crée le 27 Mai 2007. Il est composé de 16 femmes toutes habitant la même localité. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce. 

Debout à droite de la photo, Marietou est la responsable du groupe. Elle âgée de 45 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 10 enfants. 

Elle vend des arachides en graines au niveau du marché hebdomadaire de leur localité, activité qu'elle a mené depuis plusieurs années. 

Ce prêt lui permettra de s'approvisionner en quantité suffisante en cette période et de revendre à un bon prix pendant l'hivernage où la matière sera prisée. 

Avec les recettes générées, elle compte renforcer son épargne, et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa progéniture (dans les domaines: scolarité, sanitaire, alimentaire)
texts.en:
The Lannaya solidarity group has been created on May 27, 2007. It is composed of 16 women living in the same village. Their main business acvitiviy is retail.

Marieto, standing on the right in the photo, is the grop’s leader. She is 45 years old. She is married and the mother of 10.

She sells peanuts (ground nuts) and  seeds at the weekly market of their village, something she has been doing for years.

This loan will allow her to buy a sufficient quality of produce now to resell it at a good price later during the winter season, when gains in value.

With the income from this business, she would like to grow her savings and improve the life conditions of her children (schooling, health and hygiene, food).

loans.use: to purchase peanut seeds or peanuts in the shell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To construct a dairy unit.

loans.name: Wendtoin Group

texts.fr:
Mme Rihanata est le responsable du groupe WENDTOIN. Mariée, elle est mère de 3 enfants. Le plus âgé a 15ans et le moins âgé a 4ans.2 vont a l’école et elle a 4 personnes en charge.

Elle est coiffeuse depuis 09ans. Mme s’approvisionne au marché de bissighin.Ses clients sont les femmes.

Elle veut s’acheter 20 sachets de mèche,10 sachets de laine et 12 sachets de perle.

Mme économise ses bénéfices pour ouvrir un grand salon de coiffure. Elle ambitionne s’acheter une moto.
texts.en:
Mme Rihanata is the leader of the group WENDTOIN. She is married and the mother of three children. The oldest is 15 and the youngest four years old. Two of them go to school. She is also responsible for four other people. 

She has been a hairdresser for nine years. She buys her supplies at the market of Bissighin. Her customers are women. She wants to buy 20 bags of hair extensions, 10 bags of wool, and 12 bags of beads. She is saving up her profit to open a big beauty salon. She dreams of buying a motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy 20 bags of hair extensions, 10 bags of wool, and 12 bags of beads.

loans.name: San Expedito Group

texts.es:
El comité San Expedito se formo con la union de varias vecinas de la comunidad de la ciudad Santaní.
El comité que se denomina San Expedito está en el quinto Ciclo con 10 integrantes, es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unidas, solidarias y responsable, las integrantes poseen un gran espíritu emprendedor.
La Sra. Celia se dedica a la cria de animales, con los cuales sustenta a sus familiares. Sabe que el trabajo que realiza es digno y muy loable y sabe que con la ayuda adecuada llegara muy lejos.
Solicita el crédito para poder comprar mas animales que criar y asi poder lograr mas ingresos economicos para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
The communal bank "San Expedito" is made up of a group of neighbors from the community of Santaní.

This group, called "San Expedito," is in its 5th loan cycle and has 10 members. This group stands out in the neighborhood for being very united, cooperative and responsible. Its members have a great entrepreneurial spirit.

Celia supports her family with her business raising animals.  She knows that the work she does is decent and worthwhile, and she knows that with adequate support it will take her very far.

She requests a loan to buy more animals to raise, so that she can have a better income for herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy animals to later sell, and animal feed

loans.name: Berna

texts.en:
Berna is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is married and has three children, all of whom are currently in school. Berna has a business selling fruits and vegetables, which she has run for one year.
To help expand her business, Berna has requested a loan of 150,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase fruits and vegetables for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Berna hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself – for example, by buying clothes. In the future, she hopes to expand her business and work in a big market.
Berna is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by generating more capital from her business.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase new items to sell in the store.

loans.name: Kuña Aty Group

texts.es:
El comité Kuña Aty se formo con la union de varias vecinas de la comunidad de la ciudad de Santaní.
El comité está en el quinto Ciclo con 11  integrantes, es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unidas, solidarias y responsable, las integrantes poseen un gran espíritu emprendedor, ya que están al día con las cuotas y pretenden terminar esta etapa con muy buen cumplimiento de responsabilidad con la institución.
La Sra. digna, desde pequeña se dedica a la cria de animales de granja, es una mujer laboriosa y emprendedora, ella lucha para salir adelante, piensa en darle un mejor futuro a sus familiares por medio de su trabajo.
Solicita el credito para la compra de los balanceados para sus animales, como asi tambien los medicamentos que estos podrian llegar a necesitar. Cree que la ayuda quee podria Brindarle la Fundación Paraguaya le seria de gran ayuda para poder aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The committee Kuña Aty was formed when various residents of the city of Santaní joined together. The committee is in its fifth loan cycle with 11 members. The group stands out in its neighborhood for being very united, mutually supportive and responsible. The members are possessed of a great enterprising spirit since they are up-to-date with their payments and expect to finish this phase having complied very well with their responsibilities with the institution. 

Mrs. Digna has raised farm animals since she was a young girl. She is a hard-laboring and enterprising woman. She fights to get ahead and hopes to give her family members a better future through her work. She is seeking the loan for the purchase of feed for her animals, as well as medications which they may need. She believes that the help which Fundación Paraguay could give her would be of great assistance in order to increase her earnings.

loans.use: to purchase feed and medicines for farm animals.

loans.name: Badima Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe est crée le 27 Mai 2007. Il est composé de 27 femmes qui habitent toutes la même localité. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce. 

Kounady debout à droite de la photo, et levant la main est la responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 36 ans. Elle est mariée et vit avec ses 05 neveux et nièces car n'a pas d'enfants encore. 

Elle vend de la glace et des jus de fruits ( bissap et pain de singe). Elle s'approvisionne au marché et dans les villages environnants. 

Avec ce nouveau prêt, elle pourra s'approvisionner en quantité suffisante pour la revente. 

Les bénéfices qu'elle va tirer de son commerce serviront à renforcer son épargne et aider son époux dans la prise en charge des besoins familiaux.
texts.en:
The group was set up on 27th May 2007 and is made up of 27 women who all live in the same town. They are all primarily small-scale traders.

Kounady, who is standing on the right of the photo and raising her hand, is in charge of the group. She is 36 years old, married and lives with her five nephews and nieces, since she does not have any children yet.

She sells ice-cream and fruit juices (hibiscus and monkey bread). She gets her supplies at the market and in the surrounding villages. With this loan, she will be able to get a sufficient quantity of goods to resell. The profits she makes from her business will be used to build up her savings and to help her husband to provide for the family's needs.

loans.use: to buy monkey bread and dried hibiscus plus ingredients (sugar, "sachets", succulent plants)

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La  Sra. Juana es de la ciudad de Santani, tiene 46 años de edad, es soltera y tiene 4 Hijos, todos mayores de edad, trabajan independiente.
Como medio de sustento de ella y la de su familia tiene una despensa donde cuenta ya con una clientela bien definida, pero pese a ello quisiera poder ampliar un poco mas su campo de ventas.
Ella se define como una mujer honesta y trabajadora, desde pequeña ha trabajo y por ese lado no tiene ningun problema.
Solicita el credito para poder ampliar un poco más su pequeño negocio y asi poder tener más variedad de productos que pueda ofrecer a sus clientes. Piensa que el credito le sera de mucha ayuda no solo a ella sino tambien a toda su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Juana is from the city of Santani. She is 46 years old, single and has four children, all of them adults who work independently. 

As a means of supporting herself and her family, she has a store with an established customer base, in spite of which she would like to be able to broaden somewhat her area of sales. 

She is defined as an honest and hard-working woman. She has worked since she was a young girl and has no problems in that respect. She is seeking the loan to be able to expand her small business a bit, and thus have a greater variety of products to offer her customers. She believes the loan will be of great help not only to her but also to her whole family.

loans.use: to purchase products to stock her store such as groceries, canned goods, drinks, etc.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
El comité Maria Auxiliadora II se formo con la union de varias vecinas de la comunidad de la ciudad de Santaní.
El comite denominado María Auxiliadora II es muy conocido en el barrio por ser un grupo muy organizado, donde todas las miembros trabajan muy activamente, de forma responsable y muy sacrificada. ven el trabajo la forma de salir adelante y conseguir mas ingresos para su familia.
La Sra. Mirian, posee una modesta despensa con la cual puede sustentar a sus familiares y a ella misma. Sabe que una ayuda para poder aumentar la variedad de productos le vendria muy bien.
Solicita el crédito para comprar mercaderias, con las cuales podra aumentar su stock de mercaderias con lo cual podra atraer a mas clientes.
texts.en:
The committee Maria Auxiliadora II was formed when various residents of the city of Santaní joined together. The committee known as Maria Auxiliadora II is well-known in the neighborhood for being a very organized group in which all the members work actively, responsibly and with many sacrifices. They see work as a means of getting ahead and obtaining more income for their families. 

Mrs. Mirian owns a small store with which she can support her family members and herself. She knows that getting help in order to increase her variety of products would be a very good thing for her. She is seeking the loan to purchase merchandise with which to be able to increase her stock so she can attract more customers.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as groceries, drinks and other products for stocking her store.

loans.name: Abdusamad

texts.ru: Абдусамад житель города Куляб. Ему 25 лет. Он женат. Имеет одного ребенка. Его жена, домохозяйка. Сам Абдусамад занимается торговлей на рынке "Сомон" города. Он имеет магазин со смешанным ассортиментом. Кроме того он занимается торговлей арбузов. Этим видом деятельности Абдусамад занимается уже четыре года. Она берет кредит для покупки порфюмерии и косметики, чтобы увеличить ассортимент своего товара.
texts.en: Abdusamad lives in the city of Kulob.  He is 25 years old, married and has one child.  His wife is a homemaker.  Abdusamad is involved in sales at the "Somon" city market.  He owns a store, where he sells various merchandise.  Besides this, he also sells watermelons.  Abdusamad has been involved in this type of business for four years.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of perfumes and cosmetics in order to increase his merchandise selection.

loans.use: to purchase new perfumes and cosmetics

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence has been in farming for eight years in her hometown of Kitale, with her farm producing eggs, maize, beans and tomatoes. She is married with seven children aged between 10 and 21 and all attending school.

Florence has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase poultry birds.She says the loan will improve her family's living standards and ensure her children have money for their education. She wants to have 1,000 birds and hopes she will be the main egg supplier in the area.

Poultry diseases are her main challenge.

loans.use: to purchase poultry birds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for painting the walls and fix kitchen and bathroom water pipes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Book Diom Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité BOOK DIOM a été créé le 14 mai 2010.Il est composé de 14 femmes issues de la même zone.Leur activité principale est le commerce.

Madame Fatou (debout à droite de la photo) est responsable du groupe,elle est mariée et âgée de 50 ans. Elle s'occupe de 12 enfants qui sont à sa charge mais seuls les 07 constituent ses propres enfants.

Elle a pour activité principale la vente de légumes et de jus de fruits.

Son prêt lui permettra d'acheter en quantité suffisante les fruits et légumes nécessaire pour mener une activité rentable.

Son objectif est de s'occuper de la scolarité de ses enfants et de renforcer sa capacité d'épargne.
texts.en:
The solidarity group BOOK DIOM was created on May 14, 2010. It is comprised of 14 women from the same area. They mainly work in commerce.

Ms. Fatou (standing at the right in the photo) is the group's official. She is married and 50 years old. She takes care of twelve children who are in her care, but only seven of them are her own. Her main business involves selling vegetables and fruit juices. Her loan will enable her to buy a sufficient quantity of fruits and vegetables necessary for running a profitable business. Her goal is to take care of her children's schooling costs and to boost her capacity to save money.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Safaa

texts.en:
Safaa is a 35-year-old housewife who did not let the fact that she has three children to raise with her husband keep her from being a productive member of the family. Wanting to stay by her children’s side during the day and having experience as a housewife led her to start a small retail business at home selling household supplies.

Since she knows what is best for women to use at their houses, she started attracting them to buy from her, plus being closer than the closest home supply shop in their area.

Now after three years since launching her business, and being known in the area,  Safaa has applied for this loan to start expanding by opening her own home supplies store to increase the income she gets and to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more products to sell in her own store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Dental Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Dental a été créé en Décembre  2010 à l’inauguration de leur banc villageois. Il est composé de 21 femmes qui sont issues du même village. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Assise  en deuxième position de la gauche vers la droite. La responsable du groupe est âgée de 38 ans. Elle est  mariée et est mère de quatre enfants. 

Elle vend du riz, de l’huile végétale et de palme. Elle a  une bonne expérience dans ce domaine pour l’avoir pratiqué au moins trois années.

Ce nouveau lui permettra de s’approvisionner en riz et huile pour la revente.

Avec les bénéfices qu’elle tirera de son activité, elle compte soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
The “Dental” group was created in December 2010 at the opening of the local Banc Villageois. It is composed of 21 women from the same village. Their main business activity is retail.

The group’s leader is seated second from left in the photo. She is 38 years old, married and the mother of four. She sells rice, vegetable and palm oil. She has solid experience in this business having done it for over three years. 

This new loan will allow her to restock rice and oil for sale. Thanks to the income from her business, she plans to help her husband provide for the schooling of their children.

loans.use: to buy rice and vegetable and palm oil for resale.

loans.name: Topista's Group

texts.en:
Topista is 22 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is married and has three children, all of whom are currently in school. Topista has a small hotel that sells food, which she has run for three years.
To help expand her business, Topista has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more cups and food for the hotel. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Topista hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for her family. In the future, she hopes to buy a plot of land and build a house.
Topista is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by generating more capital from her business.

loans.use: to purchase more cups and food for the hotel.

loans.name: Zedy

texts.en:
Zedy has been in mixed farming for 14 years, producing tea and milk and selling to the local market. She is married with three children aged between 7 and 11. Her family resides in the Litein area of South Rift Kenya where she does farming. She gets additional income from selling honey.

Zedy has requested a loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a dairy cow. She says the income generated will go toward paying the school fees for her children..She is focusing on acquiring pure breeds for better income generation in the future.

She notes the unreliability of milk prices is a great challenge owing to the fact that animal feed is expensive.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Halima's Group

texts.en:
Halima is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is married and has two children, neither of whom are currently in school. Halima has a business selling cooking stoves, which she has run for four years.
To help expand her business, Halima has requested a loan of 350,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase materials for making cooking stoves for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Halima hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself – for example, by buying new clothes. In the future, she hopes to open a charcoal sales business.
Halima is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has aided her prospects for the future by helping her generate more capital for her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials for making cooking stoves for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: ro purchase wheat seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase wheat seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy tomatoes, apples and bananas for resale

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary, 50, is married to Edward, who is a contractor, and is blessed with two children aged 30 and 24. She has been in crop farming and dairy farming for 15 years. The business earns her a monthly income of KES 27,000.

This is her fifth loan with KADET LTD, and she has a good credit history. She will use the loan funds to buy a Friesian dairy cow for milk production.

She intends to use the expected profits to expand her farming and hopes to be a big supplier of milk and farm products in the future.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production

loans.name: 49,ttvanha. Thieuhoa Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thom works in agriculture raising food. She is requesting a loan to invest in her business.

Thom is 37 years old and she is married with two children. She is the group leader of the 49.TT Van Ha solidarity group, which consists of three members. 
She lives and works in the Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with two dependents.


Thom has been involved in this business for three years. The main hardship that Thom faces in her business is the lack of capital. This is her first loan with the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Thom hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for vegetables and trees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy groceries and eggs to sell and to repair his stall

loans.name: 1 Chợ Điện Biên Group

texts.en:
Thuý is 42 years old and is married with three children. She lives with no dependents in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province. For the past five years, Thuý has operated a food stall where she sells vegetables. One of her most critical business difficulties is the lack of capital.

Thuý is requesting a loan to purchase fruit to sell and to invest in her business. This will be her first loan with the Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. With the profit from her loan, Thuý hopes that her business will do well, her children will have a good life, and she will be able to remodel her house.

loans.use: to purchase fruit to sell

loans.name: 5 Chợ Điện Biên Group

texts.en:
Tiến is 49 years old and married with two children. She lives with no dependents in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province. Tiến is the leader of a five-member group called the 5 Điện Biên Solidarity Group. For the past seven years, she has operated a food stall where she sells fermented pork rolls. The main business hardship that Tiến faces is the lack of capital.

Tiến is requesting a loan to purchase pork pies and fermented pork roll to sell to invest in her business. This will be her first loan with the Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. With her business profit, Tiến hopes that her business will do well and her family's life will improve.

loans.use: to purchase pork pies and fermented pork roll to sell

loans.name: 7 Chợ Điện Biên Group

texts.en:
Lanh is 49 years old and married with two children. She lives without dependents in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province. Lanh is the leader of a four-member group, the 5.1.7 Điện Biên Solidarity Group. For the past five years, Lanh has operated a retail business where she sells processed seafood. Her lack of business capital always causes her anxiety.

Lanh is requesting a loan to purchase more goods to sell and to invest in her business. This will be her first loan with the Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. With her profit, Lanh hopes to remodel her house and expand her store.

loans.use: to purchase processed seafood to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cereals such as rice, lentils, and peas to cook and sell

loans.name: Shadia

texts.en:
Shadia is 30 years old and married with three children between the ages 6 and 13 years old. She also has three dependents.  She sells milk, bread, etc. She runs her business from 6 am until 9 pm every day and she has three years of experience in this business. 

Shadia has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company to purchase more milk, bread, cooking oil, etc in her supermarket to sell. She plans to reinvest the additional profit in her business and save for her future.

loans.use: To buy more milk, bread, etc. to sell

loans.name: Ana Cenobia

texts.es:
Ana de 48 años es una mujer muy emprendedora ; ella vive en el barro Los Altos del Bosque de la ciudad de Cartagena con su esposo y sus tres hijos en las edades de 22 a 26 años, conlos que sueña cumplan sus propios sueños y son su inspiración en el trabajo independiente que realiza, mediante el cual  fabrica ropa  especialmente femenina y que  inició buscando la oportunidad de tener un ingresos para apoyar la gestión de su esposo en su hogar,  sin descuidar la  educación  y formación personal de sus hijos .  Esta fue la razón por la cual estudió el arte de confecciones con el cual lograría los dos objetivos y finalmente emprendió su aventura,  iniciando con un taller de confecciones  en su propia casa, con el que gradualmente ha crecido y proyecta desarrollarlo  hasta conseguir que genere puestos de trabajo. 
Su Credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace Ana a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  con el  comprará telas, hilos botones y una fileteadora semiindustrial, con la cual cualificará su tarea productiva, mejorara los tiempos del proceso y finalmente responderá oportunamente a pedidos de nuevos diseños en la línea femenina.
texts.en:
Ana, 48, is a very enterprising woman. She lives in the Los Altos del Bosque neighborhood of the city of Cartagena with her husband and three children aged 22 to 26. She dreams that her children may fulfill their own dreams. They are her inspiration in the independent work she does, in which she makes clothing, especially women's clothing. She began her work looking for an income opportunity to support her husband's leadership in their home, without neglecting the education and upbringing of her children. This was the reason she went to school to study dressmaking, by which means she would achieve her two objectives. Finally she started up her venture, beginning with a dressmaking shop in her own home. Gradually her business has grown and she plans to continue to develop it to the point at which it may generate some jobs for others.  

Her Kiva loan is the first financing Ana has had with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will purchase cloth, thread, buttons and a semi-industrial overlock sewing machine. With these she will evaluate her productive task, improve process times, and finally, respond quickly to orders for new designs in the feminine line.

loans.use: to purchase cloth, thread, button and a semi-industrial overlock sewing machine.

loans.name: 1 Phú Sơn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hương operates a food stall selling soup. She is requesting a loan to invest in her business.

Hương is 47 years old and she is married with two children. She is the leader of a 5-member group, the 7.1.1 Phú Sơn  solidarity group. Hương lives with two dependents in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Hương first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hương has been involved in this business for seven years. Her main difficulty is lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hương hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids and maintain her stall.

loans.use: To purchase more tables and food to maintain her food stall.

loans.name: 2 Phú Sơn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hoè works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to invest in her business.

Hoè is 64 years old and she is married with three children. She is the leader of a 7-member group, the 7.1.2 Phú Sơn  solidarity group. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents.

This is Hoè first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hoè has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is her lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hoè hopes for her children to find a good job and for her business to do well.

loans.use: To purchase breeding animals and cattle-feed.

loans.name: 3 Phú Sơn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Tuyên  has a service business cutting hair. She is requesting a loan to remodel her shop.

Tuyên  is 65 years old and she is married with three children. She is the leader of a 5-member group, the 7.1.3 Phú Sơn  solidarity group. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents.

This is Tuyên's  first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Tuyên  has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Tuyên  faces in her business is her lack of capital.

With her business profit, Tuyên  hopes to improve her quality of life and to help her children in their work.

loans.use: to remodel the barber shop.

loans.name: Ever

texts.es: El joven Ever oriundo de la localidad de el Torno, vive en el domicilio de su padre ubicado en la Junta Pirai,  es de ocupación moto taxista, trabaja en el torno, hace unos dos años se dedica a esta labor donde le va muy bien ya que esta afiliado al sindicato de moto taxis, el destino del crédito es para comprar una moto nueva y trabajarla y así generarle otros ingresos, se siente agradecido con la institución por el apoyo que se le a brindado.
texts.en:
The young man Ever, native of the population center of El Torno, lives in his father's home located in Junta Pirai. His occupation is providing taxi services by motorcycle. He works in El Torno. He has earned his living doing this work for two years and it is going very well since he is affiliated with a motorcycle taxi union. 

The purpose of the loan is to purchase a new motorcycle for his work and thus generate additional income. He appreciates the institution for the support it has provided him.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Nancy Elena

texts.es:
Nancy va por su cuarto crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y planea recibir su segundo credikiva, ella está satisfecha con sus avances en el negocio, porque ha logrado el aumento de su capital de trabajo y con ello la compra de materias primas para elaborar vestidos que ha vendido y con los que ha conseguido aumentar su clientela. Tambien  se siente muy feliz por encontrarse en su propia casa en el macroproyecto Ciudad Bicentenario, gestionado por la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo en su enfoque misional de construir comunidades sostenibles, allí está fortaleciendo su mercado con nuevos clientes. Su sueño más adelante es tener su propia boutique y hacer su casa de dos plantas para separar el espacio productivo del familiar; con su credikiva comprará telas e insumos de confección y mercancia como cosméticos y perfumeria que ya tiene encargados. 
Ella envía el siguiente mensaje a sus financiadores de Kiva: “Me siento agradecida y le pido a  Dios  que sigan ayudando y el programa siga extendiéndose a muchas familias.” Si usted quiere conocer la historia de Nancy ingrese al siguiente enlace: http://kiva.org/lend/235029
texts.en:
Nancy is negotiating her fourth loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and plans on getting her second Kiva loan.   She is satisfied with her business’ advances because she’s managed to increase her working capital and with it the purchase of raw materials to make dresses which, in turn, has led to an increase in customers.

She also feels very happy to be in her own house located in the Ciudad Bicentenario macro project managed by Fundación Mario Santo Domingo as part of its mission to build sustainable communities.  She is strengthening her market there with additional customers.  Her dream for later on is to own a boutique and to add a second story to her house in order to separate living quarters from business space.  She will use her Kiva loan to buy fabric and sewing supplies and merchandise like cosmetics and perfume that she already has orders for.

She sends the following message to Kiva lenders:  “I feel very grateful and ask God that you will continue to help and that the program continues to reach many families.”

If you’d like know Nancy’s story, please enter the following link: 
http://kiva.org/lend/235029

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies and merchandise like cosmetics and perfume.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a jack of all trades. From serving in the Army to working at Lockheed Martin to running his own business, one thing has remained constant in his professional life: the business of fire extinguishing. 

John first experienced the fire extinguisher business during his time in the Army. From 1963-1966, while stationed in South Korea, a medical issue prevented John from getting clearance to work in the field, so he remained on the base working with fire extinguishers. During this time, he got certified with the National Fire Protection Association to work with fire extinguishers, a fact which would serve him well in the years to come.

After his release from active duty in 1966, John continued his work in the business. He got his state license to work with civilian fire extinguishers, which he says wasn’t a problem because of his experience in the Army and the referrals he secured from that work. Shortly afterward, he began working for Lockheed Martin, and, in 1993, he added another full-time endeavor to his career. While continuing to work for Lockheed Martin, he began running his own fire extinguishing business, servicing clients as large as the University of Texas.

For medical reasons, John retired from Lockheed Martin and his business when he qualified for retirement benefits in 1998. He then spent several years working on a music career, working mostly with nursing and retirement homes. However, after the music equipment became too heavy for him to manage himself, he decided, in 2010, to get back into the fire extinguisher business.

John started “It’ll Work Fire Extinguishers” in May 2010. In his own words, “We sell and service fire extinguishers to residential, commercial, restaurant, and industrial businesses.” As a result of his previous experience owning a business, John says that it only took about one year for business to pick up. Though he says that "It’ll Work" is operating with about 60% of his previous client base, business is growing along with the economy, and he anticipates significant growth in the coming years. 

John’s loan will allow him to purchase a "Supercan" into which he dumps the fire extinguisher’s chemicals after service. He will also purchase a Dry Chemical Extraction pail with a mechanism to fill the fire extinguishers. Finally, he will make a down -payment on his insurance, pay the state registration fee for the business, and, as he says, will “probably do mail-outs (advertisements) with the rest.”

This loan will take John’s business a long way and will allow him to continue providing safe and reliable service to all of the clients in his community.

loans.use: to pay for fire extiguisher equipment, business insurance, state registration fees, and mail-out advertisements.

loans.name: 4 Phú Sơn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Lan has a retail business selling dry food. She is requesting a loan to maintain her business.

Lan is 45 years old and she is married with two children. She is the leader of a 7-member group, the 7.1.4 Phú Sơn  solidarity group. Lan lives with two dependents in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Lan's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Lan has been involved in this business for four years, but she hasn't enough capital at present.

In the future, Lan hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids and to extend her business.

loans.use: To purchase more food to resell.

loans.name: Vicenta Lourdes

texts.es: La Sra. Vicenta  tiene como actividad la venta D. comida, actividad que desarrolla solo los fines D. semana, solo los días domingos, preparando lechón y pollo al horno esta actividad la desarrolla conjuntamente con su hijos y su esposo quienes le ayudan en esta actividad, el destino del crédito es para la compra D. un horno mas granD. y una freidora  para aumentar su productividad y poder ampliar su  snack, la Sra. realiza muy ricos sus platos y es muy conocida por el lugar por la buena atención que brinda a su clientes, es una persona muy trabajadora agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Vicenta’s activity is food sales, an activity she does only on weekends, specifically on Sundays.  She prepares roasted piglet and roasted chicken.  Her children and husband help her with this activity.

The loan will be used to buy a larger oven and a fryer to increase production and be able to expand her snack bar.  She makes very delicious dishes and is well known in the place for the good service she provides her customers.  She’s a very hard working person who is grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy an industrial oven and a deep fryer.

loans.name: Reuben

texts.en:
Reuben is a farther of seven, all adults but with two still attending post secondary education. He has been in farming for 20 years and currently employs two farmhands. His farm produces tea, maize and milk. He has low-rental houses.

Reuben has made a loan request amounting to 70,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a dairy cow. He says the cow will provide milk for the family and provide more to sell for meeting other basic needs. He is focusing on building a dairy unit for his animals.

Reuben is however disturbed by the high cost of animal feed which he says is a challenge in dairy farming.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Sanabar

texts.ru:
Санабар родилась в селе Шарк  (Карасуйский район, Ош обл., Кыргызская Республика). Ей 49 лет. Санабар вдова, имеет 4 детей. 
Санабар родилась в простой семье. Она была старшим ребенком в семье с 10 детьми, большую часть времени она посвящала домашним хлопотам: присматривала за младшими братьями и сестрами, занималась домашней работой и небольшим хозяйством. Санабар в детстве мечтала стать учительницей, но увы жизнь заставила ее пойти совсем по иному пути.  В 1980 году она окончила школу, а в 1981 году родители, в соответствии с древней традицией,  выдали замуж Санабар в  Алайский район.  В 1983 году у молодой семьи родился первенец,  по законам шариата молодожены остались жить в родительском доме, так как муж Санабар был младшим сыном.  Муж честно трудился в колхозе, сама Санабар занималась домашней живностью,  к тому времени у них уже было 2 малышей, земли выделенной колхозом было мало, так как в то время на каждую семью выделялся лишь участок в 2 сотки, на котором практически нечего было сажать, затраты не покрывались полученным урожаем. Шли годы, семья теперь уже состояла из 6 человек. Муж Санабар был преуспевающим фермером в родном селе, но в 2002 году на семью обрушалась беда - неизвестные убили мужа Санабар.  Через 5 лет Санабар с детьми  решают перебраться в Чуйскую долину.    В 2007 году семья покупает дом в селе Полтавка  и начинает бизнес в разведении скота с покупки одной лошади. С тех самых пор прошло 4 года, через многие испытания прошла семья, но благодаря упорству и трудолюбию Санабар, ее бизнес стал успешным. Сегодня в хозяйстве 2 кобылы и 4 барана, дополнительно занимаются выращиванием свеклы и продают кумыз (кобылье молоко). Санабар запрашивает кредит в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) для покупки двух кобыл для откорма. Доход от кредита Санабар планирует использовать для дальнейшего увеличения своего бизнеса.    
ЗАО МФК "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" предоставляет кредиты по линии Кива для социально-уязвимых слоев населения. ЗАО МФК "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" является одной из лидирующих Микрофинансовых организаций Кыргызстана. "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" – это надежный финансовый партнер, осуществляющий вклад в развитие экономики Кыргызской Республики путем предоставления доступных микрофинансовых услуг в сельской местности и городах, способствующих созданию рабочих мест и отвечающих интересам своих клиентов и инвесторов.
texts.en: Sanabar was born in the Shark village (Kara-suu district, Osh province, Kyrgyzstan).  She is 49 years, a widow and has four children.  Sanabar was born in a simple family.  Being the oldest child in the family of ten children, she spent the majority of her time taking care of the household, such as looking after her younger brothers and sisters, doing household and caring for a small farm.  During her childhood, Sanabar dreamed of becoming a teacher, but her life forced her to pick a different destiny.  She finished school in 1980, and, according to an old tradition, her parents married her off to the Alay district in 1981.  The young family had their first child in 1983.  According to the sharia law, newlyweds remained living in the parents' home because Sanabar's husband was the youngest son.  Sanabar's husband diligently worked at a collective farm, and Sanabar took care of the domestic animals.  By that time, they already had two young children.  The collective farm allotted them very little land because at that time, one family got only 200 square meters.  It was impossible to grow anything on such a small plot of land, and the family's expenses exceeded the profits.  Years passed, and the family grew to six people.  Sanabar's husband was a leading farmer in his native village, but disaster fell on the family in 2002, when Sanabar's husband was killed by unknown men.  Five years later, Sanabar and her children decided to move to the Chui valley.  The family bought a house in 2007 in the Poltavka village and started a livestock breeding business with the purchase of one horse.  Four years passed since then, and the family experienced many challenges during this time, but thanks to Sanabar's persistence and hard work, her business became successful.  Now the household has two horses and four sheep.  In addition, the family grows beats and sell kumyz (horse milk).  Sanabar is requesting a loan in the sum of 100,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of two horses for fattening up.  Sanabar plans to use the loan for continued development and growth of her business.

loans.use: to purchase horses and grow her business

loans.name: 5 Phú  Sơn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Cấp has a retail business selling dry food. She is requesting a loan to invest in her business.

Cấp is 66 years old and she is married with three children. She is the leader of a 5-member group, the 7.1.5 Phú Sơn  solidarity group. Cấp lives with no dependents in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Cấp's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Cấp has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Cấp hopes for her children to find a good job  and to remodel her stall.

loans.use: To purchase more food to resell.

loans.name: Candida

texts.es:
Cándida de 66 años se siente muy feliz por encontrarse en su propia casa en el macroproyecto Ciudad Bicentenario, gestionado por la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo en su enfoque misional de construir comunidades sostenibles. Allí tiene su propio negocio llamado “Comercializadora La Niña Cande”  donde vende refrescos, pollo, carnes frías y mecatos, en un punto de venta que está gradualmente posicionándose en la medida en que crezca esta comunidad, que planea un número de 25 mil viviendas, por eso su proyección es firme. 
Cándida vivía en San José otro municipio del departamento de Bolívar de donde vino en condiciones de desplazamiento y perdió todos su semovientes, así fue que se instaló en Cartagena a construir suevos sueños y gradualmente ha progresado, consiguió su propia casa y una forma de generar ingresos mediante un negocio, con el que sueña hacerlo crecer, aumentando su capital de trabajo y con ello sus clientes; su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace a al Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará  en mayor volumen cajas de refrescos y bebidas, mecatos carnes frías y productos de la canasta familiar, que últimamente solicitan las amas de casa y son de rotación rápida. Su meta más adelante es adicionarle una panadería a su negocio, porque este oficio lo maneja perfectamente y hay un buen potencial de crecimiento en esta zona donde aún no existe una.
texts.en:
66 year-old Cándida is very happy to be living in her own home which is located in the Ciudad Bicentenario macro-housing project which is administered by Fundación Mario Santo Domingo as part of their social focus on creating sustainable communities.  Cándida has her own business there called "Comercializadora La Niña Cande” where she sells soft drinks, chicken, cold cuts and packed lunches from a sales location which is gradually positioning itself as the community grows.  There are plans to build 25,000 homes within the community and so the projection for her business is solid.

Cándida used to live in San José, another town within Bolívar department.  She was uprooted from there and lost all her livestock so she set up home in Cartagena in order to build new dreams.  She has gradually made progress.  She has obtained her own home and a way of making a living through a business.  She dreams of growing her business, increasing her working capital and also her number of customers.

This Kiva loan is the first loan that Cándida has received from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use it to buy crates of soda and drinks, packed lunches, cold cuts and essential household products in larger quantities.  Housewives have been requesting these products recently and they have a quick turnover.  Cándida's goal for the future is to add a bakery to her business because she can manage that trade perfectly and there is a good growth potential in her area as there is still no bakery there.

loans.use: to buy sodas and soft drinks, packed lunches, cold cuts and essential household products in larger volumes

loans.name: Lucia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Lucia, es madre soltera, vive con sus dos hijos de 11 y 4 años de edad, administra una panadería y vende ropa, aprendió el negocio de una tía, y tiene más de ocho años de existir, sus labores inician a las 3:00am cuando se levanta a preparar el pan para hornear, durante el día lo vende a los vecinos de la zona.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para invertirlo en materiales para hacer el pan, como huevos, manteca, harina, azúcar  y leche, esta compra será una gran ayuda para Lucia, ya que dispondrá de todos los materiales para continuar en su venta de pan.
Su objetivo es que sus hijos tengan lo necesario para su crecimiento, con una fuente de ingreso que le permita a ella comprarse toda la alimentación y medicamentos, además de tener el proyecto de mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Lucia is a single mother living with her two children who are 11 and 4 years old.  She runs a bakery and sells clothes.  She learned the business from an aunt and she’s been in business for 8 years.  Her work day begins at 3am when she gets up to prepare the bread for baking.  She sells all day to local residents.

She is asking for a loan to buy baking supplies like eggs, shortening, flour, sugar and milk.  This purchase will be very helpful for Lucia because she’ll have all the supplies on hand to continue with her bread sales.

Her goal is that her children have everything they need to grow, that she has a source of income that will make it possible for her to buy food and medicine and she also has a pending home improvement project.

loans.use: buy baking supplies like eggs, shortening, flour, sugar and milk.

loans.name: 6 Phú Sơn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Dung has a retail business selling dry food. She is requesting a loan to invest in her business.

Dung is 51 years old and she is married with two children. Dung is the group leader of the 7.1.6 Phú Sơn  solidarity group, which consists of 5 members. Dung lives with two dependents in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Dung's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Dung has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is her lack of capital.

With her business profit, Dung hopes to make enough money to take care of her kids, and to extend her house.

loans.use: To purchase more food to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizer and insecticide.

loans.name: Elvira Maria

texts.es: La Sra. Elvira tiene como actividad la venta de comida, actividad que desarrolla los fines de semana, a demás de tener como profesión ser enfermera. Ella vive junto a su hermana que al igual que ella es soltera, el destino del crédito es para poder mejorar la atención del micro snack que ella atiende con la compra de una broastera industrial y una spiedera, para así elaborar pollos al spiedo y a la broaster, ya que en el lugar es el único lugar donde venden comida y tiene mucha clientela, y poder mejorar sus ingresos y  así poder mejorar su calidad de vida, es una persona muy trabajadora agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Elvira’s activity is weekend food sales, an activity she does in addition to practicing her profession as a Nurse.  She lives with her sister who, like her, is single.  

The loan will be used to improve the service she provides in her small snack bar with the purchase of an industrial Broaster and a rotisserie roaster to make Broasted chicken and rotisserie roasted chicken since it’s the only place selling food and she has a lot of customers.  

She will be able to improve her income and her quality of life.  She’s a very hard working person who is grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy an industrial Broaster.

loans.name: Fanny Karina

texts.es:
Fanny de 33 años, vive en una zona peri-urbana en la Perimetral. Es soltera y tiene una hija que esta en escuela fiscal. Es comerciante y se dedica a la venta de ropa , sabanas y edredones.


Comenzó hace un tiempo atrás en la venta de artículos para el hogar , siempre le a gustado la ventas que se dedico a eso , vende artículos como ropa de todas clases edredones y sabanas y lo hace por medio de pedidos lo que deses sus clientes. Con la ayuda del préstamo quiere comprar mas mercadería y también adecuar su vivienda para tener una vida mejor para su hija y le que mas anhela que sea una niña de bien en sus estudios.
texts.en:
Fanny is 33 years old and lives in a peri-urban area of La Perimetral.  She is single and has one daughter who attends a public (state) school.  Fanny is a saleswoman who sells clothes, sheets and comforters.

Fanny started out some time ago selling household products.  She has always enjoyed selling things and so she made this her business.  She sells goods such as clothes (of all kinds), comforters and sheets.  She makes her sales to order.  With the help of this loan, Fanny would like to buy more merchandise and also do some work on her home so that her daughter can have a better life.  What she most wishes for is for her daughter to do well in her studies.

loans.use: to buy sheets, comforters, cement and sand

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy iron, sandpaper, a polishing disk, sheets of metal, saws and paint

loans.name: Jessica Veronica

texts.es:
