Jessica de 34años, vive en una zona peri-urbana en el Fortín de Guayaquil. Es casada y su esposo trabaja como chofer y tienen 2 hijos de 5 años estudia en escuela fiscal y otro de 6 meses. Ella se dedica a la confección y ventas de telas.

Comenzó su actividad hace 4 años ya que tiene un titulo de corte y confección y de allí decidió abrir su propia negocio de confección. Labora diariamente con una persona que le ayuda. Con la ayuda del préstamo desea comprar mas material para su costuras como rollos de telas hilos y botones. En un futuro desea tener su propio local.
texts.en:
Jessica, 34, lives in a peri-urban zone in El Fortín in Guayaquil.  She is married and her husband works as a driver.  They have two children; one is 5 years old and goes to public school and the other is 6 months old.  She is a dressmaker and fabric merchant.

She started her activity 4 years ago because she earned a degree in dressmaking and she decided to open her own dressmaking business.  She works every day with help from one other person.  With support from the loan she wants to buy more dressmaking supplies like bolts of fabric, thread and buttons.  In the future, she’d like to have her own locale.

loans.use: to buy bolts of fabric and other dressmaking supplies.

loans.name: 8 Phú Sơn Group

texts.en:
M. is 39 years old and she is married and has two children. She is the leader of a seven-member group, the 7.1.8 Phú Sơn solidarity group. M. lives in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

M. has a retail business selling dry food. She has been involved in this business for four years, but she undercapitalizes to maintain her business. M. is requesting a loan to maintain her stall. This is M.'s first loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, M. hopes to make enough money to provide for her children and to remodel her house.

loans.use: To purchase more food to resell.

loans.name: Jack Merlin

texts.es:
Jack de 57 años, vive en una zona urbana en el Guasmo (fue nombrado así debido a la especie de árboles Guazuma ulmifolia. El Guasmo es un barrio popular, de clase humilde, que anteriormente era una hacienda) de Guayaquil, su esposa se dedica al hogar y tiene hijos mayores de edad. Su actividad es el taller de automotriz.

Comenzó hace unos años atrás y escogió esa actividad de arreglar autos porque desde pequeño aprendió hacerlo, taller de 8H00 am a 6H00 pm. Con la ayuda del préstamo desea comprar mas repuestos para sus respectivas ventas a la vez para arreglos de vehículos para sus cliente a así aumentar sus ganancias. En un futuro quiere ampliar su taller.
texts.en:
Jack, 57, lives in an urban zone in El Guasmo, so called because of a species of tree: Guazuma ulmifolia.  El Guasmo is a low-income neighborhood which used to be a hacienda in Guayaquil.  His wife’s a housewife and he has adult children.  His activity is an auto repair shop.  

He started a few years back and chose the activity of repairing cars because he learned how when he was still a little boy.  The shop is open from 8am to 6pm.

With help from the loan he wants to buy more spare parts to sell and to use to repair his customers’ cars in order to increase profits.  In the future, he’d like to expand his repair shop.

loans.use: to buy automobile spare parts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es: El señor Julio es técnico electrónico, su taller lo tiene ubicado en la calle muy concurrida ahí brinda servicio técnico en reparación de televisores, computadoras, dvd´s, radios y todo tipo de aparatos electrónicos, vive en la zona de Tacagua en casa de su mamá con su esposa y sus hijos. Su esposa es enfermera y ayuda  con los gastos en alimentación y en educación, ambos trabajan muy duro por el bienestar de sus hijos, don Julio hace poco también incursionó en el negocio de la compra venta de televisores, ahora el crédito que solicita es para la compra de televisores y así poder arreglarlos y venderlos obtenido ganancias y así incrementar su capital en este nuevo emprendimiento, don Julio trabaja con la institución demostrando responsabilidad con sus pagos.
texts.en:
Julio is an electronics technician.  His shop is located on a very busy street.  He offers television, computer, DVD player, radio and all kinds of electronic equipment repair services.  He lives in the Tacagua zone in his mother’s house with his wife and children.  His wife is a nurse and helps cover food and education costs.  They both work very hard for the wellbeing of their children. 

A short time ago Julio started selling television sets.  Now, the loan he’s requesting is to buy television sets to repair and sell to obtain profits and increase his capital with this new enterprise.  Julio works with the institution demonstrating responsibility with his payments.

loans.use: to buy television sets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase drinks and bags of rice.

loans.name: Titus

texts.en:
Titus is a farther of three children who all attend school. 

He is a farmer in his hometown in the Nkubu area of Central Kenya. His farm produces milk, tobacco and maize, which all go to the local market and The Mastermind tobacco industries. He operates a motorcycle transport business besides his farming.

Titus has requested a loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a dairy cow. He says this will enable him to pay for the education of his children owing to improved income from the additional cow. He plans to buy more land to expand his farming.

Titus mentions the high cost of animal feed and insufficient rains as the challenges in the farming business.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: 10 Phú Sơn Group

texts.en:
Hợp is 54 years old. She is married and has two children. She is the leader of a three-member group, the 7.1.10 Phú Sơn solidarity group. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

Hợp has a retail business selling dry food. Hợp has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to invest in her business. This is Hợp's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

In the future, Hợp hopes for her children's work do well and to upgrade her stall.

loans.use: To purchase more food to resell.

loans.name: Korir

texts.en:
Korir  is married and has two children with one already in school. 

He has been in mixed farming for five years, producing tea and milk and selling to the local market. He gets additional income from his private veterinary services to the local farmers.

Korir has requested this loan of 70,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to enable him to construct a dairy unit for his animals. He is optimistic that the cows' production will improve and enable him to repay the loan and save more and acquire more dairy cows in the future.

He says his big challenge remains the fluctuating milk prices within the local market. He is glad Juhudi loans have empowered small farmers greatly.

loans.use: To construct a dairy unit.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel, es ganadero, vive con su esposa solamente, porque sus hijos ya están en sus respectivos hogares, él tiene más de 30 años de estar trabajando en la ganadería, ya que su padre desde muy joven le enseño a trabajar, inicia sus labores a las 4:00am hasta las 4:00pm, además de que también presta servicio de viajes de pasajeros.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para comprar ganado y también insumos para cultivar maíz,  como abono y fertilizantes, con esta inversión tendrá mejor hato ganadero, y al mismo tiempo su cosecha de granos básicos.
El sueño de Manuel es trabajar cada día mejor luchando contra las adversidades para lograr sobrevivir con su esposa.
texts.en:
Manuel is a rancher.  He lives alone with his wife as his children already live in their own households.  Manuel has been working in ranching for more than 30 years as his father taught him to work when he was very young.  He starts his work at 4.00am and keeps going until 4.00pm.  He also provides a passenger transport service.

Manuel is currently requesting a loan to buy cattle and also supplies for growing corn such as manure and fertilizers.  With this investment, he will have a better herd of cattle and a better harvest of basic grains.

Manuel's dream is to work better every day, fighting against setbacks so that he and his wife manage to survive.

loans.use: to buy cattle and also supplies for growing corn such as manure and fertilizers

loans.name: Nieves

texts.es: La señora Nieves es una señora líder, que trabajo excelente en una banca comunal, ahora trabaja de manera individual ella tiene el negocio de la venta de pantalones de varón en la feria 16 de julio, su puesto es propio , ella vive con su esposo y sus hijos, el mayor de ellos se enfermo de apendicitis y pese a esta situación ella logro salir adelante  con el apoyo de su familia, la señora nieves es muy trabajadora, y solidaria con sus compañeras su meta es sacar profesionales a sus hijos  y tener una casa propia para brindarles mayor comodidad, con el dinero del crédito comprar pantalones al por mayor para esta época de frio, la Sra. Nieves es una persona trabajadora agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Nieves is a leader who behaved excellently while in a communal bank.  Now, she’s acting as an individual.  She sells men’s pants at the 16 de Julio market.  She owns her stand.  She lives with her husband and children.  Her eldest got appendicitis and despite this situation she was able to get ahead with help from her family.

Nieves is very hard working and supportive of her companions.  Her goal is to see her children become professionals and to have a house of her own to provide more comfort.  She will use the money from the loan to buy pants at wholesale for this cold season.  Nieves is a hard working person who is grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy pants for the cold season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more soft drinks, alcohol, and food items.

loans.name: Emanuel

texts.en:
Emanuel is aged 32 and has been in farming for six years, producing tea and milk and selling to the local market in his hometown Litein, South Rift, Kenya.

Emanuel has made a request for 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a motorcycle in order to start up a transport business. He says the transport business has picked up in the area and the motorcycle will also help him bring his own produce to the market in a timely manner. He hopes the business will add to his farming income and expand the businesses significantly.

Emanuel points to drought and poor markets as the major challenges in farming.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans is a resident of Litein in South Rift, Kenya. He is aged 22 and married with one child aged one. He has been in active farming for four years, his farm producing  tea and milk which go to the local market.

Evans has requested a loan of 50,000 KES to purchase a motorcycle and venture into the transport business. He says the business is lucrative and he remains hopeful the venture will pay for the loan and provide the family with basic needs.

He points at rampant disease outbreaks as the main challenge in the farming industry and his main threat that has lead him to try the transport industry.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Fausto Bayardo

texts.en:
Fausto is 44 years old and lives in Tulcán, Ecuador with his wife and their 
two children, aged 22 and 14 years. He is cheerful, hardworking, humble, patient, and sociable. 
Fausto is a carpenter and he is seeking his first loan 
to purchase wood for his business. His art was taught to him by his father 
and he has perfected his craft over the years through his business. Thanks 
to his business, he is able to provide for his family. He works alongside his 
wife and a hired assistant. 
His business is established and is going well. He has a steady clientele that he serves.  He hopes that this loan will help him expand his woodworking techniques and improve his work. His goal is to 
grow professionally and expand his business by employing more people. 
By hiring more workers, he hopes to help his community.

loans.use: to purchase wood for his carpentry business.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is 29 years old and married with three children, aged between 9 months and 6 years. He runs a general merchandise store in Waterloo near Freetown.

Ibrahim has owned this business for eight years and sells cigarettes and milk at his store. His business is the only source of income he has. He says that the main challenge to his business is price inflation.

He requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase milk and general merchandise goods.  Ibrahim says that the extra income from this loan will help him take care of his family. In the future, he would like to be a supplier to other store owners.

loans.use: To purchase more milk and provisions.

loans.name: Maria Norma

texts.es:
María, se dedica a la venta de Hot Dog, vive con su esposo y una hija de 16 años de edad, ella trabaja vendiendo todos los días cerca de su casa, este negocio surgió por la necesidad de mantener a su familia, ayudando a su esposo con los gastos del hogar.
Su objetivo actualmente es comprarse una máquina de coser  ropa, para instalar una sastrería, por eso solicita un préstamo que le permita obtener dicha maquina y dar inicio a una nueva actividad.
Con esta inversión podrá aumentar sus ingresos, pues sería una nueva actividad la que tiene que atender, de la que espera mejorar junto a su familia y un día lograr comprarse su casa.
texts.en:
María sells hotdogs.  She lives with her husband and a 16-year-old daughter.  She sells every day near her house.  The business came about because she needed to support her family and help her husband cover household expenses.

Her goal currently is to buy a sewing machine to set up a tailor shop.  This is why she’s asking for this loan that will make it possible for her to acquire said machine and start a new business.

With this investment she will be able to increase income because it would be a new business to tend to which she hopes will help her and her family improve and one day be able to buy herself a house.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sewing necessities.

loans.name: Maricela Elizabeth

texts.es:
Maricela, vive con su familia, tiene un hijo D. 5 años D. edad, ella con su esposo trabajan la agricultura, sembrando frijol y maíz, desD. hace 10 años, ella contrata mozos para que le ayuden a realizar la tarea D. preparar el terreno y sembrar, el horario D. trabajo inicia a las 6:00am hasta las 3:00pm.
Ella actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra D. fertilizantes para el cultivo, ya que es parte importante para realizar la siembra, siempre se inicia abonando y fertilizando el terreno, esta compra D. materiales le ayudara a tener lo necesario a través del préstamo, aunque su riesgo siempre será la época lluviosa.
Su objetivo es ver crecer a su hijo, apoyarle en sus estudios y trabajar arduamente para conseguir sus objetivos.
texts.en: Maricela lives with her family and 5-year old son.  Her husband and her have worked in agriculture for the last 10 years, growing corn and beans.  She employs farm hands to prepare the soil and plant crop seed, working from 6:00am to 3:00pm.  Maricela seeks this credit to purchase fertilizer to increase her crop yield, and hopes to overcome the uncertainty of the rainy season for growing her crops.  She hopes to be able to give her son a good education, and to meet her goals to prosper.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for crops

loans.name: Ivan Fernando

texts.en: Ivan is 46 years old and lives in the city of Tulcán in northern Ecuador. He is married and lives with his wife and their 22-year-old son. He is a happy person who, above all, is very responsible, friendly and hardworking. Ivan is seeking his first loan to buy supplies for his restaurant. His business began when he opened a very small restaurant with his wife as the cook. Her food is outstanding, but at the beginning they served only friends and acquaintances. As they learned more about running a restaurant, their business became well known and customers now seek them out. Right now, he continues to work with his wife and has hired a friend as a helper. Their business is going well because it has a good reputation. He hopes that this loan will help him increase his income. His dream is to open a second small restaurant where he can give the gift of employment to other people. In the future, he hopes his child will become a good professional and that his business will continue to grow.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his restaurant.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Virginia Adela

texts.es: La señora Virginia se dedica a la venta de masitas de repostería como ser donas,, galletas, alfajores, empanadas y otros actividad que la realiza hace 12 años,  el requerimiento del préstamo es para la compra de un carrito para la venta de sándwich en una escuela por que hay la oportunidad de tomar una tienda en alquiler esta razón le lleva a solicitar el crédito, la señora vive en casa de su mama que ya es de edad avanzada ella se hace cargo de su manutención y los gastos por enfermedad que ella tiene.  La señora Virginia está muy contenta con el financiamiento que se le otorgó por que indica que esta actividad que va a emprender le va a generar un ingreso extra y es una forma de empezar algo nuevo, sin dejar de lado la actividad de repostería, ya que le va muy bien con esta actividad, es una persona trabajadora agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Virginia has sold assorted baked goods like donuts, cookies, sponge cake, turnovers and others for 12 years.  The loan is needed to buy a small cart to sell sandwiches at a school because she has the opportunity to lease a store and this is why she’s asked for the loan.

She lives in her mother’s house because she is elderly and Virginia takes care of her and covers the medical expenses for the illness she has.  

Virginia is very happy with the loan she was granted because she indicates that this new activity she is going to start will generate extra income and it’s a way to start something new without having to set aside her pastry business because she does very well with it.  She is a person who is grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy a sandwich cart.

loans.name: Pasos Firmes Group

texts.en:
Ana is 62 years old and is the mother of six grown children. She runs her own business selling fresh produce such as fruits, vegetables, and meat, from her home in a sugar cane community, which lies in the eastern part of the Dominican Republic, specifically in the city of El Seybo. Ana is the leader of a group comprised of Haitians citizen who emigrated from Haiti many years ago to work in sugar cane production. 

Ana started her business around eight years ago when she began selling vegetables and fruit. She is excited to receive her eleventh loan from the Kiva partner Esperanza International. Ana will use her loan to increase her inventory and to expand her business into a grocery store. She will purchase more merchandise, including rice, beans, onions, eggplant, potatoes, salami, chicken, and many other goods. Ana also sells used clothing for men and women. 

Ana will use her business profit to continue to expand her business. She will also use part of her revenue to help support her three grandchildren who live with her, their mother, and her husband. Her grandchildren will start school in August, and Ana is planning to help to pay for their school uniforms and supplies.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as rice, beans, fruit, salami, chicken and other goods

loans.name: Nieves

texts.es: La Sra. Nieves  y su esposo son clientes antiguos D. la institución ellos tienen tres hijas y un hijo, ellos viven en la comunidad D. Unni la cual se encuentra a unos 20 min. D. nuestra institución D. Chasquipampa los buses no pasan con mucha frecuencia que solo pasan en ciertos horarios establecidos, el esposo trabaja como transportista en el radio taxi y ella venD. verduras en el mercado Rodríguez solo tres veces a la semana esos días ella va desD. muy temprano para comprar las verduras D. las señoras productoras para luego venderlos mas tarD., también produce en su comunidad los productos como ser: la papa, alverja, aba, etc. Ella en este momento necesita para aumentar su capital en mercadería comprando verduras por mayor ya que todo esta subido D. precio, es un apersona muy trabajadora agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Nieves and her husband are long-standing clients of our institution.  They have three daughters and one son, and live in the community of Unni which is 20 minutes away from our institution in Chasquipampa.  They do not have a very frequent bus service and the buses run to certain set timetables.  Nieves' husband works as a radio taxi driver and Nieves herself sells vegetables in Rodríguez market three times a week.  On those days, she goes out very early in the morning to buy vegetables from the ladies who produce them.  She re-sells them later in the day.  In her community, people produce products such as potatoes, peas, beans, etc.

At the moment, Nieves needs to increase her capital.  She will buy merchandise (vegetables) wholesale since everything has increased in price.  Nieves is a very hard-working person and is grateful to the institution for the support she has been offered.

loans.use: to buy vegetables in large quantities

loans.name: Matilde Dinarda

texts.es:
Matilde de 52 años,  es una mujer trabajadora que tiene un negocio de venta de productos Yanbal (compañía que da oportunidades a mujeres para ventas vender por catalogo productos de belleza). 

Poco a poco a incursionado en el mercado con diferentes productos que vende con una estrategia. Da a crédito los productos para que sus clientes le puedan pagar en diferentes plazos. Vende perfumes, cremas, desodorantes, maquillajes etc. Tiene tres hijos pero actualmente está separada por eso quiere continuar trabajando por eso quiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como perfumes, cremas, bisutería y así incrementar su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Matilde is 52 years old.  She is a hard-working woman who has a business selling Yanbal (company that gives women opportunities to sell beauty products by catalog) products.

Little by little she has entered the market with different products that she strategically sells.  She gives the products to her customers on credit, and they can pay in different installments.  She sells perfume, cream, deodorant, and make-up, etc.

She has three children.  She is currently separated, and that is why she wants to continue working.  Therefore, she wants the loan to pay for merchandise like perfume, cream, and costume jewelry to increase her working capital.

loans.use: to buy perfume, creams, and costume jewelry.

loans.name: Tito Santiago

texts.es:
Tito, es vendedor de hamacas y lazos, tiene tres hijos de 39, 36 y 38 años de edad, cada uno tiene su propio hogar, él tiene 20 años de dedicarse al negocio de la Jarcia, junto a su esposa lo fundaron, trabaja todos los días desde las 6:00am hasta las 5:00pm, su ventaja es tener muchos clientes conquistados.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de hamacas, pues las compra ya hechas para revenderlas, y no cuenta por el momento con lo suficiente ni en dinero ni en el inventario, para continuar con su negocio, con esta compra fortalecerá en el comercio, tendrá más oportunidades de venta y de generar ingresos.
Para tito su principal objetivo es tener una fuente de ingreso constante, que le ayude a ofrecer una buena condición de vida a su esposa.
texts.en:
Tito sells hammocks and ties for hammocks.  He has three children; ages 39, 36, and 38.  Each one has their own home.  

He has had his business, La Jarcia, for 20 years.  He and his wife founded the business.  He works every day from 6:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m.  His advantage is that he has won many customers.

He is requesting a loan to buy hammocks.  He buys them made, and he resells them.  At this time he does not have enough money or inventory to continue his business.  This purchase will strengthen his business, and he will have more opportunities to sell and generate income.

Tito’s main objective is to have a constant source of income that will help him provide his wife with good living conditions.

loans.use: to buy hammocks to sell.

loans.name: Adjenia Group

texts.fr: ADJENIA est un groupe de deux personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer leur activité, ce groupe sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. La présidente du groupe, Zénabou Titilayo (celle qui n'a pas de document en main), est née le 22 Décembre 1973 au Bénin et est mariée à un couturier du nom de Razak. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés, et à leur charge. Zénabou Titilayo et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants. Il y a près de dix ans que Zénabou Titilayo mène comme activité la vente de produits cosmétiques et de sous-vêtements de façon ambulante ; ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et de répondre aux besoins de sa famille. Zénabou Titilayo fait ses achats au Togo et au Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Zénabou Titilayo sollicite un crédit avec le second membre du groupe ADJENIA. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en: Adjenia is a group of two people who live in the same district in Benin. With the aim of strengthening their business, this group is requesting a second loan from Alidé. The president of the group, Zénabou Titlayo (the woman who is not holding a document in the photo) was born on 22nd December 1973 in Benin and is married to a tailor by the name of Razak. The couple has three children, all at school and in their care. Zénabou Titlayo and her husband live with their children. For almost ten years Zénabou Titilayo has been selling cosmetics and underwear on a door-to-door basis; this allows her to provide for her own needs as well as those of her family. She buys her products in Togo and in Benin. In order to satisfy customer demand she is requesting a loan with the second member of the Adjenia group. This loan will allow her to satisfy customer demand more readily and to make more money.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and underwear

loans.name: Florentin

texts.es:
Florentín, vive con su esposa, es agricultor y también trabaja como motorista de un bus urbano, tiene tres años de ser motorista, y la agricultura la practica desde hace 10 años, trabaja todos los días de 6:00am a 4:00pm.
Actualmente está iniciando sus labores en la siembra de maíz, para esto solicita un préstamo e invertirlo en abono y fertilizantes, esta compra es muy importante para él, pues contara con lo necesario para sembrar.
Su aspiración es algún día a través de su trabajo poder construir su casa y tener mejores posibilidades económicas.
texts.en:
Florentín lives with his wife.  He is a farmer, and he also works as an urban bus driver.  He has been a driver for three years, and he has been a farmer for ten years.  He works every day from 6:00 a.m. until 4:00p.m.  He is currently starting his work planting corn.  

That is why he is requesting a loan to buy natural and chemical fertilizers.  This purchase, to have what he needs in order to plant, is very important to him.

His aspiration is to one day, through his work, be able to build his house.  He also aspires to have better financial options.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies, natural and chemical fertilizers.

loans.name: San Juaquin 2 Group

texts.es: El banco D. emprendimiento "SAN JUAQUIN 2" se encuentra en su segundo ciclo, el cual esta conformado por personas responsables y trabajadoras, este Banco D. Emprendimiento esta representado por las siguientes socias: Presidenta la señora Roció quien es soltera, se dedica a la confección D. artesanías en tela y lana, es una joven responsable y trabajadora que sola mantiene su hogar con el dinero D. crédito comprar tela y lana e hilos para la confección D. sus artesanías, es una persona trabajadora agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: The "San Juaquin 2" community bank is in its second loan cycle.  The bank is maD. up of responsible and hard-working people and is represented by  Roció, the bank president, who is single and makes handicrafts from fabric and yarn.  Roció is a responsible and hard-working young woman who is solely responsible for supporting her household.  She will use her loan money to buy fabric, yarn and threads for making her handicrafts.  She is a hard-working person who is grateful to the institution for the support they have offered her.

loans.use: to buy fabric and threads to make handicrafts

loans.name: Edjromigbe 2 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe EDJROMIGBE 2 est formé de deux personnes qui habitent toutes ensemble dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Mouniratou, est celle se trouvant à gauche de la photo. C’est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Mouniratou est mariée à un certain Raoul, mais n'a pas encore d'enfant. Il y a plus de dix ans que Mouniratou exerce comme activité, la vente de friperies et de cartes de recharges téléphoniques ; ce qui lui permet de se prendre en charge et de participer aux charges du ménage. Dans le souci de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Mouniratou désire augmenter le stock de ses produits. Pour ce faire, Mouniratou sollicite ensemble avec le second membre du groupe EDJROMIGBE 2, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The group EDJROMIGBE 2 is composed of two persons who live in the same neighborhood. The representative of the group is called Mouniratou and is the woman standing on the left in the photo. It's the first time that this group has requested financial help from  ALIDé in order to raise the level of their activities. 

Mouniratou is married to Raoul, but has not got any children yet. For more than ten years, she has been selling used clothing and rechargeable telephone cards. That allows her to support herself and help with household expenses. Wishing to better respond to the demand of her clientele,  Mouniratou would like to add to her inventory. In order to do this, she is requesting, together with the other person in the EDJROMIGBE 2 group, her very first loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy used clothing and rechargeable telephone cards.

loans.name: Illimani Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ILLIMANI” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Collpani, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Felicidad. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: comercio de chalinas, producción y servicio.
 
La señora Felicidad,  indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer  y que ingreso por invitación de una promotora que visito su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de chalinas, que viene trabajando hace veinte años atrás, aprendiendo el mismo de su madre.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para la compra de material (compra de chalinas), este material lo compra de la calle Buenos Aires y viajes a Desaguadero, posteriormente lo venderá en las ferias de lunes a viernes. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.
texts.en:
The “Illimani” communal bank will start its first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Collpani Center.  It has 8 members led by a governing board headed by Felicidad.  The members of this communal bank are in a variety of businesses among which we have:  scarves sales, production and service.

Felicidad indicates that this is the first time she’s participated in Pro Mujer and she joined thanks to an invitation from a promoter who visited her at home.  She currently sells scarves and has been in business for the last 20 years having learned the business from her mother.

The loan she will take out is to buy merchandise (scarves).  She buys it on Buenos Aires Street and on trips to Desaguadero and then sells them later on at the Monday and Friday markets.  She generates income this way to help out her family as much as possible.  She is married and has two children.

loans.use: to buy scarves.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy iron, brass, copper and aluminum

loans.name: Odette Heureuse

texts.fr: Née le 24 Juillet 1983 dans une ville du Bénin, Odette Heureuse est mariée à un mécanicien du nom de Modeste. Le couple a trois enfants à charge, dont deux représentent leurs enfants. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés.  Odette Heureuse et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour assurer les différents besoins de sa famille, Odette Heureuse  mène comme activité la vente de produits de brasserie dans sa boutique située dans une ville du Bénin. Odette Heureuse  s’approvisionne dans les dépôts de boissons. C’est la première fois que Odette Heureuse sollicite auprès de ALIDé un crédit, en vue de rehausser le niveau de son activité, d’accroître sa clientèle et son revenu.
texts.en: Odette Heureuse was born on 24th July 1983 in a town in Benin and is married to a mechanic by the name of Modeste. The couple has three children in its care, of which two are their own children. All the children are at school. Odette Heureuse and her husband live with their children and together cover the various family expenses. In order to provide for the family's needs, Odette Heureuse has a business selling brasserie products in her shop, which lies in a town in Benin. She gets her supplies from a drinks warehouse. It is the first time that Odette Heureuse has requested a loan from Alidé, in order to increase her business volume, customer base and income.

loans.use: to buy bottled and canned drinks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ten sacks of corn

loans.name: Ana Lilian

texts.es:
Ana, venD. cosméticos, tiene casa propia, vive con dos hijos y su esposo; El negocio lo tiene en su propia casa y también sale a ofrecer D. forma ambulante, tiene 14 años D. estar en el negocio, hasta el momento gracias a Dios no ha tenido dificultades.
Ella solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en mercadería, comprando lociones, cremas, shampoo, maquillaje y ropa interior, con este préstamo lograra su proyecto D. aumentar su mercadería y ofrecer a los clientes mayor diversidad D. productos D. belleza.
Su aspiración es tener un negocio estable, con un local fijo en el M., D. esta manera se dará a conocer más y mejoraran sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Ana sells cosmetics.  She has a house of her own and lives with two children and her husband.  Her business is home-based and she also goes out to sell door to door.  She’s been in business 14 years and to date, thanks to God, she’s had no difficulties.

She requests a loan to buy merchandise like lotions, creams, shampoo, makeup and underwear.  With the loan she will attain her project of increasing merchandise and offering customers more variety of beauty products.

Her goal is to have a stable business with a fixed locale in the market so she will be better known and her income will improve.

loans.use: to buy lotions, creams, shampoo, makeup and underwear.

loans.name: Los Claveles Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LOS CLAVELES” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Collpani, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Isabel. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: Tienda de barrio, venta de abarrotes, venta de estuco, comercio, producción y servicio.
 
La señora Isabel,  indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer  y que ingreso por invitación de una promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene una tienda de abarrotes, que inicia conjuntamente este prestamo, aprendiendo el mismo de su madre.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para la compra de material (compra de estuco), este material lo compra de la zona Pacajes, posteriormente lo venderá en su tienda de la zona Santa Barbara. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la que la el préstamo es rápido.
texts.en:
The Community Association “LOS CLAVELES" is beginning its first season with Pro Mujer ("For Women"),  as part of the Collpani Center.  The association is made up of nine members and is led by a board headed by Señora Isabel.  The businesses that community association members participate in are varied.  Among them are: neighborhood stores, grocery sales, sale of plaster, trade, production and services.

Señora Isabel indicates that it is the first time they are joining with Pro Mujer, and the entry came at the invitation of a promoter.  Today she has a grocery store, which will be the first one to start with this loan.  She learned the same business from her mother.

The loan that she will now draw on is for the purchase of materials (purchase of plaster).  She purchases this material from the Pacajes area, then sells it at her shop in the ​​Santa Barbara area. This type of work allows her to generate resources to support her family as much as possible, because she lives with her partner and three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replies that she likes that the loan is fast.

loans.use: to purchase plaster

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Dosseh Théophile

texts.fr: Né le 30 Juin 1974, Dosseh Théophile est marié à une coiffeuse du nom de Onance. Le couple a quatre enfants à charge, dont trois sont les leurs. Parmi les enfants, certains sont scolarisés. Dosseh Théophile vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants. Dosseh Théophile subvient ensemble avec sa femme, aux besoins de la famille. Dosseh Théophile est un décorateur et exerce cette activité depuis une douzaine d’année dans un quartier du Bénin. En vue d’acquérir un outil de travail performant lui permettant de mieux satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle dans un bref délai, Dosseh Théophile sollicite un second crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le premier crédit dont Dosseh Théophile a bénéficié antérieurement a été bien remboursé.
texts.en: Dosseh Théophile was born on 30th June 1974 and is married to a hairdresser by the name of Onance. The couple has four children in its care, of which three are their own children. Some of the children are at school. Dosseh Théophile lives with his wife and children, and he and his wife provide for the family's needs between them. Dosseh Théophile is a decorator and has been carrying out this activity for around twelve years in a district of Benin. With a view to acquiring an efficient working tool and satisfying customer demand more rapidly, he is requesting a second loan from Alidé. His first loan was repaid in full and on time.

loans.use: to buy a computer

loans.name: Afi Délali

texts.fr: Revendeuse de boisson locale (boisson très appréciée chez nous faite à base de palmier à huile). Afi  a 31ans et a 01 enfant. Ce prêt lui servira à acheter du SODABI à TSEVIE et à KPALIME.
texts.en: A retailer of a local beverage (which is much appreciated among us) made from the oil palm, Afi is a 31-year-old woman who has one child. This loan will be used to buy SODABI in TSEVIE and in KPALIME.

loans.use: to buy SODABI

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Disenia Dolores

texts.es:
Disenia, es comerciante de verduras, vive con su esposo y dos hijos de 5 y 4 años de edad, Ella es comerciante, tiene un puesto de venta en el mercado municipal, ofrece verduras en un horario de 7:00am a 4:00pm.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para comprar plátanos, repollo, tomates, cebollas, con esta compra fortalecerá el negocio, aumentando el número de verduras, para ofrecer a los clientes.
Sus aspiraciones es tener el negocio fuerte, con mayores posibilidades de ingresos, viendo la forma de mejorar y que sus hijos puedan crecer sanamente.
texts.en:
Disenia is a vegetable merchant.  She lives with her husband and two children who are 5 and 4 years of age.  She’s a merchant and has a stand in the municipal market selling vegetables from 7am until 4pm.

She currently requests a loan to buy bananas, cabbage, tomatoes and onions.  She will strengthen the business with this purchase increasing the number of vegetables she has in stock for customers.

Her goal is to have a thriving business with better income generating capabilities aimed at improving and so that her children can grow up healthily.

loans.use: to buy bananas, cabbage, tomatoes and onions.

loans.name: Portales Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama "Portales". Está ubicado en el Estado de Puebla en México. El grupo está conformado por 9 integrantes; la señora María es la presidenta del grupo. Ella tiene 58 años, estudió hasta el sexto de primaria, es casada y tiene 3 hijos. Ella se dedica a la cria y compra de animales aparte que tiene vacas de las cuales obtiene leche para vender con las personas de su comunidad este negocio lo inicio hace 30 años. Solicita el préstamo para comprar más animales para su ganado. Sus clientes son el público en general. Al momento de solicitar este préstamo se siente entusiasmada ya que tiene la oportunidad de invertir en su ganado para incrementar sus ventas. También espera que con este préstamo y su esfuerzo pueda tener una mejor calidad de vida para ella y su familia y así apoyar a su esposo en los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
This group is called “Portales” and is located in the State of Puebla in México.  It has 9 members and María is the group President.  She is 58 years old and went up to 6th grade.  She’s married and has three children.

She raises livestock to sell and also has cows that produce milk that she sells to people in the community; she started this business 30 years ago. 

She is asking for a loan to buy more animals for her herd.  Her customers are the general public.  She is very excited about the loan because it gives her the opportunity to invest in livestock to increase her sales.  She also hopes that with this loan and her effort she will be able to have a better quality of life for her and her family and to help her husband meet family expenses.

loans.use: to buy more livestock.

loans.name: Martha Alicia

texts.es:
Martha, vive con su madre una señora de 70 años de edad, y dos hijos de 16 y 10 años de edad, ella es comerciante de pan dulce, compra y vende todos los días, su puesto está instalado en el mercado municipal, su horario es de 6:00am a 5:00pm.
Actualmente requiere de un préstamo para la compra de pan dulce y francés, con este préstamo se fortalecerá el negocio, teniendo mayor disponibilidad y variedad para ofrecer a los clientes.
Ella aspira algún día tener su propia panadería,  con esfuerzo y mucha dedicación espera algún día realizarlo, pero actualmente con este préstamo está más segura  de la inversión.
texts.en:
Martha lives with her mother, a 70-year-old woman, and with her two children who are 16 and 10 years of age.  She sells sweet bread.  She buys and sells daily.  Her stand is located in the municipal market.  Her schedule is 6am to 5pm.

She currently needs a loan to buy sweet and French bread.  With this loan she will strengthen the business having more and more varied available stock for her customers.

She hopes someday to have her own bakery and with much work and dedication expects to accomplish it someday.  However, with this loan she is surer of the investment.

loans.use: to buy sweet and French bread to resell.

loans.name: Milluni Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MILLUNI” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Rosa. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de jugos, artesanía en tejido de vicuñas, venta de comida, cerrajería.
 
La señora Rosa,  indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer  y que ingreso por invitación de una promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de elaboración de artesanías, que viene trabajando hace diez años atrás.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra hilo, lana, etc.), este material lo compra de la Ceja y la 16 de julio, por mayor, posterior a la elaboración lo distribuirá a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para ella, pues es soltera.
texts.en:
The “Milluni” communal bank will start its first cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Panamericana Center.  It has 8 members led by a governing board headed by Rosa.  The members of this communal bank carry out a variety of businesses.  Among them are:  games sales, vicuña wool textiles, food sales and metal shop. 

Rosa indicates that this is the first time she’s joined Pro Mujer and that she was invited by a promoter.  She currently has a business making crafts that she’s had for the last 10 years.

The loan she will take out now is to increase her capital (she will buy yarn, wool, etc.)  She buys these materials in La Ceja and at the 16 de Julio Market at wholesale.   After she completes making the crafts she sells them on order.  This way of working allows her to generate income for herself since she’s single.

loans.use: to buy yarn, wool, etc.

loans.name: Dorotea Del Carmen

texts.es:
Dorotea, vive con sus hijos D. 16 y 6 años D. edad, administra una tienda y venta D. ropa, este negocio surgió por iniciativa propia hace 4 años, está ubicado en un local del mercado municipal, su horario es D. 6:00am a 5:00pm.
Ella quiere un préstamo para invertirlo en prendas D. vestir como blusas, faldas, jeans, ropa interior, pues su deseo D. fortalecer el negocio solo se pueD. realiza a través D. un financiamiento, que le permita tener a los clientes nuevas prendas para sus exigencias.
La principal aspiración D. Dorotea es desarrollarse como comerciante, mantener un negocio con suficiente mercadería que le genere mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Dorotea lives with her children who are 16 and 6.  She runs a clothes store.  This business came about through her own initiative four years ago.  It is located in premises in the town market.  She works from 6.00am to 5.00pm.

Dorotea would like this loan to invest in clothes such as blouses, skirts, jeans and underwear as she can only achieve her desire to strengthen her business through taking a loan.  This will allow her to have new clothes with which to meet her customers' demands.

Dorotea's main aspiration is to make progress as a saleswoman and maintain a business with enough merchandise that makes her better profits.

loans.use: to invest in clothes such as blouses, skirts, jeans and underwear

loans.name: Jesukpego (Cocotomey) Group

texts.fr: JESUKPEGO (Cocotomey) est un groupement constitué de onze personnes et dont la présidente (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est nommée Christine. Les membres du groupe résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de roulement, ce groupement sollicite pour la deuxième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Née le 06 Avril 1965 au Bénin, Christine est mariée à un électricien du nom de Bertin et est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Christine vit avec ses enfants et assure leurs charges respectives grâce au revenu que lui procure son activité. Pour y arriver, Christine vend des tissus, des bijoux et des chaussures par le système de distribution. Christine achète ses produits au Bénin. Ce deuxième prêt permettra certainement à Christine et aux autres membres du groupement JESUKPEGO (Cocotomey), de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu.
texts.en: Jesukpego (Cocotomey) is a grouping of eleven people and its president (who has her hand raised in the photo) is called Christine. The group members all live in the same district of Benin. With a view to increasing their working capital, this group is requesting a second loan from Alide. Christine, who was born on 6th April 1965 in Benin, is married to an electrician called Bertin and is mother to three children, all of whom are at school. She lives with her children and provides for their respective expenses thanks to the income she gets from her business. She sells fabric, jewelry and shoes through the distribution system and buys her products in Benin. This second loan will without doubt allow Christine and the other Jesukpego (Cocotomey) group members to increase their business volume, their customer bases and their income.

loans.use: Acheter des tissus, des chaussures et des bijoux.

loans.name: Si/11364 Group

texts.fr:
Mme R.Julie Pascaline représente le groupe LA GRACE. Elle est mariée, mère de 3 enfants. Le plus âgé a 20ans et le moins âgé a 6ans.2 de ses enfants vont a l’école et elle a 3 personnes a sa charge.

Elle vend du savon depuis 1an. Mme s’approvisionne au marché de toécé dans un village environnant. Ses clients son les femmes.

Mme veut acheter 2 cartons de savon local et un carton de savon importer.

Ses économies serviront à ouvrir un kiosque. Elle ambitionne ouvrir une alimentation et construire une maison.
texts.en:
Ms. R. Julie Pascaline represents the group LA GRACE. She is married and the mother of three children. The eldest is 20 years old, and the youngest is 6. Two of her children go to school. And she has three persons to support. She has been selling soap for a year. She gets her supplies at the Toécé market in a nearby village. Her customers are women.  She wants to buy two boxes of local soaps and a box of imported soap.

Her savings will serve to open a kiosk. Her ambition is to open a grocery store and to build a house.

loans.use: to buy 2 boxes of local soap and a box of imported soap

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Ten years ago, Patricia decided to start her business, Loop Services & More, after realizing that her six years of experience in public notary could afford her a more lucrative career than working for someone else. She says that obtaining her license to practice public notary was the simple part; the difficult part was building up her reputation and gaining clientele.

One of the ways that Patricia has been able to build clientele is by offering several more services than the average public notary, including income tax filing, income tax preparation, mailing services and immigration paperwork. 

As a native Spanish speaker, Patricia is also able to provide access to all of these services for the Hispanic communities in the Texas-Mexico border city of Brownsville, where her business is located. Because many of her clients are not educated in the complexities of the government documents necessary to stay and work in the U.S., access to translations of these documents is of the utmost importance to them. She partially attributes her loyal clientele to her ability to provide these much needed services.

Patricia feels that her business has had two major successes so far. The first was the speed with which Loop Services was able to expand its clientele base. The second was a letter she received from the Internal Revenue Service thanking her for all of the people that she has helped with her business. Of this letter, she says, “(the letter) made me really happy because I enjoy helping my customers in whatever they need, even if it is just translating something for them.” 

In the future, Patricia hopes to expand her business to offer still more services and employment to her Brownsville community. She hopes to begin offering payment services for bills, money transfers, and money orders. Currently, she employs one other person, but she hopes that the expansion of her business will allow her to offer more employment to those who need it.

With this loan, Patricia bought a post box, painted her office, purchased two desks, and installed an office alarm system. She is in the process of dividing her office space into two different offices, reserving one side for public notary and the other for the services she wishes to add. The loan will also pay for the equipment and licenses needed for these new services. Finally, with the remaining money, Patricia will invest in publicity for her business to bring in more clients.

Her experiences in business have led Patricia to advise new entrepreneurs never to lose hope. She says, “I always saw my business as a job; you work to provide good customer service, and, if you’re doing well, the clients will come back.” With this simple, yet effective, business philosophy, Patricia hopes to continue expanding her business and serving the community around her.

loans.use: to pay for a post box, paint her office, purchase furniture and equipment, install an office alarm system and invest in publicity.

loans.name: Marina Esperanza

texts.es:
Marina, actualmente vive con su familia, tiene hijos pero ya no viven con ella porque están casados, ella tiene un negocio ubicado en el mercado municipal, vende ropa y mercería, trabaja de lunes a domingo y este negocio es el medio de donde obtiene ingresos para su familia.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa nueva, específicamente blusas, camisetas, faldas, ropa interior, también mercería cuchillo de cocina, utensilios de cocina como cucharas, tenedores.
Su objetivo es mejorar el negocio con esta inversión, para que su inventario tenga de todo lo necesario en los hogares, y así contar con la preferencia de muchos clientes, quienes le generan las ganancias para cubrir sus necesidades.
texts.en:
Marina currently lives with her family.  She has children but does not live with them because they are married.  She has a business located in the municipal market.  She sells clothing and haberdashery.  

She works Monday-Sunday and this business is how she earns the income for her family.  She is requesting a loan to buy new clothing, specifically blouses, t-shirts, dresses, undergarments, and other kitchen utensils such as knives, spoons and forks.  

Her goal is to improve her business with this investment so that her inventory has everything necessary for the home and so that she can have the preference of many customers, the ones who generate the most income to cover their needs.

loans.use: To purchase clothing: blouses, shirts, skirts, undergarments and also kitchen utensils such as spoons and forks.

loans.name: Tomasa Del Socorro

texts.es:
Tomasa, habita en Chacaraseca comarca de León  es madre de dos hijos de 3 y 2 años de edad respectivamente, esta casada, de oficio comerciante se dedica a la venta ropa, bisutería, electrodoméstico y mercadería en general.  Ella inicio a la edad de 19 años como comerciante con capital propio, ella vendía ropa y joyas de oro y plata a trabajadores de una fabrica textilera ellos fueron sus primeros clientes. Hoy en día ella vende mercadería en general ambulante sale a vender a León y Chinandega es una mujer emprendedora que le gusta el trabajo pues su mayor inspiración son sus hijos ya que por ellos es que trabaja muy duro.
Solicito el préstamo para  comprar más mercadería para vender tales como ropa, electrodomésticos, bisutería. Con esta inversión espera atraer mas clientes, ofrecer mayor productos a sus clientes, pues sus expectativas son de crecer, tener una tienda que ofrezca mercadería en General y estudiar una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Tomasa lives in Chacaraseca, León.  She’s the mother of two children who are 3 and 2 years of age respectively.  She’s married.  She’s a merchant selling clothes, costume jewelry, home appliances and general merchandise.  She started as a merchant at the age of 19 with her own capital.  She used to sell clothes and gold and silver jewelry to employees at a textile factory; they were her first customers.  Today, she’s a street vendor of general merchandise.  She goes out selling to León and Chinandega.  She’s an enterprising woman who enjoys her work because her greatest inspiration is her children and it’s for them that she works so hard.

She asked for the loan to buy merchandise like, clothes, home appliances and costume jewelry, to sell.  With this investment she will attract more customers and have a wider variety of products in stock because her expectations are to grow, to have a store stocked with general merchandise and to study a university career.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Angelo Benjy

texts.es: El joven Angelo  es soltero, tiene 22 años de edad,  Angelo estudia Electrónica Indusrial en un instituto de prestigio que le ha permitido trabajar  en una empresa como distribuidor de lubricantes solo los fines de semana donde realiza las función de repartidor de aceite, todo relacionado a lubricantes, Angelo escogió esta carrera porque  es su vocación y considera que el aplica la lógica y razonamiento para solucionar problemas referente a su carrera  , Su sueño de Angelo es brindarle a sus padres una mejor calidad de vida y de alguna forma devolverle a ellos todo lo que hicieron por él, con el fin de seguir creciendo a solicitado un  préstamo para pagar su matrícula y prácticas profesionales. Sabemos que Angelo  cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos de Edaprospo le ayudaran.
texts.en:
The young Angelo is 22 years old and single.  Angelo studies Industrial Electronics at a prestigious institute that allows him to work in a business distributing lubricants on the weekends where his role is distributing the oil and everything else relating to oil.  Angelo chose this profession because it is his vocation and he believes that he should apply the logic and reasoning to solve problems related to his career. 

His dream is to provide his parents with a better quality of life and somehow give back to them what they did for him.  In order to continue growing he is requesting a loan to pay for his tuition and professional practices.  We know that Angelo will achieve his goals with hard work and effort and with the help of the Edaprospo loan.

loans.use: To pay for his tuition and professional practices

loans.name: Ana Isabel

texts.es:
Ana, vende comida rápida como pupusas, tamales, pasteles y sodas, vive con su familia y tiene cuatro hijos de 12, 8, 6 y 2 años de edad, ella inicio el negocio hace diez años trabajando de lunes a domingo, este negocio es su fuente principal de ingresos.
Ella solicita un préstamo para comprar productos para elaborar la venta como maíz, tomates, frijoles, hojas de banano, pollo y bebidas, que son parte de los productos para las pupusas, tamales y pasteles, este préstamo le ayudara a mejorar el negocio.
Su aspiración es que sus hijos continúen estudiando, que a través del negocio pueda cubrir todos los gastos y necesidades de ellos.
texts.en:
Ana sells fast food such as pupusas, tamales, pastries, and sodas.  She lives with her family and has 4 children ages 12, 8, 6, and 2.  She started her business 10 years ago working Monday-Sunday.  This business is where she earns her main income. 

She is requesting a loan to buy products to expand sales such as corn, tomatoes, beans, banana leaves, chicken, and beverages which are the ingredients necessary to make pupusas, tomales, and pastries.  This loan will help her improve her business.

Her dream is for her children to continue studying and for this business to cover all of their expenses and needs.

loans.use: to buy materials to sell: corn, tomatoes, beans, banana leaves, chicken, and beverages.

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es:
Tomas, es comerciante de ropa, vive con su esposa y tienen dos hijos, todos trabajan en el hogar y él inicio el negocio gracias al apoyo de su esposa, no tiene un horario fijo, y tiene un buen record como comerciante, ha trabajado con créditos que son los que le han permitido alcanzar crecimiento.
Él Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa tanto para hombres y mujeres, como camisetas, blusas, pantalones, esta inversión le ayudara a mantenerse en el negocio contando con todo lo necesario para los clientes.
Para él, crecer y ser un empresario exitoso es su mayor deseo, aumentando  la clientela y alcanzando una mejor solvencia económica.
texts.en:
Tomas is a clothes salesman.  He lives with his wife and they have two children.  All the members of his household work.  Tomas started this business with the support of his wife.  He does not work fixed hours and he has a good record as a salesman.  He has worked with loans which have allowed him to grow his business.

Tomas is currently requesting a loan to buy men's and women's clothes such as t-shirts, blouses and pants.  This investment will help him to stay in business as he will have everything he needs for his customers.

Tomas' biggest wish is to grow and be successful as a businessman, increasing his number of customers and achieving better financial solvency.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (t-shirts, blouses and pants)

loans.name: Sonia Carolina

texts.es:
Sonia, vive con su familia, su madre y dos hijos, tiene casa propia, ella es comerciante D. ropa, zapatos y accesorios, el negocio lo estableció desD. hace dos años por iniciativa propia, solo con el apoyo D. su madre, no tiene un horario D. trabajo establecido.
Ella requiere financiamiento para comprar diversidad D. zapatos y ropa para ambos sexos, la inversión le ayudara a tener mejores estilos D. zapatos y blusas, faldas, short, esto le permitirá atender D. la mejor manera a la clientela.
Su objetivo es montar su propia empresa, que tenga mayor rentabilidad para garantizar una mejor comodidad a su familia.
texts.en:
Sonia lives with her family: her mother and her two children.  She owns her own home.  Sonia is a saleswoman who sells clothes, shoes and accessories.  She set up her business two years ago, on her own initiative and with her mother's support.  She does not work fixed hours.

Sonia needs a loan to buy a range of shoes and clothes for both sexes.  This investment will help her to have better styles of shoes, blouses, skirts and shorts available.  This will enable her to better serve her customers.

Sonia's goal is to set up her own company that is more profitable so that she can guarantee better comfort for her family.

loans.use: to buy shoes and clothes such as blouses, skirts and shorts

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.fr: Né en 1969 au Bénin, Gabriel est marié à une revendeuse du nom de Josephine. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Gabriel et sa famille habitent ensemble dans une ville du Bénin. Gabriel assure les diverses charges de la famille grâce au revenu issu de son activité. Gabriel a très peu fréquenté l'école, mais a appris la couture, activité qu'il exerce depuis vingt cinq ans environs. Gabriel désire acquérir de nouvelles machines à coudre performantes, afin de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle. Ce deuxième crédit permettra certainement à Gabriel de réaliser son rêve. Gabriel ambitionne plus tard élargir son champ d'activité par l'ouverture d'autres ateliers de couture dans les villes environnantes. Le premier crédit dont Gabriel a bénéficié antérieurement a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
Born in Benin in 1969, Gabriel is married to a reseller named Josephine. The couple has three dependent children who attend school. Gabriel and his family live together in a city of Benin. Gabriel takes care of the family’s various expenses with the income earned through his business activity. Gabriel received minimal schooling but learned to sew, an activity he has been practicing for about twenty five years. 

Gabriel wants to buy new, high performance sewing machines in order to better satisfy the needs of his customers. This second loan should help him to achieve his goal. The first loan he received was repaid without problems.

Gabriel hopes someday to expand his business by opening additional sewing shops in neighboring cities.

loans.use: to buy new sewing machines

loans.name: Alba Del Carmen

texts.es:
Alba, se dedica a la crianza de cerdos, vive con su esposo y sus hermanos, su madre y no tienen hijos, todos trabajan en su hogar, el negocio de los cerdos, lo inicio por el apoyo de una amiga, trabaja en su casa, no tiene un horario establecido.
Ella por el momento necesita un préstamo para comprar cerdos, engordarlos y luego venderlos, esta compra le ayudara a mejorar y aumentar la granja  de cerdos, uno de sus riesgos es que los cerdos puedan enfermar.
Alba tiene el objetivo de ampliar la granja, convertirse en una negociante en grande, y dar a su familia una mejor condición de vida.
texts.en:
Alba raises pigs.  She lives with her husband and his siblings, and her mother.  She does not have children.  Everybody in her household works.  Alba started her pig business with the support of a friend.  She works from home and does not work fixed hours.

Alba currently needs a loan to buy pigs to fatten and then sell.  This purchase will help her to improve and increase the size of her pig farm.  One of the risks she faces is that her pigs could become sick.

Alba's goals are to expand her farm, become a large-scale businesswoman and provide her family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Tomas Rigoberto

texts.es:
El señor Tomas de 44 años de edad, es originario de La Ciudad de León, es soltero , de oficio sastre, se dedica a la confección de todo tipo de ropa. El inicio atraves de sus padres pues ellos eran sastres también , cuando el tenia 14 años de edad inicio como sastre , apoyando a su padre en el taller de costura , hace doce años es el quien se hace cargo de este negocio . Hoy en día la mayoría de sus clientes son los colegios, empresas privadas.
Solicito el préstamo para compra materia prima como telas al por mayor. Con esta inversión espera satisfacer la demanda que tiene. En sus planes futuros quiere darle una mejor presentación a su taller de costura, comprar mas maquinas de cocer y poner otro taller de costura.
texts.en:
Tomas, 44, is from the city of León.  He’s single and his occupation is Tailor.  He makes all kinds of clothes.  He stared as a tailor through his parents who were also tailors, when he was 14 years old helping his father in his shop.  He took over the shop twelve years ago.  Today, most of his customers are schools and private firms.

He asked for the loan to buy raw materials, like fabric, at wholesale.  With this investment he hopes to meet his customer demand.  In his future plans is improving his shop’s appearance, buying more sewing machines and setting up another tailor shop.

loans.use: to buy raw materials like fabric at wholesale.

loans.name: Loko Chantal

texts.fr: Loko Chantal est née en 1965 au Bénin. Mariée à un enseignant nommé Victor, Loko Chantal est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à sa charge. En plus de ses enfants, Loko Chantal a cinq autres enfants à sa charge. Loko Chantal vit ensemble avec sa famille dans une ville du Bénin. Loko Chantal vend divers produits (sucre, pâtes alimentaires, lait, piles, savons, riz, farine de manioc, œufs frais, huile végétale, etc.) à son domicile. Loko Chantal s'approvisionne au Bénin. Cette activité lui procure des revenus l’aidant ainsi à participer aux charges familiales. Loko Chantal ambitionne élever le niveau de son activité et la diversifier par l'achat d'autres produits divers ; ce qui lui permettra d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire et de rehausser le niveau de son revenu, mais également de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle. Pour ce faire, Loko Chantal sollicite un autre crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Loko Chantal was born in Benin in 1965. She is married to Victor, a teacher, and she is the mother of three dependent children who all attend school. In addition to her own children, Loko Chantal also has five other children in her care. She and her family live together in a city of Benin. 

Loko Chantal sells various products from her home (sugar, pasta, milk, batteries, soap, rice, cassava flour, fresh eggs, vegetable oil, etc.). She buys her merchandise in Benin. The income she earns from this activity allows her to help pay for the family expenses. 

Loko Chantal hopes to bolster and diversify her activity by buying other miscellaneous products, which should help not only to boost her revenue and profits, but also to better meet the needs of her customers. To that end, she is seeking another loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy various products such as soap, pasta, sugar, rice, milk, eggs, etc. for resale

loans.name: Gladys Villaney

texts.es:
La señora Gladys, tiene 40 años de edad, esta casada, es madre de 3 niñas, de oficio comerciante, se dedica a elaborar  y alquilar trajes típicos , ella es originaria de la ciudad de León. Ella empezó a los 25 años de edad con un pequeño financiamiento ya que vendió ropa en el mercado de la ciudad, su esposo es artista y diseñador de trajes típicos el noto que la concurrencia de clientes aumentaba cada día en busca de sus diseños fue entonces cuando empezaron a ver esta actividad como un negocio lucrativos para ellos, actualmente elabora un promedio de 250 trajes cuenta con el apoyo de su hija y esposo, además de vender ropa nueva que es su otra fuente de ingresos .        
Solicito el préstamo para la elaboración de trajes típicos y aumentar su inventario. Ella espera que con esta inversión pueda satisfacer parte de la demanda de sus clientes pues es bastante y necesita tener inventario suficiente para poder abastecer a sus clientes, tiene la expectativa de crecer y expandir su negocio. Tiene como meta próxima comprar vitrinas y mobiliarios para la exhibición de  sus trajes típicos.
texts.en:
Gladys is 40 years old, married, and has three daughters.  She works as a merchant making and renting traditional clothing.  She is originally from the city of León.  

She started her business when she was 25 with a small loan since she sold clothing in the market in the city.  Her husband is an artist and designer of traditional clothing.  He noted that the number of customers increased every day in search of his designs, so they began to see this activity as a lucrative business for themselves.  Currently, they make about 250 suits with the support of their daughter and her husband.  They also sell new clothing as another source of income.

She is asking for this loan to make traditional clothing and increase their inventory.  She hopes that with this investment they can satisfy part of the demands of their customers because it is too much, and they need to have sufficient inventory to supply their customers.  She expects to grow and expand the business.  Her next goal is to purchase glass and furniture to display the traditional clothing.

loans.use: to make traditional clothing and increase her inventory.

loans.name: Dossou Gérard

texts.fr: Dossou Gérard est né le 18 Novembre 1976 au Bénin  et est marié à une coiffeuse du nom de Mariette. Dossou Gérard a trois enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés. En plus de ses enfants, Dossou Gérard a un autre enfant à sa charge. Dossou Gérard et sa femme vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Dossou Gérard a arrêté l'école au cours secondaire puis a appris la coiffure, activité qu'il exerce depuis une douzaine d'année. Dans le but de mieux équiper son salon de coiffure par l'acquisition de matériels de coiffure et de produits cosmétiques, Dossou Gérard  sollicite pour la deuxième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce crédit permettra certainement à Dossou Gérard de mieux satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle. Dossou Gérard a bien remboursé son premier crédit.
texts.en:
Dossou Gérard was born on November 18, 1976 in Benin and is married to a hair stylist called Mariette. he has 3 children, some of whom go to school. As well as his own children, he is responsible for one other child. Doussou Gérard and his wife live together with their children, and together they take care of the family's expenses. 

Doussou Gérard left school at the secondary level and learned hair styling, which he has been involved in for around 12 years.  In order to better equip his salon by obtaining styling equipment and beauty products, Doussou Gérard is asking for a second loan from ALIDé. This loan will allow him to better meet the needs of his customers. The first loan was properly repaid.

loans.use: to buy a hairdryer and beauty products

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: This loan will be used to purchase meats, eggs, cheeses, fruits, vegetables, beverages, snacks, cooking oil, butter, margarine, rice, corn, shirts, trousers, blouses, hats, shoes, sandals, irons, and fans.

loans.name: Leocadio Freddy

texts.es:
Leocadio, de 48 años de edad, es originario de la comunidad Palo de lapa ubicada en el departamento de León, esta casado, tiene 5 hijos, de oficio agricultor el siembra granos básicos ,también se dedica a la ganadería. El empezó a los 18 años de edad, comenzó sembrando algodón  con su papa, de esta manera fue adquiriendo experiencia en la siembra e cultivos desde entonces no parado de trabajar. Incluso ha laborado con financiamiento que le ha sido de gran ayuda, a el le gustaría exportar su producto directamente a quien le pague mejor su cosecha, pues quiere diversificar la siembra de hortalizas.
Solicito el préstamo para compra de insumos para sembrar yuca, maíz, ajonjolí. Con esta inversión desea ampliar sus cultivos, mejorar sus condiciones de vida. En lo futuro quiere sembrar chiltoma, tomate, cebolla, papaya.
texts.en:
Leocadio, 48, is from the community of Palo de Lapa located in León Department.  He’s married and has five children.  He’s a basic grains farmer and also raises livestock.  He started out at the age of 18 growing cotton with his father.  He acquired experience in planting and caring for crops this way and hasn’t stopped working since.  He has even worked with financing which has been of great help to him.  He’d like to export his products directly to whoever will pay the best price for his crops because he’d like to diversify his crops.

He asked for the loan to buy farming supplies to plant manioc, corn and sesame.  He hopes to use this investment to expand his crops and improve his living conditions.  In the future, he wants to grow peppers, tomatoes, onions and papayas.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy aluminum and iron

loans.name: Esperanza Group

texts.es: Alberto, Maria, and Doris, who all live in the San Lorenzo region of Honduras, formed the Esperanza solidarity group in June, 2011. Collectively they will serve as guarantors of one another’s loans.  Alberto sells new clothing and school supplies, and is requesting a loan of Lps. 8,000 to purchase merchandise. Both Maria and Doris sell basic groceries and household products, and are requesting loans of Lps. 8,000 and 6,000 respectively with which they will purchase merchandise for their businesses.
texts.en: Alberto, Maria, and Doris, who all live in the San Lorenzo region of Honduras, formed the Esperanza solidarity group in June, 2011. Collectively they will serve as guarantors of one another’s loans.  Alberto sells new clothing and school supplies, and is requesting a loan of Lps. 8,000 to purchase merchandise. Both Maria and Doris sell basic groceries and household products, and are requesting loans of Lps. 8,000 and 6,000 respectively with which they will purchase merchandise for their businesses.

loans.use: This loan will be used to purchase meats, eggs, cheeses, fruits, vegetables, beverages, snacks, cooking oil, butter, margarine, rice, corn, shirts, trousers, blouses, hats, shoes, sandals, and school supplies.

loans.name: Petrona

texts.es:
Petrona es comerciante en venta de ropa y productos de cosméticos, también vende helados, el cual tiene cuatro años en las ventas, ya que años anteriores, laboraba como domestica. Hoy en día cuenta con la ayuda de sus tres hijos que están en el país de Costa Rica, los cuales envían remesas, y los otros viven independiente.
Durante varios años, ha venido construyendo su casa toda de concreto, gracias al ahorro y apoyo de sus hijos, así como el financiamiento que Afodenic ha dado en cuatro ciclos todos para la infraestructura en donde ha avanzado más rápido la construcción.
Hay un cuarto que es el que va a mejorar que aun  es de zinc, y cuartones ya muy viejos, en donde tiene comprado piedra, piedrín, arena, y comprara con este préstamo laminas de zinc, cuartones, clavos, hierro, cemento para comenzar e ir poco  a poco cerrándolo más seguro.
texts.en:
Petrona sells clothing, cosmetics and also ice cream.  She has been in this business for four years and before that she worked as a maid.  Now her three sons and daughters who are in Costa Rica help her by sending her money and the others live on their own.
For several years she has been building her house of concrete, thanks to her savings and the help from those working in Costa Rica.  With the financing from Afodenic she has had four loan cycles for the infrastructure which has advanced faster than the construction.
There is a room which she wants to improve that’s made of zinc and has roofing timbers that are very old.  She has bought stone, pebbles, sand and she will use this loan to buy sheets of zinc, timbers, nails, iron and cement to begin to finish it more securely.

loans.use: To buy construction materials to begin building a concrete room since it's now made of zinc, and to change the roof

loans.name: Marelis

texts.es:
Marelis  es una mujer D. 57 años que vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en las edades D. 28 a 35 años, en San Jacinto un municipio del departamento D. Bolívar, destacado por la variedad D. hamacas y artesanías que fabrican sus habitantes en tejido vertical, como parte D. sus tradiciones culturales.
Marelis aprendió la confección D. ropa como su actividad preferida desD. muy  joven;  a los 17 años en forma empírica  la practicaba apoyada por una vecina y hace cuatro años, realizó varios cursos con el SENA para perfeccionar su arte y emprender en su propio taller,  un negocio ubicado en su vivienda  a través del cual  produce uniformes escolares, actividad a la que ha agregado una comercial relacionada con este mismo proceso, pues también venD. tela y accesorios a otras modistas D. la región y productos cosméticos por catálogos; en la actualidad cuenta con maquinaria suficiente para aumentar sus ventas y eso es justamente lo que quiere que le ocurra permanentemente. Cuando es temporada donD. se incrementan sus ventas, marelis contrata a otras personas para trabajar y desea sostener empleos en su negocio.
