La actividad D. confecciones desarrollada en su taller,  le ha facilitado  sacar adelante a sus hijos y le genera la mayor parte D. los ingresos familiares, pues con esta esta y el apoyo D. su esposo han logrado  adquirir su casa  propia. Marelis está vinculada a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo desD. hace 5 años organización con la que ha recibido 5 financiamientos; su credikiva es el sexto y con él comprará materiales para uniformes escolares y accesorios para la venta en su pequeño punto comercial D. insumos D. confecciones y también otras mercancías que venD. mediante guías especializadas como cosméticos, accesorios femeninos, colonias y perfumes.  Su sueño más adelante se centra en  tener una casa en la ciudad D.  Cartagena, para que cuando los nietos ingresen a la Universidad, tengan donD. vivir y respecto a su capital D. trabajo, incrementarlo para   conseguir nuevos clientes que a su vez apoyen el logro D. una mayor rentabilidad, que en la actualidad se encuentra en un  27%  y con su ejercicio D. trabajo disciplinado y persistente muy seguramente aumentará
texts.en:
Marelis is a 57 year old woman who lives with her husband and their three children, who range in age from 28 to 35.  They live in the San Jacinto municipality in the Bolívar department.  It is known for the variety of hammocks and handicrafts the population makes with a vertical loom as part of their cultural tradition.  

Marelis learned to make clothes as her preferred activity when she was very young.  When she was 17 years old she got practical experience with a neighbor’s help.  Four years ago she took various courses with SENA (National Education Service) in order to perfect her art and start her own shop.  Her business is located in her house, where she makes school uniforms.  She has expanded this aspect of the business beyond making school uniforms.  She also sells fabric and accessories to other dressmakers in the region.  Additionally, she sells cosmetics by catalog.

She currently has enough machines to increase her sales, and that is exactly what she wants to do.  During her high sales season, Marelis hires other people to work.  She hopes to be able to sustain these jobs.

The business activity of making clothes developed in her workshop.  It has facilitated getting her children ahead.  It also generates the major part of the family income.  With this and the support of her husband, they have managed to get their own home.

Marelis has worked with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo for five years.  She has received five loans from this organization.  Her Kiva loan is her sixth, and she will use it to buy materials to make more school uniforms and accessories to sell at her small shop.        

Her dream for later on is to have a house in the city of Cartagena.  She wants this for her grandchildren when they enroll in the University.  That way they will have a place to live.  She also dreams of increasing her working capital in order to get new customers, which will in turn result in greater profitability than the current 27%.  With her disciplined work and her persistence it will surely increase.

loans.use: to buy materials for school uniforms and accessories to sell at her shop and also women's accessories, cologne and perfume.

loans.name: Coca Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “C.” iniciará su tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Patacamaya, está compuesta por diez integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Medelinne. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tienda de barrio, cerrajería, juegos en red, venta de rellenos, venta de CD’s venta de refrescos, venta de comida.
 
La señora Medelinne,  indica que es el sexto mes que integra Pro Mujer  y que ingreso por invitación de otro socio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio tienda de barrio desde hace tres años atrás, aprendiendo el mismo de su cuñada.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para la compra el incremento de su mercadería (compra de aceite, arroz, fideo, etc.), estos productos los comprara de la misma localidad de las señoras mayoristas, por mayor, y posteriormente lo venderá en su tienda todos los días. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación en salud.

En la fotografía acompaña al grupo el Asesor de credito, el que esta vestido de color cafe, pues el primer grupo de este centro focal que ingresa a ser parte de KIVA.
texts.en:
The “C.” community bank is about to start its third loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Patacamaya regional office.  The group has ten members and is run by a board of directors which is led by Medelinne.  The businesses that the members of the community bank carry out are varied and include: a neighborhood store, a locksmith's, offering online games, selling food ('rellenos'), selling CDs, selling soft drinks and selling meals.

Medelinne says that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for six months.  She joined through an invitation from another member.  She currently has a neighborhood store that she has run for three years.  She learned the business from her sister-in-law.

Medelinne will use the loan that she is taking out to buy more merchandise (oil, rice, noodles, etc.).  She will buy these products from wholesalers in her town.  She will then re-sell them in her store.  This work allows Medelinne to make income to support her family.  She lives with her partner and has two children.

When we asked her what she likes about Pro Mujer, Medelinne replied that she likes the health training.

In the photograph, the group are joined by their loan officer, who is dressed in coffee-colored clothes, as this is the first group from this regional office that has started working with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy noodles, rice, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy materials to make purses and back packs, and fine thread for making cones and accessories to adorn artisan crafts.

loans.name: Erikson Jose

texts.es:
Erikson es un joven de 26 años de edad, habita en la ciudad de león, esta casado , es padre de dos hijos de 5 y 2 años de edad respectivamente, el es comerciante se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pizzas. 
Inicio su negocio hace 5 años, su papa es dueño de una panadería y fue el quien lo impulso a poner su propio negocio. Así que el se fue a Managua a tomar un curso de panificación para capacitarse en técnicas de elaboración de pan y sus derivados,  además de la experiencia que adquirió en la panadería de su padre. De esta manera el logro poner su pizzería, con los ingresos que la generado este negocio también puso una pulpería en su casa  la cual es atendida por su esposa, este es otra fuente de ingresos que el tiene. A el le gustaría expandirse en toda la ciudad de León incluyendo sus municipios porque hay mercado para vender su producto, pero le falta transporte, no tiene en que movilizarse por tal motivo no ha podido expandirse. Debido a eso es que solicito el préstamo para comprar una moto y poder distribuir sus productos. Con esta inversión el espera incrementar sus ventas por medio de las entregas a domicilio , mejorar sus ingresos que le permitan ahorrar para realizar  una de sus metas que es poner su propia panadería, construir su casa y poder expandir su negocio fuera de la ciudad de León.
texts.en:
Erickson, 26, lives in the city of León.  He’s married and the father of two children who are 5 and 2 years of age respectively.  He’s a merchant that manufactures and sells pizzas.  

He started his business five years ago.  His father owns a bakery and he pushed him to open his own business.  This is how he went to Managua to take a baking course to learn techniques for baking bread and bread derivatives to add to the experience he’d gained from his father.  This is how he managed to set up his pizzeria.  With income generated from this business he was also able to set up a grocery store at home that his wife tends to which is an additional source of income for him.  

He’d like to expand throughout the city of León including its surrounding towns because there’s a market for his product.  However, due to lack of transportation he’s been unable to expand.  Because of this, he’s asked for a loan to buy a motorcycle to be able to distribute his products.  With this investment he hopes to increase his sales through home deliveries, to increase income so that he can save up because one of his goals is to open a bakery of his own, to build his house and to extend his business beyond the city of León.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: El Progreso Group

texts.en:
Maria is a borrower who lives near San Pedro de Macorís, Dominican Republic, in a rural community. She is the coordinator for her group, named El Progreso (The Progress), a group of Haitian citizens who have made their lives in the Bateyes of Dominican Republic.

Maria, her husband, and their three children live together north of San Pedro in a Bateyes, which is a small rural community built by sugar companies for their field workers. Despite her difficulties, Maria makes the most of her opportunities and she operates a little food market where she sells products such as clothes, shoes, and other goods. Her most difficult business challenge is that her customers do not have enough revenue to purchase the items that she sells. However, she visits other communities during the week, traveling to sell her products.

Maria is requesting a loan to purchase different products to increase her inventory such as clothing for men, women, and children, and to purchase rice, beans, cooking oil, vegetables, meat, and other items. Maria has had five previous loans and she has been able to bring changes to her family’s life.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes, and food.

loans.name: Lesbia De Jesus

texts.es:
La señora Lesbia, es originaria de Chacaraseca  comunidad ubicada en León, tiene 62 años de edad, tiene un hijo, ella se dedica  ala agricultura y crianza de ganado. Ella aprendió este oficio desde muy pequeña pues sus padres eran agricultores, le heredaron tierra para sembrar así lo hizo trabajo muy duro para sacar adelante su cosecha son los ingresos obtenidos fue comprando sus animales como vacas, gallinas y cerdos para criar. A pesar que solo logro cursar cuarto grado de primaria ha sabido salir adelante trabajan día a día para sacar sus cultivos y tener hoy en día su finca.    
Solicito el préstamo para compra bueyes y  trabajar la tierra. Este crédito le ayudara a adquirir reses que necesita para suplir necesidades que tiene su finca y cultivar hortalizas. Su próxima meta es sembrar pipián, ayote y chiltoma para abrir un nuevo mercado de cultivos que no sembraba antes y seguir produciendo para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Lesbia is from Chacaraseca, a community located in León.  She is 62 years old and has a son.  She’s a farmer and raises livestock.  She learned this occupation while still a little girl because her parents were farmers.  They passed down land to her to cultivate and that’s what she did.  She worked hard to have a successful harvest.  With income earned she bought animals like cows, chickens and pigs to raise.  Despite only completing fourth grade she has known how to get ahead.  She works day by day to raise her crops and have a farm today.

She asked for the loan to buy oxen to work the land.  This loan will help her buy cattle she needs to meet the needs of her farm and to grow vegetables.  Her next goal is to grow pumpkins, chayote and peppers to open up a new market for crops she didn’t previously grow and to continue producing to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy cattle and to plant vegetables.

loans.name: Pedro  Rafael

texts.es:
Don Pedro de 43 años, es originario de la ciudad de León, esta casado, es padre de 3 hijos, de oficio contador, el es dueño de una panadería. El inicio en este negocio a la edad de 23 años de edad , anteriormente trabajaba como contador en una institución estatal para ese entonces el tenia 18 años de edad, el también estudiaba un curso de Ingeniería Agrícola y al mismo tiempo trabajaba pero le resulto difícil seguir pagando este curso pues su familia pasaba por una situación económica muy difícil tuvo que dejar de estudiar , y había perdido su trabajo . Un tío lo motivo a que pusiera su propio negocio para salir adelante así lo hizo poco a poco hasta tener hoy en día su panadería. 
El solicito el préstamo para comprar un horno industrial. Para aumentar la producción de pan y atender la demanda de sus clientes con esto aumentar sus ingresos por medio de las ventas. El desea abrir nuevos mercados en las zonas rurales de León  pues considera que es buen punto de venta para distribuir sus productos, comprar una moto para distribuir su producto y ahorrarse en combustible. Sus siguientes pasos son realizarles mejoras a su negocio, modernizar algunas de sus herramientas de trabajo como la compra de una batidora industrial.
texts.en:
Pedro, 43, is from the city of León.  He’s married and the father of three children.  He’s an Accountant by profession and also owns a bakery.  He started this business at the age of 23.  He used to work as an accountant for a state institution.  Back then he was 18 years old.  He was also taking Agricultural Engineering courses while working but it became difficult to pay for the schooling because his family was going through a difficult economic situation.  He had to stop studying and had lost his job.

An uncle encouraged him to set up his own business so that he could get ahead.  He did so and gradually attained the bakery he has today.  He asked for the loan to buy an industrial oven to increase bread production and meet customer demand increasing income through his sales.

He wants to open new markets in the rural parts of León because he feels they are good sales points for his products and to buy a motorcycle to distribute his products and save on fuel.  His next steps include doing some improvements to the business and modernizing some of his work tools like buying an industrial mixer.

loans.use: to buy an industrial oven.

loans.name: Delphia

texts.en:
Delphia works at a homeless shelter running a program designed to house both the homeless and those at risk of becoming homeless. Her passion for economic empowerment within the homeless community sparked a desire to launch a program that provides income opportunities to the homeless through the sale and distribution of biweekly and bimonthly newspapers.  The vendors are able to purchase the newspaper from the program for less than half the sales price and keep the remaining portion as income.
 
Delphia chose to open this business because of her experience working with the homeless and at-risk population and her passion for poverty reduction.  Although her business is home-based for now and relies on volunteers, she believes the business will give the homeless an entrepreneurial mindset and have many positive impacts for the homeless population in the city.

With this loan from ACCION USA, Delphia will be able to print more newspapers for her flourishing business.


Additional Information About This Loan 

This loan has been made as a part of Kiva Detroit and in partnership with Michigan Corps.  Kiva Detroit is the first Kiva City, a program where Kiva works with community organizations and field partners in the United States to provide local small businesses with microloans. Michigan Corps is the first community organization to work with Kiva in Detroit, and conducts outreach through small business networks, churches, community foundations, and across many personal and social media networks. Learn more at kiva.org/detroit

loans.use: to pay for newspaper printing

loans.name: Jose Ever

texts.es:
José, tiene 38 años de edad, tiene casa propia, es padre de tres hijos de 16, 14 y 6 años de edad, él es agricultor, se dedica al cultivo de maíz y chile, tiene mucho tiempo de hacer este trabajo.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos agrícolas como abono e insecticidas, que le ayudaran al inicio del cultivo, dándole un buen cuido durante el crecimiento.
Su objetivo es mejorar la produccion de los cultivos, tener lo necesario para su familia y poder avanzar junto a sus hijos y esposa.
texts.en:
José is 38 years old.  He owns his own home and has three children aged 16, 14 and 6.  José is a farmer who grows corn and chili.  He has been in this line of work for a long time.  He is requesting a loan to buy agricultural supplies such as manure and insecticides which will help him as he sows his crops and will enable him to care for them as they grow.

José's goals are to improve his crop production, to have what he needs for his family and to make progress together with his wife and children.

loans.use: to buy manure and insecticides for his corn and chili crops

loans.name: Jeanett Lynn

texts.en:
Jeanett works full-time as a business analyst helping car dealers with computer issues.  Motivated by her passion to help others, Jeanett decided to start her own personal assistant/concierge business on the side after almost 20 years in customer service.  Her small business will generate revenue mainly through personal assistance services, concierge service and care services for the elderly. Clients are billed by the hour and have the option to purchase blocks of time at discounted rates. 

Jeanette realizes the importance of protecting her businesses and her clients. She wants to obtain the necessary legal documents so she can be protected and so clients know what to expect. 

With this loan from ACCION USA, Jeanett will be purchasing a computer, legal documents, training materials and marketing materials.  She hopes to expand her business by 50% in the next year by incorporating more services. Jeanett is excited about being a new business owner and is looking forward to expanding her client base.

Additional Information About This Loan 

This loan has been made as a part of Kiva Detroit and in partnership with Michigan Corps.  Kiva Detroit is the first Kiva City, a program where Kiva works with community organizations and field partners in the United States to provide local small businesses with microloans. Michigan Corps is the first community organization to work with Kiva in Detroit, and conducts outreach through small business networks, churches, community foundations, and across many personal and social media networks. Learn more at kiva.org/detroit

loans.use: to purchase a computer, legal documents, training materials and marketing materials

loans.name: Manuel Maria

texts.en:
Manuel is 42 years old. He is from Colombia and lives in the city of Tulcán, Ecuador, along the Ecuador-Colombia border. He is single and lives with his family which includes two children, aged nine and 13. Manuel is a happy person of strong character. He is reliable and, above all, a very responsible parent. 

Manuel runs a store where he sells music CDs and movies. He began his business with a small stall at the entrance to the central market of Tulcán with a borrowed tape recorder and a small amount of CDs. Thanks to a previous loan from FODEMI, he purchased his own tape recorder and more CDs. “Now I can say I have my own business,” he reports. His business is going well because it is his own and he has many customers. 

Manuel is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise for his store. He is thankful for his loans because they have opened many doors for him and he has been able to prosper. Manuel is especially thankful because no other institution would give him credit because he is Colombian. His past loans have helped him increase his income. His dream is to expand his business to give him the ability to forge a better future for his children.  

In this photo, Manuel is wearing a blue shirt and is posed with two of his customers.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise, including CDs and movies, for his shop

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Emily Ann

texts.en:
Emily founded her home-based clothing business in February 2010 while working three days a week at a magazine. She also previously co-owned a grassroots fashion label, which gave her exposure to the industry, helped her to build many contacts in the field, and enabled the confidence and skills to sell her current business products. 

Emily’s business is an organic fashion label for men and women that sells directly online. Although she is the only employee and relies on interns and volunteers, she is successfully able to sell products through word of mouth, boutique consignments, outdoor festivals and exhibit vendor booths. Emily’s greatest business accomplishment was a feature in a local magazine.

Emily hopes to one day expand her business into a vertically integrated design house with on-site manufacturing, enabling both employment and education. With this loan from ACCION USA, Emily will purchase a straight stitch industrial sewing machine and some stock for the fall collection, along with some mannequins, hangers, and hang tags.


Additional Information About This Loan 

This loan has been made as a part of Kiva Detroit and in partnership with Michigan Corps.  Kiva Detroit is the first Kiva City, a program where Kiva works with community organizations and field partners in the United States to provide local small businesses with microloans. Michigan Corps is the first community organization to work with Kiva in Detroit, and conducts outreach through small business networks, churches, community foundations, and across many personal and social media networks. Learn more at kiva.org/detroit

loans.use: to purchase a straight stitch industrial sewing machine and some stock for the fall collection, along with some mannequins, hangers, and hang tags.

loans.name: Maria Elsa

texts.es:
María, vive con su hija, se dedican a vender papas fritas y comida rápida, ella trabaja de 7:00am a 5:00pm, este negocio lo atiende en su propia casa y tiene una experiencia de 30 años aproximadamente, aprendió sola y por la necesidad de tener una fuente de ingreso.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para invertirlo en insumos para la elaboración de comida rápida, como papas, aceite, condimentos, esta inversión le permitirá cubrir mejor la demanda, teniendo la cantidad suficiente de materiales para la preparación.
Su aspiración es construir una mejor vivienda, ya que tiene espacio para poder mejorar y hacerla más segura.
texts.en:
María lives with her daughter.  Her business is selling fries and fast food.  She works from 7.00am to 5.00pm.  She runs her business from her home and has approximately 30 years experience.  She learned the business herself because she needed to earn a living.

María is requesting a loan to invest in supplies for making fast food such as potatoes, oil and condiments.  This investment will allow her to better meet her demand by having available the materials she needs to prepare her food.

María's aspiration is to build a better home since she has space to improve it and make it safer.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as potatoes, oil and condiments

loans.name: Daysi Estibali

texts.es:
Daysi, vive con su madre y hermanos, administra una tienda de productos domésticos, ella trabaja con proveedores, quienes le llevan la mercadería para el negocio, trabaja todos los días de la semana.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para comprar estantes de madera para el negocio, esta compra de mobiliario  le ayudara a tener mejor visibilidad en su negocio, ordenando los productos por  necesidad  y así prestar un mejor servicio.
El sueño de ella es comprarse su propia casa, por lo que se esfuerza diariamente para conseguirlo.
texts.en:
Daysi lives with her mother and brothers and manages a household products store.  She works with suppliers who bring the goods to the business, and works seven days a week.

She is currently seeking a loan to buy wooden shelving for the business.  The purchase of furniture will help with better visibility in her business, so she can order products when needed and thus providing better service.

Her dream is to buy her own home, which she is making a daily effort to achieve.

loans.use: to buy wooden shelving for the store.

loans.name: Mariana Del Jesús

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Municipal  de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Nueva Estrella Solidaria.

Aquí conocimos a la señora Mariana tiene 55 años  de edad, es madre soltera de tres hijos, dos de ellos ya mayores de edad y un chica de 17 años que este mes empieza a estudiar en la universidad, todos sus hijos aun viven en su casa. Esta  en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio,  es la presidenta del mismo y le gusta por la ayuda que le han brindado.

Hace varios años aprendió corte y confección por lo cual para sacar a sus hijos adelante hace nueve años puso un pequeño taller de costura en su casa en donde  se dedica a coser todo tipo de ropa, nos cuenta que lo que más confecciona es  ropa de dormir, ella trabaja a base de pedidos de personas particulares y también entrega en bazares  las prendas que ella elabora. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 22h00 y a veces hasta más tarde cuando tiene pedidos que entregar, su hija le ayuda cuando tiene tiempo.

Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar telas, hilos, botones y otros materiales para la costura.

Sus sueños son tener un taller más grande y un almacén en el centro de la ciudad donde  pueda vender sus obras.
texts.en:
In the municipal fortress of the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, (known for many years as "The City of the Royal Tamarind Trees"), the members of the New Star Community Bank for Development meet every two weeks.

Here we meet Señora Mariana.  She is 55 years old, and a single mother of three children; two of them are grown and the third is a 17 year old girl who this month began to study in university.  All her children still live at home.  She has been part of the Community Bank from the beginning and is the president of it, and she likes it for the support they have provided.

Several years ago she learned to cut and sew clothing.  In order to help her children get ahead, she started a small sewing shop in her home nine years ago, where she works sewing all kinds of clothes.  She tells us that what she makes most is sleepwear.  She works based on orders from individuals and also delivers the garments she makes to bazaars​​. She works every day from 6 a.m. to 10 p.m., and sometimes even later when she has orders to deliver.  Her daughter helps her when she has time.

This new loan will be used to buy fabric, thread, buttons and other sewing materials.

Her dreams are to have a larger workshop and a warehouse in the center of the city where she can sell her work.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, buttons and other sewing materials.

loans.name: Marisel

texts.es: Marisel lives with her husband and three children in the Choluteca region of Honduras. For the last 16 years, Marisel has made and sold bread out of her home. She is requesting a loan of Lps. 15,000 with which to buy ingredients for making bread. In her free time Marisel enjoys attending church.
texts.en: Marisel lives with her husband and three children in the Choluteca region of Honduras. For the last 16 years, Marisel has made and sold bread out of her home. She is requesting a loan of Lps. 15,000 with which to buy ingredients for making bread. In her free time Marisel enjoys attending church.

loans.use: This loan will be used to purchase cornmeal, eggs, sugar, and milk.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es: El señor JOSE  esta casado con la señora Melisa cliente de la institucion  que integró el banco de emprendimiento buenas emprendedoras que ya finalizaron su crédito. El señor José es técnico electricista y realiza instalaciones de alarmas, porteros eléctricos e instalaciones eléctricas en general, vive en la casa de sus padres los cuales  están en Argentina, vive con su esposa y con su hijo en la zona de Llojeta el crédito será destinado a la compra de materiales para instalaciones en un edificio de la zona de Miraflores. Asimismo tiene un contrato con una empresa constructora en la que trabaja junto a su papa y su hermano, es una persona muy trabajadora agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Jose is married to Melisa.  He is a customer of the field partner that integrated the communal bank.  They are good entrepreneurs who have given him his loan.  Jose is an electrical technician who installs alarms, doorbells, and other electrical installations.  He lives in his parents' house while his parents are in Argentina.  Jose lives with his wife and son in the neighborhood of Llojeta.   

The loan will be used to purchase equipment for installations in a building in the neighborhood of Miraflores. Jose also has a contract with a construction company where he works with his father and his brother.  He is a hard worker and is grateful for the field partner's support.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for electrical installations.

loans.name: Gilberto Antonio

texts.es:
Gilberto, vive con su madre y sus hermanos de 15 y 29 años de edad, él es soltero, no tiene hijos y se dedica a la venta de refrescos naturales ayudando a su madre, además trabaja en una distribuidora de agua.
Él solicita un préstamo ya que necesita cubrir algunos gastos del negocio, como por ejemplo la compra de materiales como azúcar, frutas y cereales para preparar los refrescos, así también los utensilios para tener la venta, esta ayuda le permitirá tener en una mejor condición el negocio a parte de contar con suficiente materiales para la producción.
Su objetivo es ayudar a su madre, atender su trabajo y el negocio de manera eficiente, generando mayores ingresos y una vida más confortable.
texts.en:
Gilberto lives with his mother and siblings, who are 15 and 29 years old.  He is single, with no children.  Gilberto sells natural juices to help his mother, and he also works at a water distributor.

He is requesting a loan to cover some business expenses, such as the purchase of materials of sugar, fruits and cereals to prepare drinks, as these are the tools to obtain sales.  This support will allow Gilberto to improve his business by having enough materials for production.  Gilberto's goal is to help his mother, take care of work and run his business efficiently, and thereby generate a higher income for a more comfortable life.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, fruits, and cereals to prepare drinks.

loans.name: Yajaira Cristina

texts.en:
Yajaira is 31 years old and lives in the city of Ibarra, in northern Ecuador. She is married but is living with her parents because, at the moment, she is separated from her husband. She has three daughters who are three, seven, and 12. Yajaira is a hardworking and responsible person who has a business selling cosmetics door-to-door. She began her business with a microloan from FODEMI that gave her the capital to begin working in the sale of beauty products. Yajaira reports that her business is going very well and that she has progressed and is happy with what she’s accomplished. 

Yajaira is requesting a loan to purchase more cosmetics to sell. Past loans have helped her change her products and this flexibility has increased her earnings. In addition, she is also able to offer a longer period of credit for her customers, who pay in increments. Yajaira’s dream is to have her own local cosmetics shop so that she no longer has to walk door-to-door to make her sales.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Mercy Auxiliadora

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Municipal  de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Nueva Estrella Solidaria.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Mercy, tiene 32 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de  11, 3 y de 1 año, la mayor  estudian en escuela. Su esposo es  marino mercante y trabaja en Galápagos. Hace varios años ella aprendió corte y confección en una academia de la ciudad.

Tiene un pequeño taller de costura en su casa donde se dedica a coser todo tipo de ropa y también a realizar arreglos a prendas de vestir. Además de esto también se dedica a vender ropa y zapatos por catalogo  de varias marcas, trabaja a base de pedidos, la venta de los productos las realiza en su taller y algunas veces recorre puerta a puerta. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 22h00 y a veces hasta más tarde cuando tiene pedidos que entregar. Lleva con las ventas de estos productos desde que empezó en el banco y con las costuras mucho más tiempo.

Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar ropa, zapatos, telas, botones, hilos y otros materiales para la costura. Lleva seis ciclos en el banco comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos empezó con su negocio.
 
Sus sueños son tener un taller más grande y ser una gran empresaria
texts.en:
The members of the "Nueva Estrella Solidaria" (New Star Solidarity) Communal Bank meet every two weeks in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabi.   The city has been known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarinds.

Here we met Mercy, who is 32 years old, married and has three children, ages 11, 3 and 1 years old.  The eldest is in school. Her husband is a merchant seaman and works in the Galapagos. Several years ago Mercy learned dressmaking at an academy in the city. 

Mercy has a small sewing shop in her house where she sews all types of clothes and also tailors clothing.  In addition, she also sells clothes and shoes through catalogs of various brands.  She works based on orders, selling products made in her workshop and she also sometimes goes door to door. Mercy works every day from 6:00 am to 11:00 pm and sometimes even later when she has orders to deliver. Mercy started selling these products since the communal bank began, and has been sewing even longer.

This new loan will be used to buy clothes, shoes, fabrics, buttons, thread and other sewing materials. Mercy has completed six cycles in the communal bank and likes it because her business started with a loan. 
  
Her dreams are to have a bigger workshop and to be a great businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes, fabrics, yarns, buttons and other sewing materials.

loans.name: Lucinda

texts.en: Lucinda lives in the Choluteca region of Honduras with her husband and two children. For the last 8 years, Lucinda has run a small convenience shop, selling basic foodstuffs and household items. She is requesting a loan of HNL 6,000 to purchase meats, cheeses, fruits, vegetables, snacks, beverages, basic grains, salt, butter, cooking oil, basic household cleaning products, and personal hygiene products for her shop. In her spare time, Lucinda enjoys attending church.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her shop

loans.name: Fidel Atilio

texts.es:
Fidel, vive con su familia, todos son independientes, él es carpintero, tiene su propio taller, y en el lugar no existe otro taller, lo que le permite tener la atención de los vecinos y amigos cercanos.
Él tiene una dificultad, y es que carece de madera para realizar trabajos, por lo que está solicitando un financiamiento para la compra de madera, clavos, formica y otros materiales que son muy necesarios, con este crédito tendrá el beneficio de fortalecer el taller, de tener una mayor disponibilidad para la ejecución de los trabajos.
Su objetivo es tener una carpintería bien establecida, realizar trabajos de calidad, satisfacer a los clientes y contar con su preferencia, esto será un verdadero éxito para Fidel.
texts.en:
Fidel lives with his family and they are all independent.  He is a carpenter with his own workshop, and there are no other studios in the area, allowing him to have the attention of neighbors and close friends.

Fidel's problem is that he lacks the wood necessary for his work, so he is requesting a loan to buy wood, nails, formica and other materials that are badly needed.  These materials will benefit him by strengthening the workshop to have greater availability for working on jobs.

His goal is to have a well established carpentry, perform quality work, and have satisfied customers who  continue doing business with him; this will be a real success for Fidel.

loans.use: to buy wood, nails, formica and other materials.

loans.name: Yola Paquita

texts.es:
Yola es socia del  Banco Comunal “Virgen D. Concepción”, ubicado en el C.P. Ayrumas Carumas del distrito D. Acora, provincia y departamento D. Puno, tiene 50 años D. edad, es  viuda y tiene 2 hijos.  Tiene educación primaria. 
Ella se dedica a la crianza D. animales domésticos como vacunos y ovinos.  Trabaja con el Movimiento  Manuela Ramos desD. hace un año,  con su primer préstamo  D. S/ 500.00 nuevo soles compró dos ovejas.
Con este nuevo préstamo D. S/ 2000.00 nuevo soles, invertirá en la compra  D. dos vacas para engordarlas por dos meses y poder venderlas a buen precio. En el negocio le ayudan sus hijos.
Su sueño es tener más capital para comprar más ganados y obtener buenas ganancias.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son las reuniones y la facilidad del préstamo.
texts.en:
Yola, 50, is a member of the Virgen D. Concepcion community bank in the Peruvian "departamento" of Puno.  She is a widow with 2 children.  She has an elementary school education.  
Yola operates a livestock business, raising and selling farm animals: cattle and sheep, for example.  She has worked with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for a year.  She used her first loan, for S/.500 new soles, to buy two sheep.  
She will use this loan, for S/.2000 new soles, to buy two head of cattle that she will fatten for two months so that she can sell them for a better price.  Her two children help her with the business.
Yola wants to increase her working capital so that she can buy more head of cattle and, in turn, increase her income.  
Her favorite things about her community bank are the meetings and the ease of borrowing.

loans.use: to buy two head of cattle for a livestock business.

loans.name: Osman Adilson

texts.es:
Osman, es agricultor, tiene 23 años de edad, es soltero, vive con su madre y dos hermanos de 18 y 10 años de edad, él desde joven está dedicado a sembrar maíz, también trabaja de jornalero.
Actualmente está iniciando las labores de una nueva siembra, para lo que solicita un préstamo para comprar abono y fertilizantes para sembrar la milpa.
Su objetivo es seguir trabajando para el sustento de su familia, ya que sus cultivos son parte del consumo familia y también comercializa para generar ganancias.
texts.en:
Osman, 23, is a farmer.  He is single and lives with his mother and his two sisters who are 18- and 10-years old, respectively.  He has worked, from the time he was a boy, at maize farming.  It's his main source of living, but he also works as a day laborer.
Osman is planning his next crop and he's applying for a loan that he will use to buy fertilizer and manure for his fields.  
His goal is to continue working so that he can go on supporting his family.  He grows maize not only to generate an income, but also because the family consumes part of what he grows.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and manure for a maize farming business.

loans.name: Elfa Bolivia

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Municipal  de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Nueva Estrella Solidaria.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Elfa, tiene 49 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene seis hijos, dos de ellos ya son mayores de edad y los cuatro menores estudian en colegio y escuela. El marido es chofer.

Ella es una gran ama de casa que se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de ropa, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes cuando lleva nueva mercadería, nos cuenta que también trabaja a base de pedidos que le realizan con anticipación. Trabaja todos los días por las tardes, deja a crédito y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la compra en Portoviejo y también le mandan desde  Guayaquil. Lleva cuatro años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio  y le gusta porque con los créditos ella ha podido salir adelante.
 
Sus sueños es ver que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y sean buenos profesionales,
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the 'Nueva Estrella Solidaria' community bank meet in Municipal neighborhood, in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí.  This city has been known for many years as the 'city of the royal tamarind trees'.

Here we meet 49 year-old Elfa who lives with her common-law husband.  She has six children.  Two of her children are grown up and the other four are in high school and elementary school.  Her husband is a driver.

Elfa is a great homemaker who also sells all kinds of clothes.  She makes her sales door to door and also sells from her home where her customers come when she receives new merchandise.  She tells us that she also works filling orders that her customers make with her.  She works every afternoon.  Elfa leaves her goods on credit and collects payment every two weeks.  She buys her merchandise in Portoviejo and she is also sent some from Guayaquil.  She has been in this business for four years and is doing very well.

Elfa will use this loan to buy more merchandise such as pants, blouses, t-shirts and children's clothes.  She has been a member of her community bank since the beginning and she likes it because the loans have helped her to get ahead in life.

Elfa's dream is to see her children finish their studies and become good professionals.

loans.use: to buy pants, t-shirts, blouses and children's clothes

loans.name: Juan Ramon

texts.en: Juan Ramon lives in the Choluteca region of Honduras with his mother and younger siblings. He distributes and sells bread for a living, and is requesting a loan of 10,000 Honduras lempiras with which to buy merchandise. In his free time, Juan Ramon enjoys attending church.

loans.use: to purchase bulk quantities of bread.

loans.name: Tatiana

texts.es:
Tatiana es socia del  Banco Comunal “Virgen de Concepción”, ubicado en el C.P. Ayrumas Carumas del distrito de Acora, provincia de Puno y departamento de Puno, tiene 24 años de edad, es  conviviente y tiene 2 hijos. Tiene educación secundaria. 
La señora trabaja con el  Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace un año, su primer préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevo soles lo invirtió en su negocio de venta de ovinos y vacunos.
También se dedica a la artesanía con hilos de alpaca natural, a la fabricación de chompa, chalina, accesorios y animalitos.
Ahora solicitará un nuevo préstamo de  S/ 1500.00 nuevo soles, dinero utilizará para comprar una vaca premiada o siete corderos, dice  que a veces lo compra y lo vende al instante, otras veces las compra para su engorde.
En el negocio le ayuda su esposo, quien trabaja en construcción.
Su sueño es salir fuera de la ciudad, llevar carne a otros departamentos y así mejorar sus ganancias.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la puntualidad y la responsabilidad entre las socias.
texts.en:
Tatania is a member of the Virgen de Concepción Communal Bank located in C.P. Ayrumas Carumas in the district of Acora, province and department of Puno.  She is 24 years old and is in a common-law relationship.  She has two children and has a high school education.  

Tatania has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for one year.  She invested her first loan of S./ 500.00 nuevos soles in her sheep and cattle selling business. She is also an artisan and uses natural alpaca yarn to make sweaters, scarves, accessories, and stuffed animals.  

Now, she is requesting a new loan of S./ 1500.00 nuevos soles and will use the money to buy a prizewinning cow or seven lambs. She says sometimes she buys the animals and sells them instantly, and other times she buys them for fattening.

She helps her husband, who is in the construction business.  Her goal is to bring her meat to other departments outside the city, and in this way, improve her profits.  She likes the Communal Bank because of the punctuality and responsibility among the members.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Maria Milagro De Los Angeles

texts.es:
María, es soltera, vive con su madre y un hermano,  ella realiza ventas de pupusas desde hace 10 años, este negocio lo heredo de su madre, hasta el momento ha ganado experiencia, sus clientes son vecinos y amigos cercanos.
Ella solicita un préstamo para comprar chicharrón, quesillo, aceite, condimentos y bebidas, para el negocio, ya que por el momento no tiene un buen inventario de productos.
Para María, el objetivo primordial es mejorar su negocio, su calidad de vida, vivir con una mejor solvencia económica junto a su familia.
texts.en:
María is single and lives with her mother and brother.  She has been selling pupusas for 10 years. She inherited this business from her mother, and from that moment has gained experience.  Her customers are neighbors and close friends.

She is requesting a loan to buy fried pork rinds, cheese, oil, condiments and beverages for her business, because at the moment she does not have a good inventory of products.  For María, her primary objective is to improve her business and quality of life, and to live with better economic solvency with her family.

loans.use: to buy fried pork rinds, cheese, oil, condiments and beverages.

loans.name: Rene Cesar

texts.es: El sr. Rene vive en casa anticrético en la zona norte es soltero se dedica al transporte publico con su movilidad, el se dedica al transporte desde muy joven es su principal fuente de ingreso es nuevo en la institución saco el crédito para comprar repuestos y algunas mejoras para su movilidad, el sr. Se fue muy contento con el crédito obtenido es nuevo en la institución y con el crédito Kiva.
texts.en: Rene lives in a house in "anticrético" ( a special type of rental arrangement in Bolivia) in the the northern area.  He is single and works in public transportation with his taxi.  He has been working in transportation since he was very young and it is his main source of income.  Rene took the loan to buy spare parts and make some improvements for his taxi.  He was very happy with the obtained loan, as he is new to the field partner and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy parts for his taxi.

loans.name: Pedro Enrique Adolfo

texts.es: El señor Pedro es cliente nuevo de la institución el es dentista y tiene su consultorio en la zona de Mallasa, la atención del consultorio solo es por las tardes  y atiende a pobladores de la zona, el Sr. Pedro tiene un pequeño hijito de unos meses de nacido su esposa es psicóloga pero en estos momentos solo se esta dedicando al cuidado de su bebe ellos están viviendo con su suegra en la zona de Sopocachi en la casa tienen todas las comodidades pero don Pedro esta pensando en independizarse y poder tener su casa propia el crédito que esta solicitando es para la compra de maquinaria para el consultorio ya que quiere equiparla y poder brindar una atención mejorada a sus pacientes.
texts.en: Pedro is a new customer of the field partner.  He is a dentist and has his office in the Mallasa area.  He only works in the evenings and serves residents of the area.  Pedro has a little son who is a few months old.  His wife is a psychologist but now takes care of their baby full time.  They are living with her mother in the area of ​​Sopocachi.  At home they have all the amenities, but Pedro is thinking of becoming independent and being able to have their own house.  The requested loan is for the purchase of equipment for the office because he wants to equip it to provide better care for his patients.

loans.use: to purchase office equipment.

loans.name: Reyna Cristina

texts.en: Reyna lives with her husband and two children in the Choluteca region of Honduras. For the past five years she has made and sold freshly prepared food. She is requesting a loan of Lps. 10,000 with which to buy ingredients for her food business. In her spare time, Reyna raises chickens at home.

loans.use: to purchase meats, rice, cheese, cornmeal, eggs, butter, cooking oil, salt, and condiments.

loans.name: Flor Del Rocío

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Municipal  de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Nueva Estrella Solidaria.

Aquí conocimos a la señora Flor, tiene 39 años de edad, es madre soltera de 4  hijos de 20, 17, 12 y 7 años de edad, todos aun viven con ella y estudian en colegio y escuela. Lleva en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio ya que es fundadora del banco  y le gusta porque sus compañeras son muy ordenadas y cumplidas con sus obligaciones.

Ella es una gran ama de casa que para sacar a sus hijos adelante en este mundo tan difícil se dedica al comercio, vende detergentes, desinfectantes, jabón, cloro, entre otras productos. Ella contrata vendedores a quienes les paga un sueldo, ellos ofrecen los productos puerta a puerta, también vende en su casa sobre todo a vecinos y comerciantes a quienes les vende a mejor precio por que comprar mayor cantidad. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00hasta las 18h00 y a veces hasta más tarde cuando tiene que recibir o entregar los pedidos. Lleva cuatro años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más productos como cloro, detergentes, desinfectantes, jabones, etc.
 
Sus sueños son tener una distribuidora a nivel provincial.
texts.en:
The members of the "Nueva Estrella Solidaria" (New Star Solidarity) Communal Bank meet every 15 days in the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabi.  The city has been known for many years as the City of the Reales Tamarindos.

Here we met Flor, 39 years old and a single mother of 4 children, 20, 17, 12 and 7 years old.  They are all still living with her and study in colleges and schools.  She has been in the communal bank since the beginning as a founder of the bank.  She likes it because her partners are very organized and fulfil their obligations.

Flor is a housewife raising her children is this difficult world.  So she works selling detergents, disinfectants, soap, and chlorine, among other products. She hires salespeople who are paid a salary, and they sell products door to door.  She also sells from her home, mainly to neighbors and businesses, to whom she gives a better price as they buy larger quantities. Flor works every day from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm and sometimes even later when she has to receive or deliver orders.  She has been dedicated to this activity for 4 years and is doing very well.

Flor will use the requested loan to buy more products, such as bleach, detergents, disinfectants, soaps, etc. Her dreams are to have a distributor at the provincial level.

loans.use: to buy chlorine, detergents, disinfectants, soap etc.

loans.name: Julia Amalia

texts.en: Julia lives in the Choluteca region of Honduras with her five grown children. For the last five years, she has run a small convenience shop, selling basic foodstuffs and household supplies. Julia is requesting a loan of HNL 10,000 with which to buy meats, cheeses, fruits, vegetables, snacks, beverages, basic grains, salt, butter, cooking oil, basic household cleaning products, and personal hygiene products for her shop. In her spare time she enjoys attending church.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her shop.

loans.name: Victor Andres

texts.en:
Victor is 29 years old and lives in the city of Ibarra in northern Ecuador. He is single and lives with his parents and has one child who is a year and five months old. Victor is entrepreneurial, hardworking, and responsible. He has a business selling cell phones, pants, shirts, and other merchandise from his home. In addition to the merchandise he keeps in stock, he also takes orders from customers. He began by selling two or three phones and a few pants that he financed with a small loan from FODEMI. 

Victor is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise for his growing business. His past loans have brought him more business and more profits. His dream is to work independently as an entrepreneur in his own local store selling cell phones and clothing.

loans.use: to buy cell phones and clothing for his store

loans.name: Paca Francisca

texts.en: Paca Francisca lives in the Choluteca region of Honduras with her husband and two children. For the last five years, she has run a small convenience store where she sells basic food items and household supplies. She is applying for a loan for Lps. 8,000 to buy merchandise to sell to her customers. In her spare time, she enjoys attending church.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in a convenience store.

loans.name: Las Violetas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario se llama "Las Violetas", se encuentra localizado en la comunidad de Tepalcingo, está integrado por:
*la señora M Isabel va a comprar con su crédito productos por kit perfumes, maquillajes, joyería, etc.
*la señora María Teresa va a comprar cloro en fórmula, aromatizantes, fabuloso y jabón liquido todo por galón
*la señora Emilia va a comprar botín para caballero de diferentes colores
*la señorita Viridiana va a comprar Zapato para dama, caballero, niño y compra de ropa interior para dama
*la señorita Yazbeth va a comprar Topperware por paquete para su pedido y por mayoreo
*la señorita Isindy Anahi va a comprar ropa para dama, pantalones de mezclilla, blusas de diferentes modelo
*la señora Oralia va comprar servilletas y mandiles por docena 
La señora Oralia tiene 35 años de edad ella estudio hasta la secundaria, ella es casada tiene 1 hijo que se llama Roberto tiene 6 años de edad está en Preescolar, ella vende servilletas para las tortillas o para tapar la comida, ella solicito su crédito para comprar servilletas y surtir su negocio, ella inicio su negocio hace tres años, su mamá le enseño a vende servilletas.
En la feria de Tepalcingo vienen muchos comerciantes de diferentes comunidades a vender sus productos, ahí vio las servilletas que las vendían por docena y con unos ahorros que tenía compró varias docenas de servilletas para iniciar su negocio, así empezó a vender el tianguis de Tepalcingo está ubicado en el centro, como a 15 minutos de su casa. 
Este negocio es muy importante porque se ayuda toda la familia económicamente, ella se siente orgullosa de poder trabajar en su propio negocio, poder cuidar a su pequeño hijo  y atender a sus clientas amable y cordialmente. Ella está feliz con este crédito que lograron obtener de Kiva porque va a surtir su negocio para crecer y tener variedad en modelos de servilleta para ofrecerle a sus clientas que son las señoras ama de casa,  ella utiliza las ganancias una parte para volver a surtir su negocio y otra parte para los gastos de la casa. Sus sueños y esperanzas son sobresalir, que su hijo estudie y que tenga un buen trabajo. 
Las integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “muchas gracias por apoyar a la gente que lo necesita, es una ayuda para nuestros negocio y nuestras familias”.
texts.en:
This community bank is called 'Las Violetas' and it is located in the community of Tepalcingo.  The group's members are:

*María Isabel, who will use her loan to buy perfumes, make-up, jewelry, etc.
*María Teresa, who will buy bleach, air fresheners, Fabuloso (a household clearner) and liquid soap, by the gallon
*Emilia, who will buy men's boots in different colors
*Viridiana, who will buy ladies', men's and children's shoes and ladies' underwear
*Yazbeth, who will buy individual items of Tupperware to fill orders and also buy some wholesale
*Isindy Anahi, who will buy ladies' clothes, denim pants and different styles of blouse
*Oralia, who will buy napkins and aprons by the dozen

Oralia is 35 years old and studied up to high school level.  She is married and has one son called Roberto who is 6 years old and currently in pre-school.  Oralia sells napkins for tortillas and for covering food.  She requested her loan to buy napkins and stock her business.  Oralia started her business three years ago.  It was her mom who taught her how to sell napkins.

Many salespeople from different communities come to the Tepalcingo street market to sell their products.  It was there that Oralia saw napkins being sold by the dozen.  She used some savings that she had to buy several dozen napkins with which to start her business.  She started to sell her products in the Tepalcingo street market which is located in the town center, 15 minutes from her home.

This business is very important because it helps Oralia's family financially.  She feels proud to be able to work in her own business, take care of her young son and serve her customers in a kind and friendly manner.  She is happy to be receiving this loan from Kiva because she will use it to stock her business so that she can grow and have a range of different types of napkin to offer her customers, who are housewives.  Oralia uses some of her profits to re-stock her business and also uses some to cover her household expenses.  Her dreams and hopes are to get ahead in life, and for her son to study and get a good job.

The members of this group would like to say to Kiva and Fundación Realidad "Many thanks for supporting people who need it.  You are helping our businesses and our families".

loans.use: to buy napkins for tortillas

loans.name: Hilda Elizabeth

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, conocida como la Ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos desde épocas coloniales se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Mi Mundo Natural.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Hilda, tiene 31 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos de  12, 8, 3 años y una bebé de siete meses, los  dos mayores estudian en colegio y  escuela. El marido es comerciante.
 
Ella tiene un local en el cual se dedica a la venta de arreglos florales (floristería), vende arreglos de varias formas, tamaños, colores y precios.  Nos cuenta que son muchos los clientes que todos los días realizan obsequios con sus productos. Trabaja todos los días desde las 7h00 hasta las 18h00. Las flores le mandan desde la sierra especialmente las rosas, es un comerciante mayorista quien le surte en su local tres días a la semana. Lleva con su negocio por 12 años y le ha ido muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar flores. Lleva en el banco comunal 8 ciclo y le gusta porque con los créditos su negocio ha crecido cada vez más.
 
Su sueño es tener un local propio ya que actualmente arrienda.
texts.en:
The members of the “Mi Mundo Natural” (My Natural World) communal bank meet every two weeks in the city of Portoviejo, known since colonial times as the City of the Royal Tamarinds.

We met Hilda, 31, here.  She’s in a relationship and they have four children who are 12, 8 and three years old and a 7-month-old baby girl.  The two oldest go to secondary and elementary schools.  Her husband’s a merchant.

She has a locale where she sells floral arrangements (flower shop).  She sells arrangements in different shapes, sizes, colors and prices.  She tells us that many customers make daily gifts of her products.  She works every day from 7am until 6pm.  The flowers are sent to her from the mountains, especially the roses, by a wholesaler that stocks her locale three times a week.  She’s been in business 12 years and has done very well.

This loan is to buy flowers.  She’s been in the communal bank for 8 cycles and she likes it because her business has grown a bit more with each loan.  Her dream is to have a locale of her own because she currently rents.

loans.use: to buy flowers.

loans.name: Teresa Leonila

texts.es:
Teresa de 54 años, vive en la Primavera de Duran (perímetro urbano fue originalmente irregular, con varios cerros, riachuelos y lagunas que aún se presentan como restos de una ecología en disolución). Es separada y tienen hijos mayores d edad, se dedica a la venta de ropas y accesorios para mujer.

Comenzó su actividad hace un tiempo atrás ya que quería tener su propio negocio y al mismo tiempo dedicarle mas tiempo a su familia. Labora sola y va recorriendo por sus amistad y conocido promocionando sus ropa y accesorios para sus respectivas ventas. Con la ayuda del préstamo quiere comprar materiales para construcción como puertas hierro y pinturas. En un futuro desea terminar de construir su vivienda.
texts.en:
Teresa, 54, lives in La Primavera in Duran (an urban outlying area that was once irregular that has hills, streams and lagoons still present as evidence of ecology in disruption).  She’s separated and has adult children.  She sells clothes and women’s accessories.

She started her activity some time ago because she wanted to have a business of her own while spending more time with her family.  She works by herself visiting her friends and acquaintances promoting her clothes and accessories for sale.  

With help from the loan she wants to buy building materials and supplies like iron doors and paint.  In the future she’d like to finish building her house.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Fresas Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama "Fresas"  que se integra de tres señoras cada una con diferente actividad y está ubicado en la lo calidad de Coapilla Estado de Chiapas.
     Las señora quien se le tomo la  entrevista es la señora Candelaria, ella es casada con el señor  Alfonzo y con quien procreo tres hijos que aun están a su responsabilidad y son: María Adriana  de ocho años de edad, Sandra Guadalupe de cinco años de edad y el  más pequeño es  Luis Alfonso de un año de edad.
     Ella se dedica a la elaboración de tamales y solcito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de ingredientes, como son: carne, masa, pasas, hoja de guineo,  entre otros,  y así poder elaborar su actividad en donde lleva un año y dos  meses en donde comenta que le va bien ya que con ello ha tenido un buen resultado de ingreso en su hogar.
    Comenzó con esta actividad por su propia creatividad ya que  por un tiempo estuvo apoyando a una compañera hacer tamales y vio que le dejaba ingresos, por eso ella decidió trabajar la misma actividad y nos platica que le va bien.
     Su más grande deseo  es que con esta pequeña actividad pueda  tener sus propios ahorros y  con el préstamo lograr trabajar para salir adelante con su familia.
     Las señoras que integran en el grupo son: Consuelo, quien se dedica a la  compra i venta de marranos y la señora Isabel se dedica a la compra y venta de sandalias.
texts.en:
The group is called “Fresas” (Strawberries) and is composed of three women.  Each of them has a different activity and it’s located in the town of Coapilla, State of Chiapas.

The woman who was interviewed is Candelaria.  She is married to Alfonzo and they have three children still in their care:  María Adriana, 8, Sandra Guadalupe, 5 and the youngest, Luis Alfonso, 1.

She works making tamales and asked for the loan to buy ingredients like: meat, dough, raisins and banana leaves, among others to continue with her activity that she’s been doing for a year and two months.  She comments that she does well since she’s had good results with respect to household income.

She started this activity due to her own creativity because for a time she had been helping a friend make tamales and she noticed that it was profitable.  She, therefore, decided to go into the same occupation and she tells us that she does well.

Her greatest wish is that this small activity will allow her to have her own savings and that the loan will allow her to work to get ahead with her family.

The other women who are members of the group are: Consuelo, who is a pig merchant and Isabel who is a sandals merchant.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make tamales.

loans.name: La Presa Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario se llama La presa se encuentra localizado en Palo Blanco, en el estado D. Morelos México, está integrado por la señora Daniela va a comprar con su préstamo perfumes, cremas, maquillaje, labiales, la señora Socorro va a comprar aceite, azúcar, papel higiénico, sopas, jabón , etc., la señora Agustina va a comprar manta tipo red para pescar mojarras, la señora Erisela va a comprar catálogos para empezar a vender zapatos, la señora Graciela va a comprar borregos para crianza, la señora Anahi va a comprar refrescos por mayoreo. 
La señora Agustina  tiene 46 años D. edad, ella estudio hasta el 4º. Año D. primaria, ella vive en unión libre y tiene 3 hijas Tania Lizbeth D. 19 años D. edad ya trabaja, María Guadalupe D. 14 años D. edad no estudia y Alessandra Sofía D. 9 años D. edad está estudiando la primaria. Ella venD. mojarras tilapia y solicito su crédito para comprar tarrallas, redes y madera para hacer una lancha. Ella inicio su negocio hace 20 años, su esposo aprendió viendo a sus compañeros como pescaban, a él le prestaban la lancha y las redes para pescar; haciendo un gran esfuerzo ella y su esposo compraron la madera para construir su lancha y redes para trabajar en la pesca D. mojarras. 
Ella sale a vender las mojarras al mercado D. Tepalcingo y Axochiapan utilizando el transporte colectivo, su negocio es importante porque gracias a este negocio tiene para comer, ella está orgullosa D. tener un trabajo honrado y que tiene dinero, la mojarra que lleva a vender la termina toda por su buen sabor porque van vivas y frescas, los desafíos que enfrenta el negocio es el clima, ya que en tiempo D. calor se mueren las mojarras por el calor, otro desafío es la competencia, pues hay mas compañeras que van a vender mojarras D. otras presas.
Las ganancias las utiliza para pagar el préstamo, para la comida y para la escuela D. su hija, ella tiene las esperanzas D. construir un cuarto para sus hijas y las mejorías que desea lograr para sus hijas son que  crezca, que ella les pueda dar lo mas que se pueda, que no deseen las cosas. 
Las integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “les agradecemos mucho que nos apoyan con sus préstamos y que nos sigan apoyando, con su ayuda podemos salir adelante, muchas gracias que nos están prestando”.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “La Presa” (The Dam) and is located in Palo Blanco in the Mexican state of Morelos.  Its members are Daniela who will buy perfume, creams, makeup, lipsticks, etc., Agustina, who will buy net-like cloth to fish tilapia, Socorro who will buy oil, sugar, toilet paper, soup, soap, etc., Erisela who will buy catalogues to start selling shoes, Graciela who will buy sheep to raise and Anahí who will buy soft drinks at wholesale.

Agustina is 46 years old.  She finished 4th graD..  She has a spouse and three daughters:  Tania Lizbeth, 19, who is already employed, María Guadalupe, 14, who does not go to school and Alessandra Sofía, 9, who is in elementary school.

She sells tilapia and asked for the loan to buy circular cast nets, nets and lumber to build a boat.  She started her business 20 years ago.  Her husband learned by watching his companions fish and they’d lend him the boat and nets so he could fish.  Thanks to  much effort on her and his part they bought lumber to build a boat of their own and nets to work fishing tilapia.

She goes out using public collective transportation to the Tepalcingo and Axochiapan markets to sell the tilapia.   Her business is important because thanks to it she has food to eat.  She is proud to have an honorable occupation and that she has money.  She sells out the tilapia she takes to sell because of its good flavor; she sells them alive and fresh.   The challenges she faces in business is the weather because during times of heat the tilapia die and another challenge is competition because there are many other companions that also go to sell tilapia from other dams.

She will use profits to repay the loan, for food and for her daughter’s education.  She hopes to build a bedroom for her daughters.  The improvements she wants to accomplish are so that her daughters will grow and she will be able to proviD. the most possible so that they won’t desire things.

The group members want to say to Kiva and Fundación Realidad:  “We are very grateful for the support you’ve given us with the loans and please continue to support us.  With your help we can get ahead.  Thank you very much for lending to us.”

loans.use: to buy cast nets, nets and lumber to build a boat.

loans.name: Ligia Elizabeth

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, conocida como la Ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos desde épocas coloniales se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Mi Mundo Natural.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Ligia, tiene 23 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 8 y 5 años los mismos que estudian en escuela. El marido es empleado privado. Es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque los intereses son más bajos que en otras instituciones de crédito.
 
Ella se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de ropa y también a la venta de recargas telefónicas, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y  la mayor parte de sus ventas las realiza  en su  casa ya que también se desempeña como auxiliar contable en un negocio que es del papá de nuestra amiga,  ella aprovecha para realizar sus ventas tanto de ropa como de las recargas al mismo tiempo que realiza su trabajo de contadora. Trabaja de lunes a sábado en todas sus actividades y el domingo ella nos cuenta que se dedica a descansar para empezar una nueva semana con más ganas. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Huaquillas cada vez que necesita más ropa.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. 

Su sueño es tener su casa propia ya que vive en casa de los padres.
texts.en: The members of Mi Mundo Natural ("My Natural World") Community Bank meet every 15 days in the city of Portoviejo, which has been known as the "City of Royal Tamarind Trees" since colonial times. Here we find Ligia, who is 23 years old, lives with her husband and has two children, ages 8 and 5, who are in school. Her husband is a private employee. Ligia is a founding member of the community bank, which she likes because the interest rates are much lower than other institutions. She makes a living selling all kinds of clothing and also reloading cell phone plans. She works door to door, but does the majority of her sales from her home, since she also works as an accounting assistant for her friend's father's company. Ligia takes advantage of selling clothing as much as reloading phone plans at the same time as she is working as an accountant. She works from Monday to Saturday in all of her activities, and on Sunday she relaxes so she can start the new week refreshed. She goes to the town of Huaquillas to buy merchandise every time she needs more clothing. She plans to use the loan to purchase more clothing, such as pants, blouses, shirts and baby clothes. Her dream is to have her own home since she lives in her parents' house.

loans.use: to purchase pants, blouses, shirts and baby clothes.

loans.name: Susana Celia

texts.es:
Susana es socia del Banco Comunal “San Juan de Tahuaco” ubicado en Centro Poblado Sanquira, distrito de Yunguyo, provincia Yunguyo y departamento de Puno, tiene 26 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 01 hijo.  Cuenta con estudios de primaria.
Trabaja con el  Movimiento  Manuela  Ramos desde hace dos años,  su primer préstamo fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de venta de animales caseros.
Actualmente se dedica a la venta de granos de la Región como chuño, habas y quinua.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de  S/. 500.00 nuevos soles comprará ocho arrobas de chuño, nos cuenta que lo compra en Bolivia y lo vende en Yunguyo. En el negocio la ayuda su esposo, quien también trabaja en construcción civil.
Su sueño es mejorar y seguir con el mismo negocio.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son las reuniones, el ahorro y sus ganancias.
texts.en: Susana is a member of the "San Juan de Tahuaco" community bank in Sanquira, district and province of Yunguyo, department of Puno, Peru. She is 26 years old, married and has a son. She has an elementary-school education. She has worked with Kiva partner Movimiento Manuela Ramos for the past two years. Her first loan was for 500 soles, which she used to invest in her business selling pets. Currently, she makes a living selling regional grains, such as potato flour, beans and quinoa. With this new loan of 500 soles, she plans to buy eight large sacks of potato flour. She tells us that she buys the product in Bolivia and sells it in Yunguyo. Her husband helps her with the business and also works in construction. Susana's biggest dream is to improve and continue with her business. She likes her community bank for the meetings, the savings and her profits.

loans.use: to purchase eight large sacks of potato flour.

loans.name: La Frontera Group

texts.en:
Rosa, Blanca, and Isidra, all of whom live in the Choluteca region of Honduras, formed the “La Frontera” solidarity group in June, 2011. Collectively they will serve as guarantors of one another’s loans. 

Rosa is married with four children and makes a living by selling freshly prepared food. She is requesting a loan of Lps. 8,000 with which to buy ingredients for her food business. 

Blanca is married with two children and works selling clothing and citrus juices. She is requesting a loan of Lps. 5,000 to buy merchandise.

Isidra is married with two children and operates a small convenience shop. She is requesting a loan of Lps. 4,000 to purchase merchandise for her store.

loans.use: to purchase pants, shirts, shorts, shoes, sandals, meats, cheeses, fruits, vegetables, snacks, beverages, basic grains, salt, butter, cooking oil, basic household cleaning products, and personal hygiene products.

loans.name: Frelly Roxana

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, conocida como la Ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos desde épocas coloniales se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Mi Mundo Natural.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Frelly, tiene 25 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo de tres años de edad, el marido es dueño de un taxi y un camión.

Ella para obtener sus propios ingresos y no depender de nadie se dedica en sus ratos libres al comercio, vende productos por catalogo como: ropa, zapatillas y productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y  trabaja tres días a la semana más que todo en las tardes cuando esta mas desocupada, ella  deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana o cada quince de acuerdo a lo que quieran sus clientes. Sus productos los recibe en el centro en una distribuidora. Tiene cuatro años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien. Nos cuenta que lo que más vende son los perfumes tanto para damas como para caballeros ya que son muy buenos comenta.
	
Este crédito es para comprar zapatillas, perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa. Lleva cuatro años  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer.

Su sueño es tener una boutique.
texts.en: The members of Mi Mundo Natural ("My Natural World") Community Bank meet every 15 days in the city of Portoviejo, which has been known as the "City of Royal Tamarind Trees" since colonial times. Here we find Frelly, who is 25 years old, married and has a 3-year-old son. Her husband owns a taxi and a truck. In order to earn her own income and not be dependent upon anyone, Frelly works as a merchant in her free time, selling products such as clothing, footwear and Yanbal-brand cosmetics via catalog. She sells door to door and works three days a week, most often in the afternoons when she is less busy. She sells the products on credit and collects every week or 15 days, depending on what her customers want. Frelly tells us that her best sellers are her perfumes and colognes since they are really good. She plans to use this loan to purchase footwear, perfumes, creams, cosmetics and clothing. She has been with the community bank for four years and likes it because the payments are easy to make. Her dream is to have a boutique.

loans.use: to purchase footwear, perfumes, creams, cosmetics and clothing.

loans.name: Sebastiana Gregoria

texts.es:
Sebastiana es socia del  Banco Comunal “Virgen de Concepción”, ubicado en el C.P. Ayrumas Carumas del distrito de Acora, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 42 años de edad, está   casada y tiene 6 hijos (2 independientes).  Tiene grado de instrucción 5to de primaria.
La señora se dedica al engorde de ganados como ovejas y alpacas.  Desde hace un año trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, con su primer préstamo solicitado de S/. 500.00 nuevo soles compró cuatro ovejitas.
Con este nuevo préstamo de S/ 1500.00 nuevo soles comprará doce corderos para engordarlos por cuatro meses y venderlos en la localidad de Totorani e Ilave.  En el negocio la ayudan sus hijos y amigos ya que su esposo trabaja de obrero en la ciudad de Tacna.
Además nos cuenta  que se dedica al tejido (esto lo realiza con otro capital).
Su sueño es tener una buena casa y una tienda de ferretería en la localidad de Ilave y Puno.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son las reuniones y lo que gana sus ahorros.
texts.en: Sebastiana is a member of the communal lender “Virgen de Concepción”, in Ayrumas Carumas, Acora, Puno, Peru.  She is 42, married and has 6 children (two live independently).  She studied until the 5th year of primary school.  Sebastiana raises farm animals such as sheep and alpacas.  With her first loan last year with Movimiento Manuela Ramos of S/. 500.00 she bought 4 sheep.  Now she seeks a credit of S/ 1500.00 to buy twelve lambs to sell in the market of Totorani.  Her sons and friends assist her in her work, as her husband works faraway in the city of Tacna.  She also sews to supplement her income.  Sebastiana hopes to have a better house one day and open a local hardware store.  She enjoys her association with microcredit and especially the gatherings and seeing her projects pay out.

loans.use: to buy twelve lambs to raise and re-sell

loans.name: Luis Javier

texts.es:
Don Luis de profesión ingeniero Agrónomo, labora a una empresa privada con más de dieciocho años, es casado y padre muy responsable.
A través de los años ha logrado estabilidad en el trabajo, su propia vivienda que ha venido haciendo mejora para  bienestar comun de la familia.
Este es su tercer ciclo en Afodenic, con el crédito anterior logro ampliar dos closet, y ahora cambiara el cielo raso, ya que el que tiene, está en mal estado en donde comprara los materiales para realizar la obra con dieciocho metros cuadrado. El cual está contento por esta mejora.
texts.en:
