Don Luis is an agronomist and has worked for a private company for 18 years.  He is married and a very responsible father.  Over time he has been able to achieve work stability and his own house which he has been improving for his family's well-being.

This is his third loan through Afodenic.  He plans to use it to expand two closets and change the ceiling panels which are in bad condition.  He will buy materials to cover 18 square meters of ceiling.  He is very happy about this improvement.

loans.use: To buy ceiling panels for home improvement.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel de 50 años, vive en una zona urbana en el Suburbio de Guayaquil. Es esposa es maestra en un escuela y tienen dos hijos de 20 años y una menor de 10 años que estudia en la escuela donde trabaja su esposa. Realiza show espectáculos Lunita como payaso..

Toda la vida ha trabajado como payaso y hace espectáculos para fiestas como horas locas y magia. Labora los fines de semanas cuando tiene contrataciones en diferentes fiestas y lo realiza junto con su familia. Con la ayuda del préstamo quiere comprar amplificadores a $500, arreglos de su vehículo $300 y parlantes $200 para mejorar su negocio. En un futuro desea comprarse una camioneta doble cabina.
texts.en:
Miguel, 50, lives in the urban area of the Guayaquil suburb.  His wife is a school teacher and they have two children, ages 20 and 10.  The youngest attends school where his mother teachers.  Miguel performs as a clown in the Lunita shows.

All of his life he has worked as a clown and performs at parties for "crazy" and "magic" hour.  He works on weekends, together with his family, when contracted for different parties.  With the help of the loan he wants to buy amplifiers ($500) and loudspeakers ($200), and repair his car ($300).  In the future he hopes to buy a twin cabin van.

loans.use: To buy amplifiers, loudspeakers and repair his car.

loans.name: Mujeres Rumbo Al Progreso Group

texts.es:
Fue la cuñada D. Violeta quien le enseño a trabajar vendiendo productos D. belleza  al principio empezó como su ayudante y poco a poco fue incursionando por su propia cuenta ofreciendo a sus amigos y familiares así fue ganando sus propios clientes  en la actualidad el negocio es D. ella aparte D. vender cosméticos y colonias  también ofrece tintes D. cabello  gracias a su trabajo colabora con los gastos familiares sobretodo con la lonchera D. sus hijos y los alimentos diarios, ahora se iniciara en otro negocio que es recargas virtuales y venta D. tarjetas para celulares, su préstamo lo usara para la compra D. tarjetas este negocio tiene mucha acogida debido a la demanda D. este servicio, la Sra. Violeta es socia del grupo “MUJERES RUMBO AL PROGRESO” grupo formado por 10 socias que viven en puente piedra Lima Perú.

  * Violeta viste polo blanco sin mangas (parada)
texts.en:
Violeta's sister-in-law was the one who taught her how to sell beauty products.  At first she worked as an assistant, but little by little she became independent and offered her products to friends and family to establish her own customer base.  Now she also sells cosmetics, colognes and hair color products.  Through her work she is able to help out with household expenses, especially daily food costs for her children.  She is about to set up a new business which is the sale of cell phone cards and virtual recharge.  She will use the loan to buy cards for this business which is in much demand.  Mrs. Violeta is a member of the communal bank "MUJERES RUMBO AL PROGRESO" which is comprised of 10 members that live in Puente Piedra in Lima, Perú.

* Violeta is standing and dressed in a white tank top.

loans.use: To buy telephone cards.

loans.name: Angel Eduardo

texts.es:
Angel de 57 años, vive en una zona urbana en el Guasmo (fue nombrado así debido a la especie de árboles Guazuma ulmifolia. El Guasmo es un barrio popular, de clase humilde, que anteriormente era una hacienda) de Guayaquil, su esposa le ayuda en el expreso , su actividad es hacer expreso escolar.

Comenzó hace un tiempo atrás por medio de sus amistades logro sacar un cupo en los colegios para realizar expresos escolares. Tiene un por medio de 30 alumnos y cobra a $ 30 a cada uno. Con la ayuda del préstamo quiere renovar su vehículos comprando llantas nueva que cuesta $80 cada para mayor seguridad en el transporte. En un futuro dese comprarse otro expreso ya que puede conseguir otro cupo en otro colegio para servicios de expreso.
texts.en:
Angel, 57, lives in the urban area called Guasmo (named after the plant species Guazuma ulmifolia.  Guasmo is a popular, modest class neighborhood which used to be a ranch) in Guayaquil.  His wife helps with his transporation service which is school transportation.

He started his business, through friends, some time ago and was able to get contracts with schools.  He has an average of 30 students and charges $30 per student.  He plans to use the loan to renew his vehicles by buying new tires at a cost of $80 each, for transportation safety purposes.  In the future he would like to buy another van so he can add another school to his transportation service.

loans.use: To buy new tires for his vehicle.

loans.name: Regubertha

texts.es:
Regubertha es socia del  Banco Comunal “San Miguel Arcángel II”, ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, provincia El Collao y departamento de Puno, tiene 18 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente,  tiene un hijo y solo  estudió hasta 1ro de secundaria.
La señora trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace tres meses, su primer préstamo, que fue por S/. 500.00 nuevos soles lo invirtió en su negocio de venta de carne porcino -ovino.
Con este nuevo préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, comprará tres animales para su respectivo carneo y poder venderlo, la señora dice que trabaja junto con su  esposo.
Su sueño es tener más capital para mejorar el negocio y así tener mayores ganancias.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es el ahorro.
texts.en:
Regubertha is a member of the communal bank "San Miguel Arcángel II", located in the Llave District, province of El Collao in the department of Puno.  She is 18, has a live-in partner and a son in first grade.

She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for three months.  She used her first loan of 500 PEN to invest in her pork-lamb butchery.

She plans to use the new loan of 500 PEN to buy animals for her butcher shop.  She works with her husband.  Her dream is to have more capital to improve her business and increase income.  What she likes most about the communal bank is how much she can save.

loans.use: To buy three animals for her butcher shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy utensils for her business such as dishes, cups, and other supplies to sell food.

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, conocida como la Ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos desde épocas coloniales se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Mi Mundo Natural.

En este lugar conocimos a Jorge, tiene 25 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual aun no tiene  hijos, su esposa trabaja de cajera en una discoteca en la ciudad de Manta. Lleva cuatro ciclos en el banco comunal y le gusta por las facilidades que presta el banco tanto para conseguir los créditos como el sistema de pagos.

El se dedica junto  a su esposa ha trabajar en una discoteca en la ciudad de Manta por las noches, pero en las tardes él también se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo, sus forma de venta es puerta a puerta y también en su casa ya que allí su esposa le ayuda mientras el sale a recorrer la ciudad. Nos cuenta que lleva tres años realizando esta actividad comercial y le va muy bien, la mercadería la va a traer él mismo desde Guayaquil ya que allá consigue más barato y mayor variedad.
 
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. 

Su sueño es tener un buen porvenir
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, known as the city of Royal tamarind since colonial times, members of the communal bank My Natural World meet.

Here we met Jorge who is 25 years old, in a common-law marriage, and does not have any children yet. His wife works as a cashier at a club in the city of Manta. He has had four loans with the communal bank and likes the ease of having a loan granted as well as the bank's system of payments.

He and his wife work together in a discotheque at night but in the afternoons he also sells clothes. He sells all types of clothes door to door as well as from his home since his wife helps him while goes out to sell. He tells us that he has been selling clothes for 3 years and it is going very well. He brings back his merchandise from Guayaquil since it is cheaper and there is more variety offered.

He will use this loan to buy merchandise such as: pants, blouses, shirts, and children's clothes.

His dream is to have better future.

loans.use: pants, blouses, shirts, and children's clothes.

loans.name: Petrona

texts.es:
Petrona es socia del Banco Comunal “San Juan D. Tahuaco” ubicado en el Centro Poblado D. Tahuaco, distrito D. Yunguyo, provincia Yunguyo y departamento D. Puno, tiene 52 años D. edad, está casada y tiene 07 hijos (3 independientes). Estudió educación primaria incompleta.
Petrona trabaja junto con su esposo e hijos, se dedican a la compra y venta D. ganados, como ovinos y vacunos.  Su préstamo inicial fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizó en su negocio. Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace catorce años.
Con éste nuevo crédito D. S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles, comprará una vaca mejorada.  Nos cuenta que al comprar los ganados primero los engorda por cuatro meses, luego los venD. en la localidad D. Yunguyo, también dice que se dedica a la venta D. habas y papa en Yunguyo y Desaguadero, en el negocio le ayuda su esposo e hijos.
Su sueño es tener más ganados y así mejorar sus ganancias.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son las reuniones y la facilidad del préstamo.
texts.en:
Pterona is a member of the "San Juan D. Tahuaco" communal bank located in the town of Tahuaco, Yunguyo district, Yunguyo province, and Puno department. She is 52 years old, married, and has 7 children (3 of them independent). She studied primary education but never finished.  Petrona works with her husband and children. The buy and sell livestock such as sheep and cows. Her first loan was worth $300 Peruvian Soles which she used for her business. She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for 14 years. 
With this new $3,000 Peruvian soles loan she will buy a better quality cow. She tells us that once she buys her livestock she fattens them up for four months, then sells them locally in Yunguyo. She also says that she sells peas and potatoes in Yunguyo and Desaguadero where her husband and children help her. 
Her dream is to have more livestock to make more profits.
What she likes about the communal bank are the meetings and the ease of getting loans.

loans.use: buy a better quality cow.

loans.name: Elsy Marilyn

texts.es:
Elsy de 56 años, vive en una zona urbana en las Orquídeas (llamado así porque en su originalidad había muchas flores orquídeas) de Guayaquil. Es soltera y tiene 4 hijos, su actividad es la venta de ropa.

Comenzó hace muchos años atrás inicio su negocio de ventas de ropas para solventar los gastos del hogar y de sus hijos. Labora diariamente desde temprano sale a promocionar su mercadería a amigos y conocidos. Con la ayuda del préstamo quiere comprar mas mercadería para sus ventas de ropa y así producir mas su negocio. En un futuro anhela tener su propio local y hacer dos adecuaciones en su casa.
texts.en:
Elsy is 56 years old, lives in an urban area in Orchids (named that because there were originally many orchids) of Guayaquil. She is single and has 4 children. Her business consists of selling clothes.

She began her business many years back to help make house payments and maintain her children. She works very early every morning by going out to promote her merchandise to friends and acquaintances. She wants to use the loan to buy more merchandise and make more profits. In the future she would like to have her own shop and make two repairs in her home.

loans.use: buy clothing merchandise worth $1000.

loans.name: Santa Rosa De Lima Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Ana con sus 68 años de edad aun se siente útil es por ello que  trabaja con una sobrina que exporta joyas al extranjero este trabajo que realiza  la ayuda a estar ocupada lo que ella hace es buscar buenos precios  con joyeros y artesanos para que le puedan preparar la mercadería como pulseras, aretes, collares etc. Esto a su vez las envía a su sobrina que las vende a buen precio,  Por su lado ella también ofrece algunas joyas a sus amigos y familiares este negocio le permite tener  un dinero extra que le sirve para cubrir algunos gastos personales, ahora esta muy deseosa de invertir su préstamo en la compra de mas joyas debido a que se avecinan un mes de mucha demanda, ella pertenece al grupo SANTA ROSA del cual es socia.

  *La Sra. Ana esta con blusa blanca, tambien aparecen 2 Sras que son pasivas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ana in spite of being 68 years old feels competent enough to work which is why she exports jewelry with her niece. This job helps her become occupied. She goes out and looks for jewelry at low prices with jewelers and artisans and they can prepare the merchandise such as bracelets, earrings, necklaces, etc. Once they are ready she sends them to her niece to be sold at good prices. She also offers some pieces of jewelry to friends and family. This job helps her have extra income to cover personal costs. Now she wants to use her loan in buying mO. jewelry  since a lot of demand approaches in a month. She belongs to the communal bank Santa Rosa.

* Mrs. Rosa is wearing a white blouse, two women are attending as passive members.

loans.use: buy jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Pelagra  Juana

texts.es:
Pelagra es socia del  Banco Comunal “Virgen de Concepción”, ubicado en el C.P. Ayrumas Carumas del distrito de Acora, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 48 años de edad, está  casada y  tiene 6 hijos (2 independientes).  Estudió hasta 4to de primaria.
Desde hace un año trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo solicitado fue de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en  la compra de 2 ovejitas para engordarlas.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/ 1500.00 nuevo soles, comprará una vaca para su respectivo engorde por dos meses y luego la venderá en la localidad de Ilave.  También cuenta que vende alpacas.  Ella trabaja junto con su esposo e hijos.
Su sueño es tener más ganados  y mejorados así podrá tener mayores ganancias.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son las reuniones, la puntualidad y el ahorro.
texts.en:
Pelagra is a member of the communal bank "Virgen de Concepción", located in the Ayrumas Carumas village of the district of Acora in the province and department of Puno.  She is 48, married and has six children (two are independent).  She has a 4th grade elementary school eduation.

For a year she has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement and her first loan in the amount of 300 PEN was used to buy two sheep.

She plans to the use the new loan of 1,500 PEN to buy a cow which she will feed for two months then sell in the town of Llave.  She also sells alpacas.  She works with her husband and children and her dream is to have more well-bred livestock to increase her earnings.  What she likes best about the communal bank are the meetings, punctuality and savings.

loans.use: To buy a cow.

loans.name: Emerita Del Carmen

texts.es:
Emérita de 37 años de edad, madre soltera de siete hijos, de los cuales tres trabajan y la ayudan económicamente, su negocio es la venta de pan, el cual lo hace ambulante, cada día, durante once años tiene este negocio, el cual inicio al separarse de su esposo.
La ventaja que tiene es que la panadería  es de su papa, quien da al crédito y al contado la variedad de ricos panes.
Como objetivo ha sido la construcción en las mejoras a su casa, el cual quiere poner cerámica ya que es de tierra aun su piso y desea mejorar esta condición a si como mejor higiene, también comprara unas láminas de zinc, para mejorar el techo. Todo esto lo está logrando a corto plazo gracias al financiamiento que Afodenic está otorgando.
texts.en:
Emérita, 37, is a single mother of seven children, three of whom work and help her out economically.  She is a street vendor and sells bread for a living.  For eleven years, ever since she became separated from her husband, she goes out every day to work.

The advantage she has is that the bakery belongs to her father who sells his delicious bread on both a credit or cash basis.

She wants to carry out home improvement by covering her dirt floor with ceramic tile for comfort and hygiene purposes.  She also plans to buy zinc sheeting for a better roof.  Thanks to Afodenic's lending she is able to reach her goals in a short amount of time.

loans.use: To buy ceramic tiles and zinc sheeting.

loans.name: Celia Rosa

texts.es:
Doña Celia  trabaja en la costura con más de once años, hoy en día, también labora como domestica para poder cubrir los gastos de su hogar, pues ejerce los dos trabajo, lo cual hace su costura por la tarde y los fines de semana, hace costura de encargo, y vestido nuevo para vender.
Celia quiere invertir en mas tela es por eso con este crédito nuevo hará el pedido en cincuenta yardas de lino americano, dacron blanco, tubos de hilo en colores variado, encajes, bordados con el fin de producir más. Logrando esta inversión gracias al financiamiento que Afodenic ha dado en dos ciclos.
Tiene pensado comprar otra máquina de coser, más moderna para hacer diferente tejido y lograr la captación de clientes.
texts.en:
Doña Celia has been working as a seamstress for 11 years.  Currently, she also works as a cleaning lady to be able to cover her household expenses, meaning she is holding down two jobs.  She sews in the afternoons and on weekends, taking orders and selling new dresses.

Celia wants to buy more fabric and plans to use the loan to place an order for 50 yards of American linen, white dacron, varied colors of thread, embroidery and lace so she can produce more volume.  This investment can be made thanks to the loans she has received from Afodenic on two different occasions.  She also plans to buy a more modern sewing machine to offer different stitching styles so she can attract more customers.

loans.use: To buy varied fabric, thread, embroidery, and lace to increase sales.

loans.name: Alfonso

texts.es:
El señor Alfonso tiene su propio negocio, un estudio fotográfico con mas de veintiún años laborando para el bien comun de la familia, casado y con tres hermosos hijos los cuales cursan sus estudios.
 En años anteriores trabajo para un canal, lo que luego puso su estudio, que ha venido mejorando y comprando sus equipo para una mejor resolucion de sus fotos y videos.
Es atraves de Afodenic, que ha logrado la compra de varios equipo de altos costos. Y con este nuevo prestamo comprara un televisor plasma de 27 pulgada para un mejor trabajo, lo que espera producir mas para elevar sus ventas , logrando mas clientela.
texts.en:
Mr. Alfonso is married and has three beautiful school-aged children.  He has his own photography studio which, for 21 years, has been the source of income for his family.

Previously he worked for a channel but then set up his own studio which he has been improving constantly, buying equipment to produce better photos and videos.

Through Afodenic he has been able to buy several expensive pieces of equipment.  He plans to use the new loan to buy a 27" plasma TV to improve his work and increase sales and attract more customers.

loans.use: To buy a 27" plasma TV for his work.

loans.name: Dinora Del Socorro

texts.es:
Dinora es una pequeña comerciante que trabaja junto con su esposo en la elaboracion de cocinas de metal electrica, y la venta de carne, el cual lleva siete años con las ventas.
Estas cocina las vende en su casa de habitacion a precios accesibles y otras por encargo las cuales son vendida en un mercado de la capital, pues es un producto muy demandado por ser muy util en la cocina y mas para la poblacion de bajo de recursos ya que el gas esta ah altos costos. Y no alcanza para comprarlo. Ha elevado sus ventas con mas produccion, gracias al financiamiento que Afodenic ha dado en  doce ciclos, mediante los prestamo. 
Con este nuevo prestamo comprara: seis laminas lisas, docientos espirales,alambre, enchufes, galon de pinturas, galon de cener,  yipson, estonbol. Para la fabricacion de docientas cocinas electricas.
texts.en:
Dinora is a small merchant who works with her husband making electric metal cookers and selling meat, which she has done for seven years.

She sells her products out of her house at reasonable prices, and also sells the cookers at the market in the capital city since it is a product in very high demand.  It is very useful in the kitchen and popular among low-income earners because gas is very expensive.  

She has increased sales by increasing production thanks to loans received from Afodenic on 12 occasions.  This new loan will be used to buy six flat sheets, 200 spirals, wire, plugs, paint and other materials to make 200 electric cookers.

loans.use: To buy materials to make electric cookers such as: flat zinc sheets, electric plugs, and other items.

loans.name: Las Lecheritas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS LECHERITAS” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por diez integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Maria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos crianza de animales, venta de verduras, venta de leche, crianza de cerdos, venta de ganado 

La señora Maria,  indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer  por invitación de una de sus compañeras. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de crianza de ganados vacuno, negocio que inicio desde niña con el apoyo de sus padres.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para la compra alimento para su ganado, el cual adquirira de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta todo.
texts.en:
The community association “LAS LECHERITAS”  is starting its first lending cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Villa Exaltación Center.  The group is made up of ten members and is led by a board headed by Señora Maria.  The businesses that community association members lead are varied, including breeding animals, selling vegetables, selling milk, raising pigs, and selling cattle.  Señora Maria says that this is their first time working with Pro Mujer, which they joined at the invitation of one of her partners. 

Currently, Señora Maria has a business breeding cattle, a business which she started in as a young girl with the help of her parents.  The loan that she is will now be drawing on is to buy feed for her cattle, which she will acquire at the markets in El Alto city.  This type of work allows her to generate resources to support her family as much as possible, because she is married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replies that she likes everything.

loans.use: to buy feed for her cattle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy spare parts for the repair of his grinder.

loans.name: Olga Basilia

texts.es:
Olga es socia del  Banco Comunal “San Miguel Arcángel II”, ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, provincia El Collao y departamento de Puno, tiene 33 años de edad, está casada y  tiene dos hijos.  Estudió educación secundaria.
Junto a su esposo se dedica a la venta de carne de porcinos en el mercado de Ilave, llevan trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos un año, su primer préstamo solicitado  fue de S/ 500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de venta de carne porcino.
Con este nuevo préstamo de  S/1500.00 nuevo soles, comprará 3 ó 4 unidades de chanchos (cerdos) para su respectivo carneo y luego poder venderlo.  
Su sueño es tener una casa y un carro para poder transportar a sus animalitos.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son las capacitaciones respecto al manejo del dinero, el cómo ahorrar y como incrementar el dinero.
texts.en:
Olga is a member of the "San Miguel Arcángel II" community bank, which is located in the Llave district in El Collao province in the department of Puno in Peru. She is 33 years old, married and has two children. She has a high school education.

Together with her husband she sells pork at Llave market. They have worked with Kiva Field Partner, Movimiento Manuela Ramos, for one year. Olga's first loan was for 500 PEN, money which she invested in her business selling pork.

With this new loan of 1500 PEN, she will buy three or four pigs for their meat, which she will then sell.
Her dream is to own a house, and a cart in which she can transport her animals.

What she likes about the Community Bank is the training provided in money management - how to save and how to make your money grow.

loans.use: to buy three or four pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay her tuition and internships.

loans.name: Olivia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doña Olivia cuenta con su propio negocio una pulperia  que administra hace doce años, el cual ha venido invirtiendo con ganancias y prestamos a plazos que Afodenic ha otorgado en cuatro ciclos.
Tiene el apoyo de sus esposo quien labora como carpintero, a si mismo el apoyo de sus dos hijos que ayudan en la venta.
Con este nuevo prestamo Olivia desea comprar una variedad de productos para obtener mejores ventas como: productos, lacteos, carne, pollo, productos de leche de pote, productos enlatados, productos de limpieza para casa, gaseosa, refrescos, golosinas, siendo lo de mas demanda. como planes es seguir creciendo para el bienestar comun de la familia y que junto Afodenic espera lograrlo para un porvenir mejor.
texts.en:
Olivia has her own business, a general store, that she has run for 12 years. She has been investing her earnings and loans from Afodenic in this store through 4 loan cycles. Olivia has the help of her husband who works as a carpenter, plus the help of her 2 sons who help in sales.

With this new loan Olivia wishes to buy a variety of products to obtain better sales, such as milk products, meat, chicken, bottled or canned milk, canned goods, house cleaning products, soft drinks, and sweets, which are most in demand. Olivia's plan is to continue growing for the common good of her family, and together with Afodenic, she hopes to achieve this for a better future.

loans.use: buy products such as meat, chicken, canned milk, snacks, and soft drinks, among others, to maintain her high-margin sales.

loans.name: Campanitas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CAMPANITAS” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Los Andes, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Aida. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: juguetería, venta de CD’s, venta de comida, albañilería, venta de ropa y artesanía, tienda de abarrotes.
 
La señora Aida,  indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer  y que ingreso por invitación de una promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de CD’s, que viene trabajando hace seis meses, con el apoyo de su familia.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para la compra de juguetes, ya que piensa aperturar otro negocio complementario al que en la actualidad realiza. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene cuatro hijos.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Campanitas" [Bells] will begin its first loan cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes Center. It is made up of nine members and led by a directive board headed up by Mrs. Aida. The businesses of the communal bank's members are various. Among them are a toy shop, CD sales, food sales, construction work, clothing and handicraft sales, and a grocery store. 

Mrs. Aida indicates that this is the first time she has joined Pro Mujer and that she joined at the invitation of a promoter. Currently she has a business selling CDs, which she has had for six months with the support of her family. 
 
The loan she will take out is for the purchase of toys since she is thinking of opening another business to complement the one she currently has. This way of working allows her to generate income to support her family as much as possible, since she lives in a committed relationship and has four children.

loans.use: to purchase toys.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase zinc, fiberboards, nails, and other items to install a ceiling.

loans.name: Gloria Elena

texts.es: Gloria madre soltera, sus hijos los tiene estudiando, prioridad que sus hijos se preparen profesionalmente, mujer emprendedora, tiene su propio negocio venta de variedad de productos para el hogar desde hace un tiempo iniciando con pequeñas cantidades y de fondos de micro créditos. Proyecto incrementar sus venta expandir su negocio.  El préstamo será invertido en el negocio para la compra de mercadería y ofrecerle a sus clientes mayores variedad, mayor calidad  en un mismo lugar.
texts.en:
Gloria is a single mother and has children who are in school. Her priority is to prepare her children to become professionals. She has her own business selling household products and it has been in operation for some time. Gloria started out by selling in small quantities and utilizing microloans. She plans to increase her sales by expanding her business.

This loan will be invested in her business by purchasing merchandise and offering her customers a wider variety of products that are of higher quality.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Primero De Enero (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal 1 de Enero se reúne cada quince días en el cantón Junín, este lugar se lo conoce por su gente amable y trabajadora y porque en este lugar se destila el mejor aguardiente del Ecuador.

Este es un grupo de personas que decidieron unirse y formar este Banco Comunal que les sirve de mucho ya que con los créditos ellos pueden mejorar sus pequeños negocios. Se dedican a diversas actividades tales como comercio, servicios, venta de comidas entre otras actividades.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Rosa, tiene 52 años, hace varios años su esposo falleció pero de esa relación tiene cuatro hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad, ella es nacida en la provincia del Guayas pero después que murió su esposo ella se vino a vivir a este lindo cantón en el cual ha conseguido un nuevo compañero con el que vive actualmente.
 
Ella tiene un local en el cual vende artículos de bazar, helados, golosinas y otros productos, aprovecha que este local está al frente de una iglesia y de una escuela y tanto los niños  como las personas que asisten a la iglesia siempre van a su local a consumir sus productos. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6h30 hasta las 22h00, nos cuenta que lleva en su local siete años y que le va muy bien.  Con este negocio ella obtiene su sustento diario.
 
Este crédito es para comprar más productos para surtir su negocio como helados, golosinas, artículos de bazar y otros productos que le hacen falta. Este es su primer crédito y le gusta  la rapidez con que dan los créditos en la institución.
 
Su meta es tener un local propio ya que donde tiene su negocio es alquilado.
texts.en:
The January 1st Communal Bank meets every 15 days in the canton of Junín. This place is known for its friendly and hardworking people. It is also known for distilling the best brandy in Ecuador.

The members of this group decided to join together to form this Communal Bank. With the loans they have received, they have been able to improve their small businesses. They engage in different businesses involving trade, services, selling food, and other activities.

It is in this place that one can meet Sra. Rosa. She is 52 years old. Her husband passed away several years ago, but their marriage resulted in four children who are already adults. Rosa was born in Guayas Province, but after her husband died, she came to live in the beautiful canton of Junín. She now has a new companion with whom she currently lives.

Rosa has a shop where she sells bazaar items, ice cream, candy, and other products. Her shop is located in front of a church and a school. Both children and people attending church come into her shop to buy her products. Rosa works every day from 6:30am to 10pm. Since opening her shop six years ago, she has done very well. Through her business, Rosa is able to provide for her daily needs.

This loan will be used to buy more products to restock her business such as ice cream, candy, bazaar items, and other products that she lacks. This is her first loan and she likes the speed by which Fundación ESPOIR disburses the loans. Her goal is to have her own shop since she currently rents the location for her business.

loans.use: to purchase ice cream, candy, bazaar items, and other products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for materials and labor so that she can renovate her kitchen.

loans.name: Fresia

texts.es:
Fresia forma parte del banco comunal “Esperanza para todos” perteneciente a la ciudad de Valparaíso.
Ella se dedica al rubro del comercio, específicamente venta de abarrotes, alimento para perros, frutas y verduras en un almacén ubicado en su casa, desde hace un año y medio. Sus clientes son frecuentes y antiguos.
Cuando comenzó a trabajar en negocios, vendía ropa interior le iba muy bien, pero decidió cambiar de rubro al de la venta de abarrotes, en un comienzo compraba poca cantidad de mercadería y los créditos de Fondo esperanza le han ayudado a invertir en mayor cantidad en su negocio. El horario de atención es de 8ºº de la mañana a 11ºº de la noche. Su mercadería la compra en supermercados mayoristas. Con el préstamo compró mercadería y arregló su vehículo.
Fresia vive junto a su marido, él es quien le ayuda en la atención de su negocio y realización de compras, después de sufrir un accidente vascular.
Sus metas son comprar un vehículo nuevo para trasladar su mercadería e incorporar en su negocio la venta de productos de paquetería.
Sus sueños son seguir trabajando, para generar mayores ganancias y poder comprar un terreno para criar diferentes tipos de animales.
Fresia está muy contenta y agradecida de los créditos otorgados por Fondo esperanza, ya que ha podido invertir en su negocio. La relación con las demás socias del grupo del banco comunal, ha sido muy grata, ya que ellos son solidarios y organizados. Las capacitaciones le han servido para organizar su negocio.
Valparaíso está situado a 120 kilómetros al noroeste de Santiago. Es la capital regional y además sede del poder legislativo del país. Es el primer puerto de la nación y ofrece gran variedad de lugares hermosos y pintorescos, como por ejemplo la casa del poeta Pablo Neruda, ganador del Premio Nobel.
texts.en:
Fresia is a member of the Communal Bank “Esperanza para Todos” (Hope for All) which is in the city of Valparaíso. She is a merchant who sells groceries, dog food, fruits, and vegetables from a store located in her house. Fresia has been in business for a year and a half. She has long-time customers who shop with her frequently.

When she started her business, Fresia sold undergarments and did very well. However, she decided to switch over to selling groceries. She started out selling small quantities of merchandise and the loans from Fondo Esperanza have helped her invest in larger amounts of inventory. Her work schedule is from 8am to 11pm. Fresia buys her merchandise from the wholesale supermarkets. With this loan, she will buy merchandise and repair her vehicle.

Fresia lives with her husband. After he suffered a heart attack, her husband has helped manage the business and purchase goods. Her goals include buying a new vehicle so that she can transport her merchandise. In addition, she wants to incorporate the sale of packaged goods into her business. Her dreams are to continue working, generate more income, and buy a plot of land so that she can raise all types of animals.

Fresia is pleased with and appreciative of the loans provided by Fondo Esperanza since they have enabled her to invest in her business. Her relationship with the other members of her Communal Bank has been gratifying since they are supportive and organized. The training seminars have helped her with managing her business.

Valparaíso is situated 120 kilometers northwest of Santiago. It is the regional capital and seat of the national legislature. Valparaíso is the main port of Chile and offers a wide variety of beautiful and picturesque places to visit, such as the home of poet Pablo Neruda, winner of the Nobel Prize.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her store and to pay for vehicle repairs.

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es: Juana mujer emprendedora, casada, sus proyecto es mejorar la infraestructura de su casa poco a poco, cambiando parte por parte de la casa que están en mala condiciones. Siendo su esposo persona de edad ella es la que aporta la mayor parte económica de los gasto del hogar trabaja como cocinera desde hace unos años. Con el préstamo comprara materiales de construcción: cemento, arena, piedrines, bloque, piedra cantera, hierro para la construcción de la pared lateral de la casa. Obteniendo seguridad para su familia.
texts.en:
Juana is an enterprising woman. She is married and has plans to improve the infrastructure of her home a little bit at a time. Juana will replace the parts of her house that are in bad condition a piece at a time. Since her husband is elderly, she has the major responsibility of providing for the household expenses. Juana has worked as a cook for the past few years.

With this loan, she will buy construction materials such as cement, sand, gravel, blocks, quarry stone, and iron for building a wall to the side of her house. This will give her family security.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to build a security wall to the side of her house.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es: Luisa madre soltera, mujer luchadora, emprendedora, trabajadora, ha logrado salir adelante con su hijos ahora sus hijos trabajan por cuenta propia, le ayudan económicamente. Su mayor proyecto es mejorar la infraestructura de la vivienda. Su trabajo es humilde y honesto desde hace un tiempo trabaja. Con el préstamo comprara materiales de construcción como. Cemento, arena, piedras cantera, hierro, piedrines siendo utilizado en la mejora de un cuarto, obteniendo mejores condiciones de vida, seguridad y comodidad.
texts.en:
Luisa is a single mother as well as a determined, enterprising, and hardworking woman. She has been able to succeed on behalf of her children. Now her children work on their own and help her financially. Her greatest priority is to improve the infrastructure of her home. She has a modest and honest job in which she has worked for some time.

Luisa will use this loan to buy construction materials such as cement, sand, quarry stone, iron, and gravel for making improvements to a room. This will provide better living conditions, as well as make her home more secure and comfortable.

loans.use: to purchase materials for home improvements.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia forma parte del banco comunal “Esperanza para todos”, perteneciente a la ciudad de Valparaíso. 
Ella se dedica a la preparación de comida rápida específicamente, empanadas, papas fritas, entre otros alimentos. Lidia prepara todos los alimentos en su casa y los fríe en un carrito ubicado cerca de su casa. Durante las mañanas se dedica a realizar las compras de mercadería, durante la tarde prepara los alimentos y en la noche se dedica a freír y vender su comida preparada. Se dedica a éste rubro desde hace 5 años.
El crédito lo invirtió en uso personal, específicamente una impresora para el estudio de su hijo y para su negocio compró mercadería.
Sus metas son seguir creciendo en su negocio y sacar un permiso que le permita tener una mayor tranquilidad para vender sus productos.
Ella vive junto a su hijo de 20 años y uno de sus nietos de 9 años de edad, Lidia es el único ingreso económico familiar. Su hijo está estudiando ingeniería en prevención de riesgos, en la universidad, por lo tanto Lidia debe costear las mensualidades de los estudios de su hijo. 
Su sueño es que su hijo termine su carrera y sea independiente económicamente. 
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de los créditos otorgados por fondo esperanza.
Valparaíso está situado a 120 kilómetros al noroeste de Santiago. Es la capital regional y además sede del poder legislativo del país. Es el primer puerto de la nación y ofrece gran variedad de lugares hermosos y pintorescos, como por ejemplo la casa del poeta Pablo Neruda, ganador del Premio Nobel.
texts.en:
Lidia is a member of the Communal Bank “Esperanza para Todos” (Hope for All) which is in the city of Valparaíso. She prepares fast food such as empanadas, French fries, and other snacks. Lidias prepares the food at home and then fries it at her cart located near her house. She buys her supplies every morning and then spends the afternoon preparing food. At night, she fries the food she has prepared before selling it. Lidia has been in business for five years.

Part of this loan will be designated for personal use, since she will buy a printer for her son to use in his studies. The rest of the money will be used to buy supplies for her business. Her goals are to continue growing her business and to acquire a permit so that she can sell her products with greater peace of mind. Lidia lives with her 20-year-old son and one of her grandchildren who is 9 years old. She is the only breadwinner in her family. Her son is studying engineering and risk management at the university, so she is responsible for paying his monthly tuition. Lidia’s dreams include seeing her son finish his degree and become financially independent. She is pleased with and appreciative of the loans from Fondo Esperanza.

Valparaíso is situated 120 kilometers northwest of Santiago. It is the regional capital and seat of the national legislature. Valparaíso is the main port of Chile and offers a wide variety of beautiful and picturesque places to visit, such as the home of poet Pablo Neruda, winner of the Nobel Prize.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for her food business and a printer for her son.

loans.name: Sherly

texts.en: Sherly, 33 years old, is a single mother to her one daughter. She's been engaged in farming corn and cassava for almost two years, and she earns 25,000 PHP in corn farming, and 120,000 PHP for cassava farming for one year. She's asking for a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase farm inputs and to pay for labor. She would like to continue receiving loans and hopes Kiva lenders will extend their assistance to her in the future.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: Elena nació en la ciudad de Cusco (Perú) y tiene 51 años de edad. Actualmente, Elena vive en la misma ciudad donde nacio junto con su esposo y sus cuatro hijos. Elena tiene un pequeño Bar – Restaurante y tiene un nombre peculiar “Tronco Seco”, ella atiende el local desde las 2 de la tarde hasta que el último cliente se vaya del local. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Elena requiere el préstamo para comprar cerveza, cigarrillos y otras cosas más. La socia es una persona responsable y trabajadora que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal la “Hatun  Rumiyoc” de la Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en:
Elena was born in the city of Cusco, Peru, and is 51 years old. She currently lives in Cusco with her husband and four children. Elena manages a restaurant and bar called “Tronco Seco” which is open from 2pm until the last customer leaves her establishment. She has been in business for several years and has done very well thanks to the effort she puts into her work. Elena is taking this opportunity to request a loan so that she can buy beer, cigarettes, and other items.

She is a responsible and hardworking individual. These qualities prompted her fellow members to extend an invitation to her to join the Communal Bank “Hatun Rumiyoc”, which is part of Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to purchase beer, cigarettes, and other items.

loans.name: Soledad

texts.es: Soledad nació en el departamento D. Apurímac (Perú) y tiene 65 años D. edad. Actualmente, Soledad vive en la ciudad del Cusco junto con su esposo y sus dos hijos. Soledad es periodista D. profesión y trabaja en la radio Voz y Coraje  D. la ciudad del Cusco.  Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Soledad requiere el préstamo para uso personal ósea para su salud.  La socia es una persona responsable y trabajadora que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal la “Hatun  Rumiyoc” D. la Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en:
Soledad was born in the Department of Apurímac in Peru. She is 65 years old. Soledad lives in the city of Cusco with her husband and two children. She is a journalist by profession and works in radio for the “Voz y Coraje” (Voice and Courage) network in the city of Cusco. Soledad has been in this business for several years and has done well thanks to the effort she puts into her job. She is taking this opportunity to request a loan for personal use, specifically to pay expenses related to maintaining the health of her bones.

Soledad is a responsible and hardworking person. These qualities prompted her fellow members to extend an invitation to her to join the Communal Bank “Hatun Rumiyoc”, which is part of Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to pay for medical expenses related to her bone health.

loans.name: Carmen Soledad

texts.es: Carmen  nació en la ciudad de Cusco (Perú) y tiene 28 años de edad. Actualmente, Carmen  vive en la misma ciudad donde nació. Carmen es contadora pública y trabaja en una entidad privada. Ya son dos años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Carmen  requiere el préstamo para implementar  su estudio contable propio.  La socia es una persona responsable y trabajadora que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal la “Hatun  Rumiyoc” de la Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en: Carmen was born in the city of Cusco, Peru, and she is 28 years old. Carmen now lives in the same city where she was born. Carmen is a public accountant, and she works for a private firm. She has been in this business for two years, and it is going very well for her, thanks to the effort that she puts into her work. Carmen needs a loan because she has the opportunity to set up her own accounting business. This communal bank member is a responsible and hard-working person who, because of these qualities, was invited by her companions to participate in the communal bank "Hatun Rumiyoc" of Arariwa Association.

loans.use: to set up her own accounting business.

loans.name: Janet

texts.es: Janet nació en la ciudad de Cusco (Perú) y tiene 31 años de edad. Actualmente, Janet vive en la misma ciudad donde nació junto con su esposo y su única hija. Janet es contadora pública y tiene su propio estudio contable. Ya son ocho años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Janet requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de trabajo y otras cosas más. La socia es una persona responsable y trabajadora que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal la “Hatun  Rumiyoc” de la Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en:
Janet was born in the city of Cusco (Peru), and she is 31 years old.  Janet currently lives in the city where she was born with her husband and their only daughter.  Janet is a public accountant, and she has her own accounting office.

She has had this business for eight years.  It is going very well for her thanks to the effort she puts into her work.  At this time Janet needs a loan to buy work materials and some other things.  She is a responsible and hard-working person.  It is for these qualities that her colleagues invited her to participate in the Hatun Rumiyoc Communal Bank with the Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to buy work materials and other things.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.es: Alexander nació en la ciudad de Cusco (Perú) y tiene 29 años de edad. Actualmente, Alexander vive en la misma ciudad donde nació. Alexander es chofer y se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte en la ciudad del Cusco en su propio taxi, él trabaja en los turnos de la mañana y noche. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Alexander requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento del carro. El socio es una persona responsable y trabajadora que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal la “Hatun  Rumiyoc” de la Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en:
Alexander, age 29, was born in Cusco (Peru).  Alexander currently lives in the same city where he was born.

Alexander is a driver, and he provides transportation services in Cusco in his own taxi.  He works the morning and night shifts.  He has had this business for several years.  It is going very well for him thanks to the effort that he puts into his work.

He is a responsible and hard-working person.  It is for these qualities that his colleagues invited him to participate in the Hatun Rumiyoc Communal Bank with the Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to pay for car maintenance.

loans.name: Hilaria Ursula

texts.es: Hilaria nació en la ciudad de Cusco (Perú) y tiene 51 años de edad. Actualmente, Hilaria vive en la misma ciudad donde nació junto con sus tres hijos. Hilaria se dedica a la venta de artesanía de tipo bisutería. Ya son cinco años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Hilaria requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales como alambre y dijes. La socia es una persona responsable y trabajadora que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal la “Hatun  Rumiyoc” de la Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en:
Hilaria was born in Cusco (Peru).  Hilaria is 51 years old, and she currently lives with her three children in the same city where she was born.

Hilara sells handicrafts, and the kind of handicrafts she sells is costume jewelry.  She has had this business for five years.  It is going very well for her thanks to the effort that she puts into her work.

At this time Hilaria needs a loan to buy materials like wire and pendants.

She is a responsible and hard-working person.  It is for these qualities that her colleagues invited her to participate in the Hatun Rumiyoc Communal Bank with the Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to buy materials like wire and pendants.

loans.name: Maria Jesus

texts.es: Maria Jesus nació en la ciudad de Cusco (Perú) y tiene 38 años de edad. Actualmente, Maria Jesus vive en la misma ciudad donde nació junto con su pareja y su único hijo. María Jesús tiene una pequeña pollería donde trabajan dos ayudantes el pollero y mozo, ella también tiene un restaurante que tiene de nombre peculiar “Choza Rustica”. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Maria Jesus requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento del local. La socia es una persona responsable y trabajadora que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal la “Hatun  Rumiyoc” de la Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en: María Jesús was born in the city of Cusco, Peru, and she is 38 years old. Maria now lives in the same city where she was born, along with her partner and their only son. María Jesús has a small chicken stand where two assistants work, the poulterer and a service boy. She also has a restaurant which has the appropriate name, "Choza Rustica" (Rustic Hut). She has already had this business for a number of years, and it is going very well for her thanks to the effort that she puts into her work. At this time María Jesús needs the loan to do some maintenance on her premises. This communal bank member is a responsible and hard-working person, and because of these qualities, her fellow bank members invited her to participate in the communal bank "Hatun Rumiyoc" of the Arariwa Association.

loans.use: to do maintenance on her restaurant premises.

loans.name: Celedonio

texts.es: Celedonio nació en la ciudad de Quillabamba(Cusco, Perú) y tiene 44 años de edad. Actualmente, Celedonio vive en la ciudad del Cusco junto con su pareja y sus tres hijos. Celedonio es chofer y se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte en la ciudad del Cusco en su propio taxi, él trabaja desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche todos los días. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Celedonio requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento del carro y para pagar la matrícula de sus hijos. El socio es una persona responsable y trabajadora que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal la “Hatun  Rumiyoc” de la Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en: Caledonio was born in the city of Quillabamba (Cusco, Peru). He is 44 years old, and now lives in Cusco with his spouse and their three children. Caledonio works in the city as a chauffeur, using his own taxi. He works from 6 AM to 9 PM, seven days a week. He has been driving a taxi for several years now, and thanks to his work ethic, he has done quite well for himself. Caledonio needs a loan so that he can make some repairs to his taxi and pay his children's school fees. Because Caledonio is so responsible and hard-working, he was invited to join the Hatun Rumiyoc community bank, which is part of the Araiwa Association.

loans.use: to repair his taxi and pay his children's school fees.

loans.name: Arthur

texts.es: Arthur nació en la ciudad de Cusco (Perú) y tiene 27 años de edad. Arthur es profesor y trabaja en la academia pre universitario y en el colegio Lideres. Ya son 8 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Arthur requiere el préstamo para uso personal desea implementar su biblioteca personal y tambien desea comprar un artefacto.  El socio es una persona responsable y trabajadora que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal la “Hatun  Rumiyoc” de la Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en: Arthur was born in the city of Cusco (Peru) and is 27 years old.  Arthur is a teacher who works in a preparatory academy and at the Lideres school.  He already has 8 years of experience teaching and it is going very well, thanks to the effort that he puts into his work.  At this time, Arthur needs a loan for personal use.  He wants to set up a personal library and he also wants to buy an appliance. He is a responsible and hardworking person, and because of these qualities his companions invited him to join in the communal bank "Hatun Rumiyoc" in the  Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to set up a personal library and buy an appliance

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es: Juan Jose nació en la ciudad de Quillabamba (Perú) y tiene 31 años de edad. Actualmente, Juan Jose vive en la ciudad del Cusco y tiene una pequeña tienda de multi servicios donde hace por ejemplo servicios de fotocopias, impresiones y tipeos.  El trabaja todos los días desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Juan Jose requiere el préstamo para hacer el mantenimiento de las fotocopiadoras. El socio es una persona responsable y trabajadora que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal la “Hatun  Rumiyoc” de la Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en: Juan Jose was born in the city of Quillabamba (Peru) and is 31 years old.  He now lives in the city of Cusco and has a small multi-service shop where he offers photocopies, printing and typing services.  He works every day from 8am until 8pm.  He has already had this business for a number of years, and it is going very well thanks to the effort he puts into his work.  At this time Juan Jose needs a loan to do maintenance on his photocopier.  He is a responsible and hardworking person, and because of these qualities his friends invited him to participate in the communal bank "Hatun Rumiyoc" in the  Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to do maintenance on his photocopier

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is married with two children. Corazon is 38 years old and lives in La Union, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She sells a variety of products such as toothpaste, soap, and shampoo to earn a living and has had this business for 12 years. Each month, she earns PHP 5000 doing this type of work. 

She has requested a loan of 3000 to purchase more variety of products such as soap and anything needed for household chores.

Corazon has been a member of PMPC just this year.

loans.use: to purchase more variety of products such as soap, toothpaste and any other household needs.

location.town: La Union, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda is 31 years old and lives in Villa M. Tejero, Liloy. She is married with two children. She has a motorcycle repair business and earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to purchase equipment for her motorcycle repair business. 

Glenda has been a member of PMPC for one year.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for her motorcycle repair business.

location.town: Villa M Tejero, Liloy Zamboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Jenilyn

texts.en: Jenilyn is married and has two children. She is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines, where she works as a farmer and also raises goats and cows. She is just starting her businesses and is applying for this loan to buy livestock feed and other supplies. She has been a member of PMPC for about a year.

loans.use: to buy livestock feed and other supplies.

loans.name: Sivat

texts.en:
Sivat, 56, resides in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. Sivat is a housewife while her husband is a rice field farmer, earning an income of $1.8 per day to help cover the family expenses. The family is also assisted by her three children, who are employed at the garment factory, earning an income of $3 each per day. 

Each month, the family has to spend $60 on food and $15 on the other necessary expenses. 

Sivat is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for the children to commute to work. This will be her third loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a new motorbike.

loans.name: Sokun

texts.en:
Sokun, 42, resides in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. 

Sokun and her husband are employed at the garment factory, earning an income of $3.3 each per day to help cover the family expenses. 

Each month, the family has to spend $100 on food and $50 on the other necessary expenses. 

Sokun is requesting a loan of $1,000 to repair her house. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to repair her house.

loans.name: Neh

texts.en:
Net, 32 years old, is a broom seller. His mother-in-law is also a broom seller and stays with his family. His wife is working in the factory, and their income is $8 per day. They have three children. Two are studying and one is too small to be in school. 

Every month, he has to spend $45 on food, $5 on electricity, $10 on school fees, $20 on transportation and $15 on other expenses. 

He would like to request a loan of $1,200 to buy a motorbike to use in his broom selling business. He wants to extend his business to make more income. And he also wants all of his children to study until they finish university.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for his broom selling business.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en: Elma is 35 years old and lives in Malintuboan, Labason. She is married, has two children and makes a living catching and selling fish. She has been doing this for the last six years and is applying for this loan to buy equipment such as hooks and nets. She has been a member of PMPC for one year.

loans.use: to buy fishing equipment including hooks and nets.

loans.name: Theany

texts.en: Theany, 27, resides in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. She makes a living selling groceries, earning an income of $4 a day to help cover family expenses. Her husband earns $12 a day as a taxi driver. Each month, the family has to spend $100 on food and $10 on other necessities. Theany is requesting a loan of $800 to buy a new car for her husband because this will allow him to provide better service to his customers. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a new car her husband to improve his business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Somaly

texts.en:
Somaly, 32 years old, is a garment worker. Her husband is a salt seller. Their income is $7 per day. They have two children, 5 and 3 years old. 

Every month, she has to spend $45 on food, $5 on electricity, $15 on transportation and $20 on other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan of $600 to buy wood to build a new house because her old house is not good to stay in. 

In the future, she wants to extend her business to make more income for supporting her family. And she wants to send her children to study and at least finish high school.

loans.use: To buy wood for building a new house.

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Srey, 49, resides in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. 

Srey sells groceries, earning an income of $10 per day to help cover the family expenses. The family is also assisted by her husband, who is employed at a local market, earning an income of $2 per day. 

Each month, the family has to spend $100 on food and $15 on the other necessary expenses. 

Srey is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase vegetable seeds to grow more crops to sell. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy seeds to grow more crops to sell in the store.

loans.name: Samun

texts.en:
Samun, 49 years old, is a weaver. She is a single mother with one daughter and she is also a weaver. They both can make $4 per day for their income. 

Every month, she has to spend $40 on food, $5 on electricity, $15 on transportation and $15 on other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan of $400 to buy silk to weave and sell to get more income. She wants to extend her business to make more products and sell to other provinces. She also wants to repair her house because now it is not in good condition.

loans.use: To buy more silks to weave.

loans.name: Ner

texts.en: Ner, 50, resides in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. Ner and her husband sell fish, earning an income of 12 USD per day to help cover the family expenses. The family is also assisted by her son who is a fisherman, earning an income of 2 USD per day. Each month, the family has to spend 100 USD on food and 15 USD on the other necessary expenses. Ner is requesting a loan of 1,200 USD to purchase more fish to resell. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy more fish to resell

loans.name: Tho

texts.en: The two people shown in the photograph are Mrs. Tho and her daughter from the province of Kompong Chhnang.  Mrs. Tho is a hard-working woman who tries to earn money to support her family. She is a widow woman and now she lives in a small house with her two single children. Her other three children have already married and live in their own houses. To earn money, Mrs. Tho sells soup to her neighbors, other villagers and passengers at home and she has one kid always assisting her in her soup-selling business. One other child is working in Thailand as a worker. Mrs. Tho would like to ask for a loan to buy more ingredients in order to cook a delicious soup to sell.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients to cook a delicious soup to sell

loans.name: Batdelger

texts.en:
Batdelger is 38 years old and lives with his wife in a ger, Mongolian yurt, in his older brother's backyard. They live in Songinohairhan district, Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. His wife is a sales person who operates her own grocery store. 

Batdelger manages a goldsmith business at a rented booth at a trading center called Duuhee. He started his business in 2009 and has been able to stabilize his business. Now he is one of the experienced businessmen who managed to build a strong customer base. He is planning to have his own workshop in the near future. 

He is a polite man who says, "I am planning to save my earning in order to buy a plot of land where I can build a house for my family." He is requesting a 3,500,000 MNT loan to purchase a plot of land for his family use.

loans.use: to purchase a plot of land

loans.name: Rona

texts.en:
Rona is is 29 years old and married with six children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

For the past seven years Rona has had a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She has requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy parts to repair her motorcycle.

Rona would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy parts to repair her motorcycle.

loans.name: Thea

texts.en: Thea, 31, resides in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. Thea is employed at the factory, earning an income of 3 USD per day to help cover the family expenses. The family is also assisted by her husband who is a farmer, earning an income of 2 USD per day. Each month, the family has to spend 50 USD on food and 15 USD on the other necessary expenses. Thea is requesting a loan of 400 USD to purchase a mechanical plow to help plow the rice field. This will be her third loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a mechanical plow to help plow the rice field

loans.name: Saron

texts.en: Saron is 52 years old and makes a living as a farmer. She earns only $1 per day and is a single mother with two children. Every month, she has to spend $50 on food, $5 on electricity, $10 on rent, $20 on school fees and $35 for other expenses. In order to meet these expenses, she is applying for a loan for $800 to buy a Tok Tok (or motorbike with a cart attached) so that her son-in-law can become a driver and earn money. She hopes that her family can earn enough money to buy supplies for her farm and pay for her younger child to go to university.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her son-in-law.

loans.name: Hermenigilda

texts.en: Hermenigilda is 53 years old and lives in Antonino, Labason. She is married with 9 children. Hermenigilda has worked in the fish industry and sold fish for a living for 30 years. She has requested a loan to purchase different kinds of fish to sell. She has been a member of PMPC for one year.

loans.use: to purchase different kinds of fish to sell

loans.name: Sovanroth

texts.en: Sovanroth, 23, resides in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. Sovanroth sells groceries, earning an income of $5 per day to help cover the family expenses. The family is also assisted by her husband who is employed as a driver for a private company, earning an income of $2 per day. Each month, the family spends $100 on food and $40 on other necessary expenses. Sovanroth is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase more groceries to stock the store. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to stock the store

loans.name: Phat

texts.en: Phat, 66, resides in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. Phat produces traditional baskets, earning an income of $1 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family spends $100 on food and $30 on other necessary expenses. Phat is requesting a loan of $850 to purchase a motorbike for the family's use. This will be her third loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for the family's use

loans.name: Sokhum

texts.en:
Sokhum, 41 years old, is a porter. Her husband is a chief of construction workers. Their income is $4 per day. They have two children, 11 and 5 years old. One is studying. Every month, she has to spend $40 on food, $5 on electricity, $10 on school fees, $20 on transportation, and $20 on other expenses. 

Sokhum would like to request a loan of $600 to buy a motorbike for her sister for traveling to work. She wants to extend her business and make more products to sell in other provinces. For her children, she plans to send them to study until they finish university.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her sister for traveling to work.

loans.name: Silis

texts.en:
Silis, 23, resides in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. Silis and her husband are butchers, earning an income of $11 per day to help cover the family's expenses. Each month, the family has to spend $100 on food and $15 on the other necessary expenses. 

Silis is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase more pigs to resell. This will be her third loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy pigs to resell.

loans.name: Altantuya

texts.en:
Altantuya is 31 years old and lives with her husband and three children in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Tuv province of Mongolia. Her older daughter is a student and her younger two, who haven't reached school age, stay home. 

Altantuya's husband is a driver who manages a transportation service business. She manages a dairy product trading business in her town. She started her business in 1999. She herds husbandry animals and produces dairy products like yogurt and milk. Now she has 8 cows in her possession. Her business is quite successful which allowed her to supplement to her family earning. She is a hardworking lady who says, "I am planning to have more livestock in the future." She is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to purchase three cows for her business.

loans.use: to purchase three cows.

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
Tita is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for ten years now. Tita works hard to support her family.

Tita has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business. In the future, Tita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Phat

texts.en:
Phat, 57 year old, is a rice seller with $3 per day for her income. She is a single mother with one son. He is 25 years old, a motorbike repairer. 

Every month, Phat has to spend $40 on food, $5 on electricity, $10 on rent house fee, $20 on transportation, and $20 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $500 to enlarge her business. With the income she gets from her business, she wants to repair her house and send her son to a technical school so that he can have a specific skill.

loans.use: to enlarge her business of selling rice and vegetables.

loans.name: Dioscora

texts.en:
Dioscora is 57 years old and lives in Dansalan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married and has 12 children. 

To earn a living, Dioscora has a business selling snacks. She earns about PHP 6000 each month doing this type of work. Dioscora has requested a loan to purchased raw ingredients for her snack vending. Dioscora has been a member of PMPC for 2 years.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital.

loans.name: Sos

texts.en:
Mrs. Sos is an young mother who has four children, most of whom are still going to a local school.

Since 2000, producing baskets has been a part of 26-year-old Mrs. Sos’s daily routine in Kompong Chhnang province. She and her husband currently buy raw materials to make baskets at home, where her children assist her. They also buy baskets from other weavers at a reasonable price and resell them to add to their profits. The couple also plants crops on their own fertile land.

Mrs. Sos will be using her loan to add to her personal savings to buy two cows to help her in the fields. This use of the loan will provide her with additional profits.

loans.use: to buy two cows to help her in the fields.

loans.name: Purevsuren

texts.en:
Purevsuren is 42 years old and lives with his wife and two sons in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in the Tuv province of Mongolia. His two sons, aged 10 and 16, both attend a local secondary school. His wife is a technician in a weather broadcasting office.

Purevsuren manages a shoe making business in his town. He started his business in 2000 and has been able to stabilize it. He has built a good relationship both with his customers and partners. With 11 years of business operation, he has gained much experience and is planning to continue his business in the future. Purevsuren recently received many orders to make shoes for children who will ride horses during Naadam, a national holiday. His two sons help with the family business in their spare time. Purevsuren is a polite man who says, "I am planning to have my own workshop in the future." He is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to purchase materials for his business.

loans.use: To purchase materials

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
Herminia is 58 years old and married with ten children. She runs a sari-sari (general store) in the Philippines. She has been running her store for fifteen years and also earns an income from a coffee shop.

Herminia has borrowed and paid back sixteen loans from NWTF before this loan. She now is requesting a 26,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari.

Herminia works hard to provide for her family. She aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her sari-sari.

loans.name: Lily

texts.en: Lily is 57 years old and lives in Punta, Liloy. She is married with 5 children. Lily has worked in the fish industry and sold fish for a living for 20 years. She has requested a loan to purchase more fish to sell. Lily has been a member of PMPC for one year.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Tungalag

texts.en: Tungalag is 50 years old and lives with her husband in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in the Tuv province of Mongolia. Her husband is a construction worker in a private company, earning a monthly salary of 300,000 MNT. Tungalag manages a ger item making business in her town. She started her business in 2000, developing a business group that included 5 members. Being a business group helped them to stabilize their business, and they now have a good relationship with their partners and customers. Tungalag used her business earnings to begin constructing a house on her plot of land. She is planning to increase her business sales in order to save some money. Tungalag is a hardworking lady who says, "I want to expand my business." She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase materials for her business.

loans.use: To purchase materials

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en: Lorna works hard to support one child. She is married and has a sari-sari store business in the Philippines. Lorna has requested a PHP 1,800 loan through NWTF to buy an Envirofit cookstove. She is getting this stove because she wants to save money by using the dried wood she can pick from her surroundings. Lorna is aware that, by using the Envirofit cookstove, she is not only saving money, but is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: To purchase an Envirofit cookstove

loans.name: Jorissa

texts.en: Jorissa is married with 2 children. She is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. Jorissa is a farmer who has been raising cows and goats for 3 years to earn a living. She has requested a loan to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Jorissa has become a member of PMPC just this year.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda works hard to support four children. She is married and sells root crops in the Philippines.

Merlinda requested a 1,800 Philippines pesos loan through NWTF to buy an Envirofit Cookstove.

She is getting the Envirofit Cookstove because she wants to avoid future lung diseases resulting from continued toxic smoke inhalation.

Merlinda is aware that by using the Envirofit Cookstove, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: To purchase an Envirofit Cookstove.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia works hard to support her family. Sofia is widowed and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Sofia is borrowing PHP 1800 through NWTF to buy an ENVIROFIT COOKSTOVE.

She is getting the Envirofit cookstove because she wants to lessen the amount of firewood that she uses when cooking food for her family.

Sofia is aware that by using the Envirofit cookstove,she is saving money, she's helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: To purchase a cookstove.

loans.name: Arceli

texts.en:
Arceli sells mud crabs. She is a hardworking entrepreneur in the Philippines who has been in this business for five years. Arceli earns additional income from raising hogs.

Arceli has been maintaining her business through her own efforts along with the help of loans from NWTF. She is now borrowing 17,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional mud crabs to sell.

Arceli dreams of saving enough money to provide herself with a secure future.

loans.use: to buy additional mud crabs to sell.

loans.name: Cherrylyn

texts.en:
Cherrylyn is 29 years old and married with one child. She has been running a sari-sari (general store) for five years as well as earning an income from selling dried fish.

Cherrylyn has borrowed and paid back six loans from NWTF. She now has requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like candies, biscuits, coffee, milk, sugar, etc. to sell in her sari-sari.

Cherrylyn works hard to provide for her family. She aspires to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional items to sell.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 39 years old and lives in Lopoc, Labason. She is married with seven children. 

Marilou works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for six years. She has requested a loan to purchase more fish to sell.
