Marilou has been a member of PMPC for two years.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Cristilita

texts.en:
Cristilita works hard to support her family. Cristilita is married and has a restaurant business in the Philippines.

Cristilita requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase meat, fish and other ingredients to sell in her restaurant.

Cristilita has been in this business for 15 years now.

In the future, Cristilita would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase meat, fish and other ingredients to sell in her carenderia

loans.name: Donnabel

texts.en:
Donnabel is 39 years old and married with three children.

Donnabel works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store.

Donnabel has borrowed and paid back nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for seven years and earns additional income from mud crab vending.

Donnabel aspires to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Altangerel

texts.en:
Altangerel is 31 years old and lives with her two daughters in a house in Hentii province of Mongolia. Her older daughter who is eight years old goes to a local secondary school while the younger one is in kindergarten. 

Altangerel manages a meat trading business at a rented stall at a local market. She started her business in 2008 and gained much experience. In addition she began conducting a used clothing trading business since February, 2011. She is doing her best to feed her children and to pay her children's education costs. 

She is planning to expand and continue her business, because her business earnings are the only source of income for her family. She is a polite woman who says, "I am trying hard to overcome obstacles encountered in my life." She is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to purchase more meat for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory.

loans.name: Eriolyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Eriolyn works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines and earns additional income from buying and selling chicken and hotdogs. Eriolyn is borrowing PHP 11,500 through NWTF to purchase additional materials for the maintenance and repair of her motorcycle for her motorcycle transport business.

Eriolyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to afford to send her child to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional materials to maintain and repair her motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling used clothing in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase additional used clothes to sell for her used clothing business.

Fe has been in this business for seven years. Fe earns more income from her general store.

Fe has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more used clothes to sell

loans.name: Efrenia

texts.en:
Efrenia is 37 years old and lives in Villa Sudiacal, Liloy. She is married with one child. 

To earn a living, Efrenia has a business selling snacks. She earns about PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work. Efrenia has requested a loan to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business.

Efrenia has been a member of PMPC for two years.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her snack-vending business.

location.town: Villa Sudiacal, Liloy, ZAmboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Martha Cecilia

texts.es: Martha es una mujer de 37 años de edad que vive con su conyuge y tiene 2 hijos en las edades de 12 y 19 años de edad, que estudian y son el motor que impulsan a Marta  en su desempeño diario, al ofrecer los servicios de alquiler de lavadoras y venta de mercanica variada mediante el sistema de crédito, a plazos pactados con sus clientes y con estos negocios obtiene ingresos para fortalecer el bienestar de su familia. Su primer negocio lo tuvo hace 11 años cuando con un capital de $ 200 COP, invirtiò en ropa interior y consiguiò clientes generando sus primeros ingresos; a esta actividad fuè agregando prendas de oro, luego calzado y bolsos, construyendo así una buena clientela, que ha ido creciendo con el transcurrir del tiempo. Hoy tambien tiene un negocio donde ofrece los servicios de alquiler de lavadoras, actividad con la que respondió a las amas de casa, que se insolaban al lavar la ropa  de su familiaa mano y bajo el candente sol de San Juan Nepomuceno, municipio en el que todos se conocen y donde la mayoria de sus pobladores tienen un parentesco entre si. Su credikiva es el segundo financiamiento que hace a la Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprarà una lavadora mas, pues desea responder oportunamente a su clientela, que en la semana no alcanza a realizar el oficio porque todas las maquinas se encuentran en uso. Asi mismo invertirá en mercanica variada como bolsos y calzado que rotaràn muy rápido porque está haciendo su compra sobre pedidos de sus clientes. Su sueño mas adelante es tener un punto comercial donde pueda exhibir ordenadamente sus productos y donde tenga opciones de ventas de contado, con mercancias de salida rápida. Marta es una mujer de muchos sueños, que con su trabajo ha logrado apoyar a sus hijos en el estudio y que muy seguramente seguirà esforzandose en alcanzar una rentabilidad  mayor al 11% que es con la que actualmente trabaja.
texts.en:
Martha is a 37 year old woman who lives with her husband and their two children, ages 12 and 19.  The children go to school, and they are the driving force for Martha’s daily efforts.  She rents washers, and she sells varied merchandise via the credit system and installments that her customers have agreed upon.  

She gets income from these businesses that strengthens the well-being of her family.  She has had her first business for 11 years.  She invested $200 COP in underwear, and she got customers and generated her first earnings.  She was adding gold jewelry to her business, and later she added footwear and purses.  That way she was building a good customer base, which 
has been growing over time.

Now she also has a business where she overs rents washing machines.  Housewives, who have been exposed to the sun when hand washing the families’ clothes under San Juan Nepomuceno’s burning sun, have responded to this business.  San Juan Nepomuceno is a municipality where everyone knows each other and where its people live among their relatives.

Her Kiva loan is the second loan she has had with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use the loan to buy another washer as she wants to respond to her customers in a timely way.  During the week some cannot wash their clothes because all of the machines have been in use.  She will also use the loan to buy varied merchandise like purses and footwear.  They turn around very rapidly because she makes her purchases by customers’ orders.

Her dream for later on is to have a commercial spot where she can display her products in an orderly way, and where she has the option of selling merchandise that turns around quickly for cash.  Martha is a woman with a lot of dreams.  She has managed to support her children’s education through her work.  She will very assuredly keep putting forth effort to reach a greater profitability than the current 11%.

loans.use: to buy a washer and merchandise like sandals and purses to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair her old house.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is married and is 48 years old. She has a retail shop business. She sells groceries such as biscuits, canned goods, instant cups of noodles, soft drinks, sugar, milk, coffee, shampoo, detergents and other goods needed. According to her, the grocery store she manages is improving. She would like to expand it more to sustain further the needs of her family. Alicia has had this business for five years.

Alicia is requesting a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase groceries such as canned goods, noodles, soft drinks, etc. Each month, Alicia earns about PHP 50,000 doing this type of work. In the future, Alicia hopes to expand her grocery store so that it will become more comfortable for her customers. Alicia prays that her request for a loan will be granted to make her dreams possible.

loans.use: to purchase groceries such as canned goods, noodles, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: 53.thieu Trung. Thieu Hoa Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thuong works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattL.. She is requesting a loan to invest in her business.

Thuong is 47 years old and she is married with two children. Thuong is the group leader of the 53. Thieu Trung solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with her two dependents.

In 2004, Thuong joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Thuong has successfully repaid eight loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Thuong has been involved in this business for eight years. The main hardship that Thuong faces in her business is lack of capital.

With her business profit, Thuong hopes to maintain  a successful business and to improve the quality of her family's life.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and seedlings for farming.

loans.name: Sem

texts.en: Sem, age 29, has been working in the crop-planting business in Prey Chor district for many years. She owns a plot of farmland that her parents provided to her. In order to make additional income, she also breeds a few piglets in a cage behind her house. From this, she can make an average of US$2.50 per day to cover her family's financial expenses. For additional income, her husband has been employed as a domestic construction worker and earns a profit of about US$5 per day. Sem will use this loan to buy additional small pigs for feeding. With the rest of the loan, she will mend her old house. The photo shows Sem with her youngest child in front of her house.

loans.use: to buy additional small pigs for feeding as well as mending her old house.

loans.name: Ritchelda

texts.en:
Ritchelda is married with four children. She is 50 years old and lives in ZNAC, Tampilisan. 

To earn a living, Richelda has a snack vending business. She has had this business for 16 years. Each month, she earns approximately PHP 5000. 

Ritchelda has been a member of PMPC for two years.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business.

loans.name: 52.thieu Long. Thieu Hoa Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chung works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to invest in her business.

Chung is 41 years old and she is married with two children. Chung is the group leader of the 52. Thieu Long solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with her two dependents.

In 2005, Chung joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Chung has successfully repaid seven loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Chung has been involved in this business for more than 10 years, but the lack of capital is still the main hardship that Chung faces in her business.

With her business profit, Chung hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids and to extend her business.

loans.use: To purchase breeding animals and cattle-feed.

loans.name: Shahida's Group

texts.en:
Shahida is married. She is a caring lady, who carries out the responsibilities of a housewife very well and also supports her husband in his animal sales business. She takes care of his animals by providing them in a timely manner with food and water.  

Her husband has been in the animal sales business for the past 15 years. He buys animals from the animal market and sells to customers after raising them. Most of his customers are butchers who approach him first for his good knowledge about animal breeds and secondly for his good & healthy animals. 

Shahida has applied loan for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husband’s business. With the loan, he will purchase some goats and sheep for later resale. He will also buy some feed and animal medicines for taking care of his animals. 

Shahida is confident that an investment will bring positive changes to her husband’s business and increase their household income. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Shahida.

loans.use: To purchase goats & sheep, medicines & feed.

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.en:
Leonarda is a 51-year-old married woman living in Pinopoc, Alcala, Cagayan. Leonarda has three children. Leonarda's spouse works as a carpenter in their place of residence.

She has been in the business of hog raising for over a year. She plans to use this loan to purchase feed for sustainability and buy vitamins and medicines to ensure good nutrition.

In the future, Leonarda would like to enhance her hog-selling business in order to generate more income and provide a successful living for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed for sustainability and buy vitamins and medicines to ensure good nutrition.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
As a married parent of 5 children, Maribel works hard to support her family. She has a business buying and selling mud crabs in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from shrimp and fish sales. Maribel is borrowing PHP 26,000 through NWTF to purchase additional mud crabs to sell.

Maribel has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional mud crabs to sell

loans.name: 2.6.51Thieu Nguyen.thieu Hoa Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Phuong works in agriculture farming food. She is requesting a loan to invest in her business. Phuong is 22 years old and she is married and has 1 child.

Phuong is the group leader of the 51 Thieu N. solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with 1 dependent.

In 2008, Phuong joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Phuong has successfully repaid 1 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Phuong has been involved in this business for 3 years. The main hardship that Phuong faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Phuong hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, and to remodel her house.

loans.use: to purchase cattle-feet.

loans.name: Gaudiosa

texts.en: Gaudiosa is 49 years old and married with 3 children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Gaudiosa is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins. Gaudiosa has been raising pigs for 4 years and also earns additional income from dried fish sales. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase feed and vitamins

loans.name: 50.thieu Nguyen. Thieu Hoa Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Dam works in agriculture farming food. She is requesting a loan to invest in her business.

Dam is 66 years old and she is married. She has 4 children. Dam is the group leader of the 50. Thieu N. solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents.

In 2003, Dam joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Dam has successfully repaid a loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Dam has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. She needs more capital to improve her business.

With her business profit, Dam hopes to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: To purchase breeding animal and fertilizer.

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en: Mrs. Thuy is a humble villager who lives in the province of Kompong Cham. She is employed as a sewing worker in the local garment industry, earning a monthly salary.  She presently lives with her old father, who is a rice cultivator. Mrs. Thuy is a good mother to her two children, who are enrolled in the local school. Mrs. Thuy would like to request a loan to buy planks to repair her broken walls and a new bicycle for her children to ride to school.

loans.use: to buy planks to repair her broken walls and a new bicycle for her children to ride to school.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is married. She is 53 years old. She sells a variety of fruits and vegetables in their community. Yolanda has had this business for 10 years now.

Yolanda is requesting a loan of PHP6,000 as additional capital in selling. She will buy a larger volume of fruits and vegetables to sell around their village. Yolanda earns PHP500 each day doing this type of work.

In the future, Yolanda hopes that her business can expand to be able to sufficiently support the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy a larger volume of fruits and vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Mariam's Group

texts.en:
Mariam is a housewife and does her household responsibilities by staying at home. She is very active and performs her daily tasks with a great sense of responsibility. She has given birth to a son and a daughter. Both of them are not of school-going age yet. Her husband has two businesses. He is a rickshaw driver as well as a fruit seller. He works very hard to fulfill the basic needs of his family. In the morning, he goes to the fruit market to sell his fruits and later he provides the transport services to the passengers. His rickshaw has grown rough and needs repair work, which is why Mariam has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to help her husband repair his business asset. With the loan, he will repair his rickshaw, allowing him to run it more smoothly and provide better transport services to the passengers. He has been operating his transport business for many years and Mariam is confident that an investment will bring positive changes to his business and increase his profits. She is a new loan user and this is her first loan application to Asasah. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Mariam.

loans.use: To repair a rickshaw

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred is 40 years old. She is married and has three adult children. Mildred has a pig to raise and sell, when it fully grows. She has been doing this type of business for five years. She is patiently doing this business for the welfare of her family. 

Mildred is requesting a loan of PHP7,000 to buy feed and vitamins for the pigs. In the future, Mildred hopes that her business can expand to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for the pigs.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 35 years old and lives in San Francisco, liloy. She is married and has 4 children. Lorna has a transportation business and earns approximately PHP 5000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to purchase a transport vehicle, such as a motorcycle. 

Lorna has been a member of PMPC for 2 years.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for her vehicle transportation business.

location.town: San Francisco, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is asking for a loan amount of PHP9,000 to buy piglets to raise and sell after a few months. Angelina uses her business income to provide for most of her family's basic needs. In the future, Angelina hopes that her business will become successful for her family.

Angelina is 50 years old, married and has four adult children. Her husband works as a farmer in their community.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is married and 33 years old. She has 2 school aged children. She has a retail shop where she sell a variety of products that she can offer to the people in her community.

Irene is requesting a loan of PHP11,000 to buy more products as inventory like coffee, creamer, detergents, etc. Each month, Irene earns about PHP300 per day doing this type of work.

In the future, Irene hopes that her business will improve more so that she can sustain the need of her family.

loans.use: to buy more products as inventory like coffee, creamer, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen is a seamstress by profession. She operates her sewing business at her home.  She sews clothes for her neighboring clients. She is very skillful and receives regular orders every month. Besides her sewing work, she also manages her household responsibilities very efficiently. She is married with three children. All of them are enrolled in a local school and getting their education. Her husband is a rickshaw driver and provides transport services to the passengers. 
 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who will use the loan to repair his rickshaw. His engine is creating problems and needs repair work. Otherwise, it will be seized. He has been providing transport services to his passengers for over many years and Nasreen is confident that after repairing his rickshaw, he will be able to provide better transport services to his passengers and will make a positive impact on his business.

loans.use: To repair a rickshaw

loans.name: Saturnino

texts.en: Saturnino, 56 years of age, is married to a vegetable vendor. They were blessed with 4 children. Saturnino has been growing corn for almost 35 years. With his last crop, his net income was 25,000 PHP. He's asking a loan for 30,000 PHP to purchase seedlings and fertilizers for his corn farm. He hopes that lenders will continue assisting him in the business so that he can further improve it and support his family with enough basic necessities.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and fertilizers.

loans.name: Nomelia

texts.en:
Nomelia is married and is 45 years old. She has one adult aged child. She has a retail shop where she sells a variety of daily-use products. Nomelia had this business for five years.

Nomelia is requesting a loan of PHP4,000 to buy products like detergent soap, canned goods and spices that she can sell in their local community. In the future, Nomelia hopes that her business can grow to maintain the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy products like detergent soap, canned goods and spices.

loans.name: Hut

texts.en: Mr. Hut, 25, is a married man who earns a living by fishing in the river with different kinds of equipment. He lives in the province of Siem Reap. Mr. Hut often sells his fresh fish in bulk to his customers who are retailers in the market. Mr. Hut’s wife is a fish breeder and they currently live with her elderly mother. Mr. Hut will use his loan to purchase additional fishing equipment for his business and to buy some fish for feeding.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment for his business and to buy some fish for feeding

loans.name: Vuffie

texts.en:
Vuffie is 35 years old. She is a married woman with 3 children. The oldest child is 14 years old. Her husband works as a farmer. 

Vuffie is also a farmer. She helps her husband till their land in Surallah, South Cotabato. They grow rice crops to sell. Vuffie also manages a sari-sari store where she sells items like noodles and canned goods.

This loan will be used to purchase fertilizer, seeds, and to pay allowance for schooling. In the future, she hopes to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, seeds, and allowance for schooling.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is a married woman with one child. Her husband drives a motorcycle transport, as another source of income for their family. Rowena is 23 years old, a young mother of Cabiruan Gonzaga, Cagayan. She sells retail products through her general store. In the business, she earns PHP2,000 net income weekly. 

She is requesting a loan amount of PHP6,000 as additional capital to buy for stock of merchandise for sale such coffee, sugar, etc. Her store has been operating for two years already. She hopes to grow this business for the future of her child.

loans.use: to buy stock of merchandise for sale such as coffee, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Carlita

texts.en: Carlita, 53 years old, is a teacher. She is married to a farmer. They have been blessed with 2 children. She's into the livestock business, particularly hog-raising. She's been in this business for almost 5 years. Her net income for 3 months is 3,000 PHP per hog. She's asking a loan amounting to 35,000 PHP to purchase some hogs to raise. She would like to continue availing loans from Kiva lenders. She hopes that they will extend their assistance to her in the future.

loans.use: to purchase some hogs to raise.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn, 44 years old, is a married woman from the town of Sto. Nino South Cotabato. She has 4 children. Her eldest child is 19 years old while her youngest child is 13. She is a rice farmer and has been doing this business for 6 years now.

Her average income for the businesses is PHP 10,000 per month. Analyn needs a loan to support her livelihood. The loan will help her buy fertilizers and rice seed.

In the future, Analyn hopes to send her children to college. She believes also that, through God’s provision, she will be able to raise her family well.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Battsetseg

texts.en:
Mrs. Battsetseg is a 42 year old divorcee and she lives with her 2 children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her eldest daughter has just graduated from secondary school and is currently taking exams towards University. Her son studies at the local secondary school. They live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent in ger district. Two years ago her husband left the family. 

Battsetseg has been running a taxi business since 2002, using her family car. Last year she bought a mini truck and she is currently leasing it monthly to someone else for small amount of money. It gives her a chance to earn some extra income. She owns a small land plot in ger district and now she is planning to build a small family house on it.

The loan that Battsetseg is taking will be used to buy necessary building materials like cement, sand, wood planks and beams and to build the basement and the main structure of the house.

loans.use: to buy a necessary building materials like cement, sand, wood planks and beams and to build the basement and the main structure of the house.

loans.name: Sundas' Group

texts.en:
Sundas is 24 years old and married with a nine-month old son. She gives him her full attention and takes care of him. She is a housewife who prefers to stay at home and do her household responsibilities.  

Her husband is an electrician by profession and provides electricity and electrical tool repairing services to his clients. Being an electrician, he needs to deal with electric current all the time but he is very much an expert and has a lot of experience in his profession. 

Sundas has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the betterment of her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy electricity repairing tools and a drill that will allow him to perform his work better and provide better repair services to his clients. He has been operating this business for the past 20 years and Sundas is very hopeful that an investment will bring better profits to her husband by improving his business.

loans.use: To buy electrical repair tools and a drilling machine

loans.name: Belina

texts.en:
Belina is a widow from the town of Sto. Nino South Cotabato. She has nine children. Her youngest child is 26 years old. She is a rice farmer and has been doing this business for 30 years now.

Her average income for her businesses is PHP 12,000 per month. Belina needs support to sustain her livelihood. The loan will help her to buy farm supplies such as fertilizers and seeds.

In the future, Belina hopes to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies such as fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Chann

texts.en: Mr. Chann is a 33-year-old married father living in the province of Siem Reap. He owns a medium sized shop next to his house in the village where he provides boat repair services to the villagers. He started his business in early 2008, and the daily income he earns mainly serves to meet his family’s expenses. Mr. Chann is also a fisherman. His wife manages the household work and plants a few vegetables to generate some income. Mr. Chann has recently been catching fewer fish than before because his equipment often breaks down. Therefore, he would like a loan to buy additional fishing tools for his fishing business.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing equipment

loans.name: Mirgul's Group

texts.en:
Mirgul is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Tokmok, a small town near to Bishkek (the capital of Kyrgyzstan). She is 33 and married to soldier.  Together with her husband she brings up two children, both of whom study at school. In order to earn additional money to meet their daily needs, the family eight years ago with an initial investment of 5000 soms rented a canteen and started to sell food.  At the moment the family’s monthly profit from this business is 15000 soms. Mirgul applied for the loan because she needs additional money to purchase foodstuffs and various products for preparing food in the canteen.  In the future with money gained from the business Mirgul wants to purchase a vehicle for the family.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase foodstuffs and various products for preparing food

loans.name: Bayarsaikhan

texts.en: Bayarsaikhan is a 52 year old retiree who he lives with his wife and 5 children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.  He owns a small  plot of and the family house on it.  His 5 children are between 19 and 28 years of age, but none of them have married yet and currently his family live quite crowded all together. Bayarsaikhan is a former policeman who had worked as a policeman for 30 years. In 2009 he retired and bought a car with the lump sum which he received at retirement. Currently he is running a taxi business using his family car. Bayarsaikhan is planning to buy an another car and give it to his eldest son. He wants him to run a taxi business as well bringing extra income to the family. Bayarsaikhan has 1800 USDs in his savings and he needs another 2800 USDs to buy a good second hand car. The loan Bayarsaikhan is taking will be combined with his savings to buy the car.

loans.use: To pay for the car which he is buying. The car will be used by his eldest son as a taxi and bringing extra income to the family.

loans.name: Chamrouen

texts.en: Chamrouen, 59 years old, is a weaver. Her husband is a village leader.  Their income is $4.50 per day. They have one son who is 10 years old and studying at school. Every month Chamrouen has to spend $40 on food, $5 on electricity, $10 on school fees, $20 on transportation, and $20 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1200 to buy silk to weave and sell to get more income. She wants to extend her business to make more products and sell to other provinces.She  also wants to repair her house because now it is not in good condition. More than that, in the future, Chamrouen wants to send her child to study at the university.

loans.use: To buy more silk to weave

loans.name: Raeesa's Group

texts.en:
Raeesa is 26 years old, married with three children. Two of them are enrolled in a local school and getting their education. 

Her husband deals with construction supplies. He provides construction supplies such as cement, bricks and sands to his customers at reasonable rates and generates income for the family. 

Raeesa herself is a beautician as well as running a boutique business. She provides her services to her female  clients. She operates her businesses from her home and is known as an expert in her fields. Her clientele base is her community women. They prefer to approach her to buy dresses and for getting beauty services.  

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of both her businesses. With the loan, she will buy beauty products (creams, masks) and makeup items (lipsticks, mascara, eye shadow) etc. and clothes and thread to be able to provide better services to her clients and increase her profit. 

She is confident that her businesses will grow further after the loan investment.

loans.use: To buy beauty products, clothes & thread for beauty salon & boutique business.

loans.name: Nuon

texts.en:
The woman shown in the picture is Mrs. Nuon, 52 years old, who lives in Siem Reap Province. She owns a small store in the local market which is full of people, and she uses this store to sell porridge in the morning and afternoon.

She generates a profit approximately of $2 a day to help support her family's daily expenses with more stability. Her husband is the chief provider for the family, and he works as a motor taxi driver. 

This couple has six children, two of whom work in a hotel as internal staff. Mrs. Nuon will be using part of this requested money to purchase more necessary ingredients for making porridge to sell; the rest of the loan will be used to buy a new motor-trailer for her husband to use in his business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making porridge to sell and to buy a new motor-trailer for her husband's business

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia, de cincuenta y un años de edad, vive en casa propia junto a sus dos hijas mayores de edad y que la ayudan en el negocio que posee en su mismo lugar de residencia vendiendo refrescos, además de hacer tortillas que vende a la salida de un supermercado cercano a la periferia de su hogar, también hace reparto de las mismas a la hora del almuerzo a empleados de la zona comercial que rodean la colonia en la que vive. Ya son varios años  que Sonia lleva dedicada a ambas actividades y ha sido con esta fuerza laboral como ha sacado adelante a sus hijas. Todos los días muy temprano ella y sus hijas despiertan, Sonia hace las compras en el mercado cercano a la localidad comprando los materiales necesarios para hacer el refresco, sea de tamarindo, horchata, melón, cebada, entre otros, mientras tanto sus hijas quedan cociendo el maíz que luego llevan a moler para preparar las ricas tortillas. Ahora Sonia ha decidido comprar al por mayor el maíz y azúcar necesarios para preparar sus tortillas y refrescos respectivamente a fín de bajar el costo de sus materias primas y además poder hacer mayor cantidad de ambos productos que a la fecha ya no abastecen suficientemente a sus clientes que la prefieren por su higiene, responsabilidad y amabilidad. Son éstas razones por las que decidió solicitar a INTEGRAL crédito y confiada en que a través de ello obtendrá mayores ganancias y mejorará la calidad de vida de su familia.-
texts.en: Sonia, 51, lives in her own home with her two grown daughters.  They help Sonia with her business, which is located in the same place as her residence.  She sells drinks and she also makes tortillas that she sells outside of a supermarket that is close to her house.  She also delivers the tortillas at lunchtime to the employees who work in the commercial area that surrounds the neighborhood where she lives.  Sonia has had these businesses for a number of years, and it has been through this hard work that she has managed to provide for her daughters.  Every day Sonia and her daughters get up very early.  Sonia makes her purchases in the market close to her neighborhood, buying the supplies she needs to make the drinks, including ingredients for horchata (a drink made of rice, almonds and cinnamon), tamarind, melon, barley, and other items.  Meanwhile, her daughters stay in the kitchen cooking the corn that they will later take to grind to prepare the delicious tortillas.  Now Sonia has decided to buy the corn and sugar she needs to make her tortillas and drinks at wholesale.  This way she can lower the cost of her ingredients and also have a greater quantity of both products on hand, because at this point her she does not have enough of these products.  Sonia's customers prefer her business because of her hygiene, responsibility and friendliness.  For all of these reasons she has decided to request a loan from INTEGRAL; she is confident that through this loan she will be able to have greater earnings and  improve the quality of life of her family.

loans.use: to buy corn and sugar at wholesale.

loans.name: Sambo

texts.en: Sambo, 52 years old, is a farmer. Her husband is a goldsmith. Their income is $3 per day. They have 4 children, 28, 25, 20, and 18 years old. Three of their children are soldiers. Every month, Sambo has to spend $50 on food, $5 on electricity, $5 on, $20 on transportation, and $20 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $600 to buy a hand tractor for plowing the other farmer’s farmland to earn some more income. When she can save some money, she wants to build a place to feed the chickens at home. She also wants send her children to school to get a specific skill so that they able to support themselves.

loans.use: To buy a hand tractor

loans.name: Rouen

texts.en: Rouen, 56  years old is a vegetable seller.  She has three children and they are 23, 20, and 19 years old. All of them are working in a factory, They can earn $2 per day for each. Every month, Rouen has to spend $50 on food, $5 on electricity, $10 on rent house fee, $20 on transportation, $20 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1000 to buy a motorbike for her son to use to travel to work. When she can save some money from selling vegetables, Rouen wants to build a place to feed chickens at home and also to send her children to school to get a specific skill so that they will be able to support themselves.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her son to use to travel to work

loans.name: Sokorn

texts.en:
Sokorn, 32 years old, is a garment factory worker. Her husband sells ice-cream. Their income is $8 per day. They have a 6 year old child who goes to school. Every month, Sokorn has to spend $50 on food, $5 on electricity, $5 on school fees, $20 on transportation, and $20 on other expenses. 

Sokorn would like to request a loan of $1000 to purchase some female pigs to sell. Her income is a bit small and she needs to get more money to support the family. The increased income is important, especially for her child to school. She needs to get another career to help her family. She wants to feed more pigs in the future to make more profit.

loans.use: to buy pigs to feed at home.

loans.name: Tolokan's Group

texts.en:
Tolokan is the leader of this group. She is 45 and married to a truck driver, whose monthly salary is 3500 soms. Together with her husband she has raised a son and a daughter. The son, 23, works in construction and the daughter, 12, studies at school. 

Tolokan works as a teacher in a kindergarten. In order to earn additional money to meet their needs, the family breeds livestock. They resell livestock at a higher price after fattening them. In this way, the family earns an additional 4100 soms per month. With money received from the loan, Tolokan wants to purchase three livestock animals for breeding and two carloads of hay to feed the livestock. In the future, Tolokan wants to see her son get wed and plans to start building a house in Bishkek.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). 

MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and hay to feed livestock.

loans.name: Ry's Group

texts.en:
This small loan group is made up of five borrowers, who are shown in the picture. The group leader, Mrs. Ry, is a 69-year-old widow who owns a small shop in front of her house where she sells soft drinks and Khmer noodles. She typically makes around $4 of profit each day to ensure that her family has a comfortable life. Mrs. Ry has two children; one is still studying in school and one sells Khmer noodles. Because their house has become old and broken, Mrs. Ry would like a loan in order to repair her house.

The other four borrowers are:
Mrs. Sok, who is asking for a loan to buy some poles to repair her house.
Mrs. Lang, a fisherman, who is requesting a Kiva loan to purchase fishing tools. 
Mrs. Sourn, a boat deliverer, who is applying for a loan to repair her old boat.
Mrs. Vuth, who is seeking a loan to purchase more merchandise for selling.

loans.use: to repair her house.

loans.name: Nuch

texts.en:
Nuch, 57 years old, is a farmer with her husband. Their income is $3 per day. They have 4 children and all of them are working in the factory. 

Every month, Nuch has to spend around $75 for every expense in the family. She would like to request a loan of $1000 to buy a Tok Tok (a motorbike with a cart attached). This will allow her son to earn money because his work earns a very small income. When she can save some money, she wants to get a place to feed the chickens at home. She would also like to send her children to school to get a specific skill with which they are able to support themselves.

loans.use: to buy a Tok Tok (a motorbike with a cart attached).

loans.name: Bonifacio

texts.en:
Bonifacio has spent his entire life being a farmer. He grew up in a small village in Sto. Nino South Cotabato. Now, he is 50 years old and married. His wife is also a farmer. He has three children. The eldest child is 25 years old while the youngest child is 21. He has been doing this business for 5 years now.

Aside from farming rice, he also raises swine to supplement the family income. His average income for his businesses is PHP 10,000 per month.

Bonifacio needs a loan to support his livelihood. The loan will help him buy fertilizers and pig feed. In the future, Bonifacio hopes to own a bigger farm.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pig feed.

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en: Sopheap, 36 years old, is working in the factory with his wife. Their income is $7 per day. They have one child and he is studying. Every month, Sopheap has to spend around $75 year old for the family expenses. He would like to request a loan of $1000 to buy a motorbike for traveling to work. He plans to get a small place for his wife to sell groceries at home, instead of working in the factory, so that she can take care the children.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for traveling to work

loans.name: Jameelan's Group

texts.en:
Jameelan is married and has no children. To pass her time and to help her husband financially, she operates a sewing business. She learned this skill from her mother in her teenage years and now she is good at it. She receives orders from her community clients and earns well after completing the orders on time. She also knows how to do embroidery but doesn’t do it on a regular basis. 

Her husband has a business doing floor polishing. He has a polishing machine and he uses it to polish floors. He is very good at his work and provides services to his customers for a reasonable fee. 

Jameelan has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to buy a new sewing machine which will help her finish orders on time. Her current machine has become old and takes much time to sew a single dress. 

She has been operating her business for the past six years and is very hopeful that the investment will help her in making her business more profitable. She is a new loan applicant of Asasah.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine for sewing business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 3 children. 

Elizabeth has a retail shop where she sells candies, biscuits & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Elizabeth is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Elizabeth hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Chanthorn

texts.en:
Chanthorn, 39 years old, works in the factory. Her husband is motorbike repairer. Their income is $14 per day. They have 3 children: 16, 12, and 8 years old, all studying. 

Every month Chanthorn has to spend around $70 on family expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1100 to buy a motorbike for traveling to work. She wants to get a place for her husband to run his career more easily and to able to get an increased income. For her children, she will be trying hard to send them to study until they finish university.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for his wife to travel to work.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is 25 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 2 children. 

Remedios has a retail shop that sells slippers, plasticware & clothing. She has had this business for 2 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy additional stock of slippers & t-shirts.

Remedios is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Remedios hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of slippers & t-shirts.

loans.name: Sen

texts.en: Mrs. Sen is a 30-year-old farmer residing in the rural area of Siem Reap Province. Since 1998, she has been planting rice crops, which are her annual business. Her husband works in construction. The family generates an income of about $7 each day. Mrs. Sen is looking for a loan to help her husband's business by purchasing some essential construction materials. The couple has two single children who still live under their income.

loans.use: to purchase some essential construction materials for her husband's business.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a 63-year-old married woman. She lives in the community of Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. Her husband is a farmer in their community. She and her husband till their small rice farm to be able to raise their family.

With the loan coming from Community Economic Ventures Inc., she can buy fertilizers, seeds and insecticides. In the future, Erlinda hopes to have a bigger farm and more profit for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds and insecticides.

loans.name: Benjamen

texts.en:
Benjamen is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines.   He is married and has 9 children. 

Benjamen has a retail shop that sells snacks, beverages & canned goods. He  had this business for 4 years. He has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy snacks, beverages & canned goods.

Benjamen is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Benjamen hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy snacks, beverages & canned goods.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 6 children. 

Analiza has a retail shop that sells snacks, canned goods & beverages. She has had this business for 3 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy snacks, beverages & canned goods.

Analiza is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Analiza hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks, beverages & canned goods.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is 19 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married. 

Pamela has a retail shop where she sells snacks, canned goods & beverages. She has had this business for 1 year. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy snack, beverages & canned goods.

Pamela is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Pamela hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks, beverages & canned goods.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 4 children. 

Rebecca has a retail shop that sells fish, like sardines & milk fish. She has had this business for 2 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy additional fish.

Rebecca is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Rebecca hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fish.

loans.name: Venera's Group

texts.en:
Venera is the leader of this group. She is 32 and married to an electrician, whose monthly salary is 10000 soms. Together with her husband she brings up a daughter and two sons. The daughter and the first son study at school and the second son is preschool age (under seven). 

In order to earn additional money to meet the family's needs, Venera breeds livestock. She started this activity sixteen years ago when she got livestock inherited from her parents. She applied for the loan because she needs money to increase the number of livestock. With money received from the loan she wants to purchase two livestock animals for breeding. In the future, Venera wishes to start building a new house.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Marlon

texts.en:
Marlon is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. 

Marlon has a retail shop that sells snacks, beverages & canned goods. She has had this business for 2 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy snacks, canned goods & beverages.

Marlon is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Marlon hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks, canned goods & beverages.

loans.name: Azucena

texts.en:
Azucena is 57 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 9 children. 

Azucena is a tailor. She sews office & school uniforms. She has had this business for 20 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy materials needed for sewing.

Azucena is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Azucena hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for sewing.

loans.name: Lubna's Group

texts.en:
Lubna is a caring lady, staying at home and carrying out her responsibilities as a housewife very well. Her husband operates a dry cleaner shop. In his shop, he provides cleaning and clothes pressing services to his customers at reasonable rates. He is very good at his services and deals with his customers very well. 

Lubna is a mother of three sons. All of them are very young and have not started their education yet. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who will buy an iron, hangers and plastic covers (for packing clothes) with the loan money. This will help him provide better quality services to his customers and increase his profits. 

Lubna is a new loan user and this is her 1st loan application to Asasah. She is hopeful that the loan investment will enable her husband to improve the financial condition of his business. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Lubna.

loans.use: To buy an iron, hangers and plastic covers.

loans.name: Esmaelita

texts.en:
Esmaelita is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 

Esmaelita has a retail shop that sells snacks, canned goods & beverages, She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy snacks, beverages & canned goods.

Esmaelita is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Esmaelita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks, beverages & canned goods.

loans.name: Mervat

texts.en:
Mervat, who is photographed in FATEN's branch, is a 39-year-old woman from Zbabdeh village near Jenin city. Mervat has three daughters and three sons. Mervat's house needs urgent painting as the walls are in very bad shape. Besides that, the garden needs a fence around it and a front gate as it is the only place where her children can play during the day.

Mervat's husband is an employee and can't afford to cover these expenses at one time, therefore she took out a loan from FATEN to pay for the painting and other expenses.

loans.use: to improve her house: paint the walls and install a fence around the garden and a front gate.

loans.name: Baktygul's Group

texts.en:
Baktygul, 56, is a member of this group. She is the resident of Bokonbaevo, a nice village in the Isykul region. She has a husband who is a pensioner. Together they bring up a sixteen year old son who studies at school. 

Baktygul works as a cleaner. Her monthly salary is 2500 soms. Three years ago her son suggested that she apply for a loan to purchase livestock. She got a loan in the amount of 10000 soms and used that money efficiently. She repaid the loan successfully and now she hopes to get another loan. The purpose of the loan is to purchase four livestock animals for breeding. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). 

MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Jackilyn

texts.en:
Jackilyn is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 3 children. 

Jackilyn has a food shop that sells chicken & pork barbecue. She has had this business for 3 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients needed for making barbecued food to sell.

Jackilyn is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Jackilyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making barbecue.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a 55-year-old married woman. She lives in the community of Sto. Nino South Cotabato. Her husband is a farmer in their community.  She and her husband till their small rice farm in order to be earn money to support their family. The average income from her business is PHP 20,000, per harvest. Evelyn also raises pigs to fatten and sell.

With the loan coming from Community Economic Ventures Inc. she can buy fertilizers, seeds and insecticides.

In the future, Evelyn  hopes to have a bigger farm and more profit for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds and insecticides.

loans.name: Lenie

texts.en:
Lenie is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 4 children. 

Lenie  has a retail shop, from which sells dried fish, snacks & canned goods. She has had this business for 2 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy snacks, beverages & canned goods.

Lenie  is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Lenie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks, beverages & canned goods.

loans.name: Rosense

texts.en:
Rosense is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 3 children. 

Rosense has a retail shop that sells biscuits, breads & canned goods. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy snacks, canned goods, & beverages.

Rosense is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Rosense hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks, canned goods, & beverages.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en:
Felicitas, 56 years old, is already a widow. She has five children. She has been into rice farming business for 25 years.

Aside from rice farming, she has also ventured into hog raising. She earns enough income by selling pigs. Her average income from farming and raising hogs is 15000 PHP per month.

Felicitas lives in the community of Sto. Nino South Cotabato. She needs a loan to purchase seeds and fertilizers. In the future, she hopes to own a bigger farm.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 44 years old. She is a married woman with four children. The oldest child is 21.

Gemma’s husband works as a farmer. Gemma is also a farmer, working in Sto. Nino South Cotabato. She has been growing rice for 8 years. Gemma earns PHP 11,000 per month doing this farming. 

This loan will be used to purchase seeds and fertilizers. In the future, Gemma hopes to own a bigger farm.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 2 children. 

Teresita has a retail shop that sells chicken & pork barbecue. She has had this business for 3 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients needed for barbecued meats.

Teresita is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for barbecued meat.

loans.name: Higinia

texts.en: Higinia is a married woman with four children, the oldest 25 years old. Both Higinia and her husband work as farmers in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. Higinia has been growing rice for 20 years, earning PHP 15,000 per month. This loan will be used to purchase seeds and fertilizers. In the future, Higinia  hopes to own a bigger farm and have a better income.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en: Lucia is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. Lucia has operated a retail shop selling snacks, beverages and canned goods for 2 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more of these items. Lucia is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Lucia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en: Gemma is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. Gemma has operated a tailoring business for 3 years, sewing office and school uniforms. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy materials needed for her tailoring shop. Gemma is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Gemma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her tailoring shop

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. Grace has operated a food shop selling chicken and pork barbecue for 2 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients for barbecuing. Grace is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Grace hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for barbecuing

loans.name: Maha

texts.en:
Maha is a 34-year-old hard-working housewife who has five children to raise with her husband Maher.

The two of them decided four years ago to start a small business together and help each other to succeed, so they started selling cleaning products at home which opened a door during these four years to having a cleaning products refill business.

Now Maha is applying for this loan so they can buy more bottles and safe equipment to use when refilling and selling, so they can grow their business and expand. 

Since Maha is a conservative person, she asked that her husband could appear in the picture instead of her.

loans.use: To buy more bottles and safe equipment to use while refilling cleaning products.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 57-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and four children; two of them are still attending school. He has been involved in the agricultural field for the past 25 years. Then, he decided to proceed with his work independently; so he bought a plot of land and executed his own farming work. 

His farm produces all types of vegetables which are all sold to local markets. Because of his older age, he hired a part-timer to help him with the farming work. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase fertilizers and seeds. He notes that these purchases will allow him to better grow his products and will increase his business productivity. In the future, he is planning to further expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Po

texts.en: Po, 57 years old, is a farmer. Her husband is a priest and their income is $7 per day. They have one child and he is working right now. Every month, Po spends around $40 on the family's expenses. She would like to request a loan of $700 to buy a motorbike for her son to travel to work. She wants her son to sell groceries instead of work when he is married. If Po could save some money, she will repair her house for her son in the future, because she has only this one son.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her son to travel to work

loans.name: Arnold

texts.en:
This is Arnold, 30 years old and a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. He is married to Marcialuz, a housewife and mother to their three children. The family manages their own household while operating the business. Arnold is working hard to continually provide income for the family's everyday expenses and his children’s schooling. Arnold believes, like most poor Filipino parents, that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents could leave to their children, as he himself has been an undergraduate.

Arnold operates a variety store, which, in the Philippines, is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, PHP 5 worth of cooking oil or an egg. Arnold earns an income by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. His store is located adjacent to his house and his regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of PHP 800 in daily sales.

To help him continue operations of his business, Arnold is requesting a PHP8,000 loan. He will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand his product inventory. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business. 

Arnold hopes to be able to expand soon, just as he fervently hopes that his children will be able to graduate one day and finish their studies. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery products and inventory items

loans.name: Ulfat's Group

texts.en:
Ulfat is 45 years old and married with six children. All of them are getting their education from a local school. Her two elder sons operate a hosiery business along with their education to be able to afford their education fee. 

Ulfat also makes shirt collars to order and earns a reasonable amount of income from her business. The earned income helps her pay utility bills. Besides her business, she carries out her responsibilities as a housewife very well. 

Her husband operates a sanitary supplies business. He also offers his customers sanitary fitting services as well. He makes deals with different people who are looking for sanitary work for their homes. 

Ulfat has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the betterment of her collar-making business. With the loan, she will buy cloth and thread for making collars in larger quantity to be able to fill orders on time and earn more profit. She has been operating her business for the past three years and hopes it will improve further after the loan investment. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Ulfat.

loans.use: To buy cloth & thread for shirt-collar-making business.

loans.name: Sreymom

texts.en: Sreymom, 39 years old, is a farmer. She is a single mother with 2 children; one is studying and one works in a factory. There are 5 members in her family, and Sreymom spends around $45 every month on their expenses. She would like to request a loan of $800 to buy a motorbike for her daughter to travel to work. She wants her daughter to sell groceries instead of work to help take care of her little grandson and the home. Sreymom has a strong commitment to send her last child to study until he finishes university even if she has to spend a lot of money.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her daughter to travel to work

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
This is Melinda, 47, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Rogelio, a mechanic, and they have one child. By the grace of God, Melinda has managed to support her child's schooling. She is working hard to continually provide income for the family's everyday expenses

Melinda oversees operations of the family's jeepney (see footnote) transportation business. They have a single unit (14-16 person capacity) jeepney. Melinda and her husband also manage their motor repair shop. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 2,500 every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Melinda is requesting a PHP 25,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy new accessories and parts for the jeepney and to buy some equipment for the repair shop. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her businesses.  

Melinda dreams of being able to buy another jeepney or to put up new repair shops in other places soon. She also dreams that her child will finish his/her education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members weekly to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

Footnote: Curiously, Jeepneys have purely American origins as they were first used by American soldiers to help the Philippines throw off the invading Japanese. Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn income and modified the Jeep into a 20-seater jeepney. It is open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy for every day travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain. Now, jeepneys are one of the items that makes the Philippines truly Philippines.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for accessories, parts and equipment

loans.name: Jacel

texts.en: Jacel is 22 years old and married. She has no children yet but she hopes to have one soon. Jacel and her husband are both farmers. They own the land that they till to grow rice crops. Jacel also raises pigs to fatten and sell. According to Jacel, her average income is 8,000 PHP per month. This loan will be used to purchase seeds, feed and fertilizers. In the future, Jacel hopes to own a bigger farm.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, feed and fertilizers

loans.name: Ikhtiyor

texts.ru: Ихтиёр житель Гиссарского района. Ему 21 год. Он женат. У него трое детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Он живет вместе с матерью. У него среднее образование. Ихтиёр уже год как занимается торговлей. Он имеет магазин, где продает продукты питания. Кредит берет для покупки молочных продуктов, колбасных изделий и приобретения холодильника.
texts.en: Ikhtiyor lives in Gissar. He is 21 years old, married, and has three children. His wife is a housewife. He lives with his mother. He has a secondary education. Ikhtiyor has been working in trade for a year. He has a shop where he sells groceries. He is taking out a loan to buy dairy products, sausage, and a refrigerator.

loans.use: to buy dairy products, sausage, and a refrigerator.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 52-year-old married man from Lebanon. He is living with his wife and four children; two of them are still attending school. He has 30 years of experience working as a farmer. He started running his own business in 1990.

 He cultivates all types of vegetables and fruit using large plastic tents to better monitor his products' growth. He sells his goods to multiple fruit and vegetable shops. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase fertilizers and seeds. In the future, he is planning to further expand his business operation. This will be his second Kiva loan.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en: Juanita is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married. Juanita has operated a shop selling fish such as sardines and milk fish for 5 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy additional fish. Juanita has been a member of HSPFI since 2007. In the future, Juanita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fish

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy milk and bread.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy paraffin, cooking fat and maize flour.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is 61 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 3 children. 

Angelina has a retail shop where she sells biscuits, snacks & canned goods. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 4,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & biscuits.

Angelina is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & biscuits.

loans.name: Kigasa Akimanyi Group

texts.en: Jane, 40 years old, is a buoyant, good-natured and affable lady. The mother of four, she operates a seven-year-old tailoring business in Kampala. Jane says that 7 years in this business have broadened her understanding of running a business, consolidating its gains, doing proper planning to ensure growth, and handling the many challenges which crop up in its operation. She sews and sells all types of clothes but has realised that school uniforms are always in high demand and she takes orders from many schools to make their school uniforms. With schools mushrooming around Kampala, Jane anticipates getting even more clients. Jane got her tailoring skills from an apprentice tailoring school. On the side, she runs a rental business. Monthly, this business generates profits totaling shillings 120,000. This loan she says is to help her purchase more and better clothing fabric to make more clothes to sell.

loans.use: To more and better clothing fabric for her tailoring business

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita, 56, is a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Domingo, a driver, and they have one child. By the grace of God, Mary Ann has managed to support her child's schooling. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for everyday expenses

Rosita oversees operations of their side-car transportation business. They have one side car or bicycle cart that carries up to two passengers. Rosita’s husband also drives the side car when he has free time. She also sells vegetables and rents a bed in her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 1000 every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a Php20,000 loan for the maintenance of her side car and also to buy new stocks of vegetables to sell, and for the renovation of her rental room. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.  

Rosita dreams to be able to buy another side car soon and for her house to be renovated. She also dreams that her child will finish education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and study the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and other maintenance costs

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 43 years old. She is a self-motivated, hardworking mother of two, ages 21 and 23 years. She has been running a general shop for the past three years. Previously, she operated a cyber café. To supplement her earnings, she does small-scale farming. She wants 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy maize flour, sugar and rice.

In the next five years, she wants to be a well-established business lady in line with her dream to become a major goods distributor. Through Faulu Kenya, she has learned business management skills and how to make wise investments.

loans.use: To buy maize flour, sugar and rice.

loans.name: Jinnilyn

texts.en:
Jinnilyn is 37 years old and is a married woman with four children. The oldest child is 12 years old while the youngest is 4. She lives in the town of Sto. Niño, South Cotabato, with her family. Jinnilyn and her husband are both farmers. They have been growing rice for eight years. 

This loan will be used to purchase seeds and fertilizers. In the future, Jinnylyn hopes to have her children finish college. She also hopes to have her own capital.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en: Lorena is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single with 1 child. Lorena has operated a shop selling home care products, pillow cases and fragrances for 5 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 12,000 to buy stock from Personal Care and Natasha. Lorena has been a member of HSPFI since 2006. In the future, Lorena hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock from Personal Care and Natasha

loans.name: Rukhsana's Group

texts.en:
Rukhsana is a housewife and does her household responsibilities by staying at home. Her husband is a vegetable seller. He operates his business in his community and offers fresh seasonal vegetables to his customers at reasonable rates. 

Rukhsana has given birth to six children. Her eldest daughter is illiterate while the other five are studying, attending a nearby school. Her elder daughter stays at home and helps Rukhsana manage the household work. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the improvement of her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy fresh seasonal vegetables in bulk to offer to his customers for sale. He has been operating his business for the past four years and Rukhsana hopes that it will improve further after the loan investment.  

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Rukhsana.

loans.use: To buy fresh seasonal vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Everlyne is 29 years old, hard working and self motivated. She is married and blessed with three children aged 7, 5 and 4 years old. Everlyne sells spare parts such as Helix and Orion, battery acid and brake fluid for motor vehicles. Prior to this, she had a retail shop.

Through Faulu Kenya, Everlyne has learned how to save and to manage her business. She wants a loan of 20,000 KES to buy engine oil, spare parts such as Helix and Orion, battery acid and brake fluid. Everlyne wants to be a well established businesswoman with several outlets in town in the next 5 years. Her dream is to be a major distributor of motor vehicle spare parts.

loans.use: To buy engine oil, spare parts such as Helix and Orion, battery acid and brake fluid

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 24 years old and single. He has been quarrying for three years and has no other source of income. He has employed two people to assist him in the business. Previously, he was employed in a transport van.
