Joseph is very thankful to Faulu Kenya because he has managed to grow his business. He hopes to become financially stable in the future. Joseph has requested a loan of 20,000 KES to buy working equipment and materials.

loans.use: To buy working equipment and materials.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
This is Corazon, 39, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Noel, a side car driver, and father to their children. By the grace of God, Corazon has managed to support her children's schooling. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for the family's everyday expenses.

Corazon oversees operations of the famly's side car transportation business. They have two units of side cars, or bicycle carts, that carry up to two passengers to their destination within the community. The passengers pay boundary (a daily quota) each day. Corazon also sells processed meat and chicken. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Corazon is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. She will use the loan for the maintenance of her side car and to buy new stocks of processed meat products to sell. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Corazon dreams of being able to buy another side car soon. She also dreams that her children will finish their education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts, maintenance and other items needed in her business

loans.name: Hazel

texts.en: Hazel is married with 1 child. She is 27 years old and lives in Osukan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. Hazel has operated a general store for 2 years, selling a variety of products. She earns PHP 6,000 monthly. Hazel has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to purchase more products to sell. Hazel has become a member of PMPC just this year.

loans.use: to purchase more products to sell

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 33 years old and a focused businessman. He is married and blessed with two children aged  13 and one year and six months.  He has been running a pub since 2002. He gets extra income from his rental houses. 
 
In the next five years, he wants to open up other branches in line with his dream to become a major beer distributor. Through Faulu Kenya, he has become well informed on how to manage his finances.

He wants 80,000 Kenyan shillings to start a butchery.

loans.use: To open up a butchery.

loans.name: Mary Rose

texts.en:
Mary Rose is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

Mary Rose has a food shop. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy raw ingredients for making bread & cookies.

Mary Rose is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Mary Rose hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making bread & cookies.

loans.name: Nazia's Group

texts.en:
Nazia is very supportive lady by nature. In order to financially assist her husband, she does embroidery and prepares embroidered dresses. She also performs her daily household work very efficiently and tries to give comfort to her family by fulfilling their needs. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who is a wagon driver and provides transport services to his passengers.  His wagon needs repair work to run smoothly. With the loan, he will repair its body so that the passengers feel comfortable to get service from him. 

He has been operating his transport business for the past eight years and Nazia is confident that an investment will help him save his business asset and improve his business conditions. She is the mother of six children. All of them are enrolled in a local school and getting their education. Nazia is hopeful that after the loan investment, her husband will be able to run his business better and increase his profit. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Nazia.

loans.use: To repair a wagon.

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
Ruby is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Ruby has a retail shop that sells fish like sardines & milk fish. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy fish to sell.

Ruby is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Ruby hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn, 40 years old, is a married woman from the town of Sto. Nino, South Cotabato. She has two children aged nine and three. She is a rice farmer and has been doing this business for 13 years now.

Jovelyn needs a loan to support her livelihood. The loan will help her buy fertilizers and rice seed.

In the future, Jovelyn hopes to send her children to college. She believes also that through God’s provision, she will be able to raise her family well.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and rice seed.

loans.name: Simeon

texts.en:
Simeon is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines.   He is married with seven children. 

Simeon has a food shop that sells breads and cookies.  He  had this business for 15 years.  He requested a loan 4,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy raw ingredients for homemade breads.

Simeon is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Simeon hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for homemade breads.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a car.

loans.name: Pruon

texts.en: Mrs. Pruon, 28 years old, is a chef in a rice shop in Siem Reap Province. She typically makes around $5 of profit each day to meet her family's needs. She is married to Mr. Chheim, 25, a motor taxi driver. They have been married for awhile but they have no children yet. Mrs. Pruon currently lives with her mother-in-law, who is a pig breeder. Mrs. Pruon will be using these funds to purchase some piglets.

loans.use: to purchase some piglets

loans.name: Hanifaan's Group

texts.en:
Hanifaan has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her business sewing clothes. She is a very hardworking lady and operates her business full-time. She receives orders from her neighbor clients and fulfills them on time to earn profits for her family. With the loan, she will buy a new sewing machine that will allow her to complete orders in less time and earn more profit. 

Hanifaan started this business after the death of her husband. She is the mother of seven children. Her eldest son works at a private mill for a low income. The second one has a construction supplies business, while the third one works in a factory. Her elder daughter is also a seamstress and supports her mother in her business. Hanifaan’s remaining children stay at home. She couldn’t educate them due to financial constraints.

Hanifaan is hopeful that by investing this loan in her business she will be able to improve its condition and increase her profits. She is a regular user of Asasah loans and this is her second loan application. In the previous loan year, she paid her installments on time and never missed a meeting. 

In the photo, the lady with a book (an Asasah passbook) is Hanifaan.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for a sewing business.

loans.name: Melisa

texts.en:
This is Melisa, 36, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Elvis, a contract worker, and is the mother of four children. By the grace of God, Juanita has managed to support her children's schooling — a dream for most poor Filipino parents like Juanita as she herself has been a college graduate and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents could leave to their children.

Melisa operates an LPG business. What she basically does is buy Liquefied Petroleum Gas tanks from wholesalers, and sells them per tank with a little profit. LPG tanks can range from small to regular size. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 2,000 Philippines pesos (Php) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php14,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more stocks of LPG tanks to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Melisa dreams to be able to give her all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She also hopes to have a store in the community market. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for new stockof LPG tanks and products for her business.

loans.name: Vengie

texts.en: Vengie is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. Vengie has a shop that sells charcoal, bananas, and coconuts. She has had this business for six years. She has requested a loan for PHP 4,000 to buy additional wood and coconut shells for charcoal making. Vengie has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Vengie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional woods and coconut shells for charcoal making

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en: Analiza is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. Analiza has a shop that sells biscuits, beverages, and canned goods. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages. Analiza has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Analiza hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en: Juvy is a married woman from the town of Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. She has three children. Her eldest child is 19 years old. She is a rice farmer and has had this business for 5 years. Her average income from her business is Php 12,000 per month. Juvy needs support to sustain her livelihood. The loan will help her buy farm supplies such as seeds and fertilizers. In the future, Juvy hopes to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies such as seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Analiz

texts.en: Analiz is 20 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single and has a shop that sells green bananas and coconuts for copras (the fried, white flesh of the coconut). She has had this business for a year. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy green bananas and coconuts to sell. Analiz has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Analiz hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy green bananas and coconuts to sell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 30-year-old single man from Lebanon. He lives on his own. He has been working in car electric repairs for the past 10 years. With this long experience, he has been able to gain a good number of clients asking for his repair services. In 2007, he opened his own car repair shop. With his requested loan of $1200 from Kiva's partner Ameen s.a.l., he will purchase new electric tools and supplies. He intends to reinforce his business operation and strengthen it. In the future, he is looking to diversify his business and open a new shop where he can buy and sell car spare parts.

loans.use: to purchase new electric tools and supplies.

loans.name: Dilshod

texts.ru: Дилшод проживает в Гиссарском районе. Ему 30 лет. Он Женат. У него двое детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам Дилшод имеет высшее образование, он экономист. По профессии он проработал один год. На сегодняшний день Дилшод занимается торговлей на рынке "Мубориз". Он арендует торговую точку, где продает детскую одежду. Он привозит товар с города Душанбе. В этой области он уже 10 лет. Кредит берет для приобретения сезонного товара.
texts.en: Dilshod lives in Gissar. He is 30 years old, married, and has two children. His wife is a housewife. Dilshod has a higher education; he is an economist. He worked in his profession for one year.  Now, Dilshod trades in Muboriz market.  He rents a shop where he sells children's clothes. He brings the goods in from Dushanbe. He has been doing this work for ten years. He is taking out a loan to buy seasonal goods.

loans.use: to buy seasonal goods.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en: Mila is 61 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 14 children. Mila has had a shop that sells sweet potatoes, bananas, and cassavas by the kilogram. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy bananas, cassavas, and sweet potatoes. Mila has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Mila hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy bananas, cassavas, and sweet potatoes

loans.name: Hamza

texts.en: Hamza (who appears in the picture) has a tailoring workshop. It is a small one that meets the demands of the village where he lives. Hamza hired a new employee as the demand is increasing, and he needs to purchase a sewing machine. Hamza took out a loan from FATEN to purchase the sewing machine and meet the demand. He makes children's clothes and distributes to stores of the village. He hopes to start working with the stores of the city of Jenin.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine for the new employee of a tailoring workshop.

loans.name: Douglas

texts.en:
Douglas is 34 years old and married to Regina, and they are blessed with two children of nine years and four years.  He has been operating his shoe business for the past seven years. 

He has been loaned KES 40,000 by KADET Ltd. This is his second loan from KADET. He intends to use his loan to purchase stock of shoes and also tailoring material for his second line of business.

He plans to use the profit from his businesses to buy pay school fees for his children and also improve the living standards for his family.

In the future, he hopes to open up a big shop.

loans.use: To add more stock of shoes.

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is 31 years old and industrious. He is a single man who operates a grocery shop. He also does a transporting business for additional income. Through Faulu Kenya, he has learned the art of keeping business records. This has helped him to run his business well.  In the next five years, he hopes to open a restaurant.  He has requested for 60,000 Kenyan shillings to buy potatoes.

loans.use: To buy potatoes for his grocery store.

loans.name: Som

texts.en: Mrs. Som lives in the province of Siem Reap. She is a foreman construction worker, earning a profit of around US $4 each day. She has a life partner in her husband who is a chief and a construction worker. This young couple works together in the same occupation. They always use their motorbike to go to their workplace and to ride anywhere in and around their village. Their motorbike has broken down and they often spend a lot of money to repair it. Therefore, Mrs. Som is seeking a loan of $700 to buy a new motorbike to replace the broken one so that they won’t have to pay for repairs any more.

loans.use: to buy a new motorbike to replace the broken one.

loans.name: Review Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard is 37 years old and has been running his animal sales business for the last 15 years with a monthly income of KES 10,000.

Servicing his fifth loan of KES 50,000 from KADET he plans to purchase dairy cows and other farm inputs for his farm. This will help him boost his earnings. The proceeds will be used in developing a plot for rental houses in his area.

His future plan is to get business prosperity and become a role model in his society.

loans.use: to buy livestock for resale.

loans.name: Jamleck

texts.en:
Jamleck is 45 years old, married to Alice, and he has been running his shoe making business for the past eight years. He earns a monthly income of about KES 20,000 .

He has been loaned KES 60,000 by KADET Ltd. This is his fourth loan from KADET. He intends to use the loan to purchase more stock like soles and new shoes.

He plans to use the anticipated profit to establish a new shoe making station.

In the future, he hopes to open up a shop where he will be making and selling wholesale.

loans.use: to use the loan to purchase more stock like soles and new shoes.
